loans.name: Jannat Khatoon M.ishaq Group

texts.en:
Jannat Khatoon baji is the wife of M. and lives in a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 16 years. She is the mother of seven children: six daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Jannat baji’s husband has a warm clothes sales business. He buys warm clothes from old markets at cheap rates and sells them in different areas of his city, earning a profit. Jannat baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more warm clothes to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy flour to re-sell. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy wooden beams for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy warm clothes to re-sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mr. Thon C. lives in Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. He is a petrol seller who buys from others gas stations. Mr. Thon is requesting a loan of $375 so he can purchase more petrol at one time, and increase his earnings. His wife, Mrs. Yoen Muntha, is a banana seller who buys from others people. Mr. Thon C. is 37years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase more petrol and increase earnings

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: V. Tamara is 54 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. She asks for a 2500 Somoni (750 USD) loan with the term of 9 months in order to buy more young cattle to sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Khlee

texts.en: Mr. Khlee L. was born in 1975 and lives in Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. He is farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. His plantation field would greatly benefit by having being abL. to irrigate, so Mr. Khlee L. has is requesting a loan to buy a pump and hoses to make his field more productive. His wife, Mrs. Tong Seng Long, is employed in a garment factory. Mr. Khlee L. is a father of four children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a pump and hoses to irrigate his field

loans.name: Zainab Group

texts.en:
Zainab baji is the wife of H. A. and lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 31 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son works in a factory; her second eldest works driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor transit vehicle;) and her youngest son is a mechanic. Her daughter is a student in 4th standard. Zainab baji’s husband sells warm clothing, and has two years experience in the clothing sales business. Zainab baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more warm clothes for her husband to resell.

This is a group loan, and Zainab baji is joined in her loan request by four other members: Sugran baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell; Nagina baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles and waste paper) to sell in their scrap business; and Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy flour to sell. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy warm clothing to resell.

loans.name: Srey Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Yem T. is a villager in Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. She is a tailor. She is requesting a loan so she can replace her old, wornout, sewing machine. This new equipment will enable her to accomplish more work in a shorter period of time and increase her earnings and living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Sim Sao, is a physician soldier. Mrs. Srey Yem is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailor business

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy T. was born in 1942 and lives in Kvav village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Moeng Lorn, are farmers who cultivate rice to earn for living. Their earnings barely support their needs and allow for no savings. Mrs. Thuy T. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This will increase income and improve her living condition.   Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a breeding cow

loans.name: Yasmeen Liaqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is the widow of L. A. and lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 16 years. She is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son is a transit driver and operates an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her other children are all enrolled in the local neighborhood school.

Yasmeen baji works selling thread. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She buys inexpensive sweaters and removes the thread from them. Then she washes the thread, bundles it, and sells it to different shops for a profit. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothing so that she may expand her thread selling business.

This is a group loan, and the funds will be distributed among group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. She is joined by three other members: Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy cooking oil and spices for her food business; Naziran baji also wants a loan to buy sweaters for her thread business; and Majidan baji wants a loan to buy wood cutting tools for her wood selling business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothing to turn into thread sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luch

texts.en: Mrs. Luch S. is a villager in Krous village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice. Because her rice field has become infertile, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and hire laborers to support her field to produce higher yields. This will improve her income and her living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Phoung Mao, pulls water lillies from the lake. Mrs. Luch S. is 37 years old and is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and hire laborers to support her field to make crop more productive.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Mrs. Thea A. is a villager in Trapaing Chhouk village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Because her field is infertile, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field to make er hcrop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Kon Phalkun, is a person who takes rice to husk.  Mrs. Thea A. is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Helena Bernardo

texts.pt:
Helena Bernardo M. natural do distrito da manhiça um dos distritos nortenhos da província do Maputo, tem 54 anos de idade, mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre o primeiro tem 30 anos e o ultimo tem 25 anos. Para alem dos filhos vive com mais duas pessoas na sua casa que ela sustenta.

Helena estudou até 9ºclasse e parou por situações profissionais, dado que ela fez as ultimas classes enquanto trabalha. Helena vive de negocio que consiste na venda de carne qual compra o quilo por 80,00mt e vende por 95,00mt;   Amendoim que compra o saco por 900,00mt e vende por 1600,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 28000,00mt.

Para Helena este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com este pretende aumentar a mercadoria para responder a demande na quadra festiva que se avizinha. Futuramente pretende melhorar as condições habitacionais.

loans.use: Compra e venda de carne, amendoim e refrescos.

loans.name: Rachana

texts.en: Mrs. Rachana S. is 27 years old. She sells used-clothes in the Svaychek Market, since 2000, getting profit US$8.20 per day. Rachana is married and mother of one child, and her husband, Mr. Chomren Youn, is 28 years old and always helps his wife's business, lives in Rolosh Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province. Rachana hopes to expand her business. Therefore, she decided to ask for US$1,000 to purchase more used-clothes to store for sale. The loans will help to increase their family's income and to support their family's living expenses stability.

loans.use: to purchase more used-clothes to store for sale

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi, 35 years old and married with 4 children, has been selling bags of charcoal for the past year, travelling twice a month to Oyo State to buy the charcoal to sell in Lagos State.  She is now requesting a loan to buy additional charcoal to sell.  Omowumi is very happy about the help being rendered to her by Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen, 40 years old and married with four children, has been selling clothes, shoes and jewelery for several years in Agege, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more shoes, bags and jewelery to sell. Queen says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en: Chidima O., 38 years old and married with three children, lives in Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells food spices in her shop. With demand for her products high, she is requesting a loan to buy more spices in bulk.  Chidima says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more food spices to sell.

loans.name: Wasiu

texts.en: I., 35 years old and married with five children, has sold kitchen utensils, yams and oranges in her shop located in Itire, Lagos State, Nigeria for a number of years. She is now requesting a loan in order to buy additional utensils and oranges to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensil and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells slippers, rubber shoes, underwear, and drinks in her shop. Bola is a LAPO client. Bola is 37 years old and married with 4 children. Bola and her family live in Lagos State, Nigeria. Bola needs the loan amount of N50,000 to buy more slippers, shoes and underwear to sell. She says thank you to all those who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more slippers, rubber shoes, underwear, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Noimot

texts.en: Noimot, 35 years old and happily married with three children, has sold dried fish and river fish for the past two years in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is now requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their generous contribution to women in Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish and river fish to sell.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin, 25 years old and married with three children, is a young happy hair stylist living in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria who strongly believes that happiness can attract customers. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers and sells weave-ons, hair extensions and hair cream in her shop.

Toyin is requesting a loan in order to purchase more weave-ons, hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions, hair cream and weave-ons to sell.

loans.name: Salamot

texts.en: Salamot, 34 years old and married with three children, buys CD and DVD discs from Alaba International Market to rent out to her shop customers.  An LAPO client, she is requesting a loan to buy more discs to rent. Salamot says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more DVD and CD discs for renting

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana, 53 years old and married with three children, is a business-oriented woman even though she has no formal education and barely understands the English language.  She has operated a frozen foods business for many years, travelling to the Republic of Benin twice a week to purchase turkey and chicken. Christiana has 3 deep freezers in her shop, and she now hopes for a loan to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi, a hardworking 42-year-old widow who cares for her five children alone, sells cooked Nigerian foods such as fufu, amala, and egusi, plus drinks, in her shop.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. Ngozi says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and food stuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
This group has three members. Mrs. Ny H. is 37 years old and works as a local farmer, raising vegetables behind her house. She sells the produce herself, usually three months after planting. Ny is married to Mr. Bo Phen, who is 37 years old and makes a living carving wood. He sells his work to a retailer. They have one child, who is a student. Ny need a loan of $150 to buy seeds.

Ny leads a group with two other members. Mrs. Botheng S. is 38 years old and makes a living growing vegetables. She is seeking a $100 loan to buy seeds. And Mrs. Chat S. is 24 years old and works as a farmer. She has applied for a loan to buy rice seeds.

All three women live in Somroang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a hair stylist and she sells weavons and hair extensions in her shop. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers.

Roseline has 2 children. The younger child is 8 and the elder is 11 years old. Roseline is 45 years old and she is a LAPO client. Roseline lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to buy more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more weavons and hair extensions

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen sells provisions in her shop, things like toothpaste, beverages, body cream, corn flakes, and bottled water. She has been in this business for a long time. Doreen is 36 years old and married with two children. Doreen and her family live in Sabo-Oniba, Lagos State, Nigeria. Doreen needs the loan amount of 80,000 N to purchase more provisions to sell. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva lenders for their generous contribution in eradicating poverty.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Султонкулов Азимчон парень в возросте 24 года женат , имеет одного ребенка.Всё своё время он занимается откормом и продажей скота.Жена его хорошая доярка и производитель домашнего кефира и сливок.У него сейчас большая корова , которая в день даёт 8 литров молока с маленьким телёнком , который на снимке.Азимчон объяснил что хочет взяв кредит купить ещё две коровы, пока скот дешёвый на рынке.Кроме коровы он имеет ещё 20 баранов.Он благодарен инвесторам за понимание и поддержку
texts.en:
Azimjon S. is twenty-four, married, and has one child. He spends all of his time fattening and selling livestock. His wife is a good milkmaid, and she makes homemade kefir and cream. She currently has a large cow who gives eight liters of milk a day, and a small calf (seen in the photograph). Azimjon explained that he would like to take out a loan to buy two more cows while the price of cattle is relatively low. Besides the cow, he has twenty rams. He is grateful to his investors for their understanding and support.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing livestock and feed

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 38-year-old mechanic living in Chweifat, a suburban area of Beirut. A father of two, Youssef has been working in the spare parts business for 13 years and decided on owning his own business. In 2001, he opened a car spare parts workshop in suburban Beirut and has been successfully managing it since then.

The loan of $1,200 would help him buy car spare parts and cater for his clients growing demands.

loans.use: To expand his inventory of spare parts.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora sells clothes, wrappers, bags, shoes and laces in her house. The demand for her goods is high. Flora lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. Flora is requesting  a loan in the amount of N140,000 to purchase more clothes, shoes, laces, and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ukeria

texts.en: Ukeria is a pensioner after retiring from teaching primary school. She has seven children and four grandchildren, and she is 54 years old and married. Ukeria is a proud woman who is very happy with the financial assistance she is receiving from LAPO Microfinance. Ukeria is pictured with a daughter and grandson. Ukeria sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs in her shop. Ukeria is requesting a loan of 100,000 N to purchase more provisions, drinks and juice to sell. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and to LAPO Microfinance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provisions and juice to sell

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich H. (pictured with her children and husband), 35, and her husband, Mr. Sokkhoeun Vann, 36, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1983 and have seven children, one son and six daughters. Six of them study at the local school and the youngest stays at home.

Pich has been farming for over ten years. She grows many types of vegetables and crops on her farmland in the village. Her husband has been a mason for ten years and has been fishing and farming since he was young.  Pich is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase a water pumping machine for farming and fishing nets for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im Thol, 40, and her husband, Mr. Sothy Seng, 42, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1987 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Three of them study at the local school and the eldest works in a garment factory.

Im and her husband have been growing vegetables for twenty years. They grow many kinds of vegetables and crops on their farmland near their house.  They sell these vegetables to a middleman in the village. Besides farming, the couple also sells firewood.  Im is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for farming.  She will also purchase a firewood cutting machine.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and a firewood cutting machine.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is a beautiful young woman. Ngozi sells wrappers (sarongs), shoes, bags and hair gear in her shop. Ngozi has been in this business for the past three years. Ngozi is 27 years old and married with two children. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 N to purchase more merchandise to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells drinks, foodstuffs and provisions from her shop, as well as building materials like sand, gravel rod and cement. Comfort has been in this business for the past five years. She opens her shop by 7 a.m. each morning and closes by 7 p.m. Comfort is 40 years old and married with six children. Comfort needs a loan of 100,000 N to buy more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Simorn H., 56, is a widow with six children, four sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside of the family home.  The other three children are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Simorn has been selling fruit for twenty years. She purchases fruit from her villagers and sells tH. at a market in Phnom Penh. Currently, she needs to build a  new staircase for her house because the old one is broken.  Since she lacks the money, she is requesting a loan of $500.

loans.use: To build new staircase for her house.

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en: Yemi grinds pepper, tomatoes, beans and corn with her grinding machine. She opens her shop from 6:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. Monday through Sunday. Yemi is 30 years old and married with two children. Yemi lives in Igbede, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past four years. Yemi needs a loan of 50,000 N to enable her to start another business in selling kerosene: she has an empty tank that she wants to fill with kerosene when she gets the Kiva loan. She says thank you to Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene to sell

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon C., 39, and her husband married in 2000 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. One of the children studies at the local school and other two are too young to attend school. Pon’s children are cared for by their grandmother. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Pon's husband is very ill so she farms alone. She has been growing rice for ten years and she learned this skill from her parents. Besides farming, she has been selling lotus flowers for five years. She purchases them from her neighbors to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Олимчон Умирзаков мужчина в возросте 39 лет , женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка занимается домашними делами и уходом за детьми.Олимчон работает постухом в колхозе.Он хорошо разбирается в мелкорогатом скоту. У него на сегоднешний день более 30 коз и 20 баранов.
Посёлок Утконсой расположен вблизи гор и все жители посёлка посут свой скот на пригорной окружности.И только поздно вечером скот пригоняют домой.Олимчон узнав что взяв кредит можно расширить свой бизнес, решил обратится в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Olimjon U. is a thirty-nine-year-old man who is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife who does housework and cares for their children. Olimjon works as a shepherd on a collective farm. He is very knowledgeable about sheep and goats. At present, he has more than thirty goats and twenty rams. The village of Utkonsoi is located near mountains, and all of the village’s inhabitants pasture their livestock in the foothills. Only late at night do they drive the livestock home. Olimjon, having learned that he can expand his business by taking out a loan, has decided to apply for one through MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying livestock and feed

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai K., 36, and her husband, Mr. Chun Nhem, 40, married in 1985 and have five children, three daughters and two sons. Two of their daughters are garment factory workers and the other children study at the local school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lai has been selling fish for four years. She sells the fish that her husband catches, as well as fish she purchases from neighbors, at the Phek Phnao market. Her husband has been fishing for four years. Lai is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to enable her to transport the fish to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Bopha H. is 42 years old. She is a decorator for wedding parties and other ceremonies. She also works in farming, while her husband, Mr. Chanveasna Chean, 39, is in the military. Bopha is the mother of three children, two of whom go to school, and one daughter who helps her in her business. They all live in the area of Prolay Commune, Kompong Tom Province. Bopha has many years of experience; hence, her business is going well with many clients.

Bopha requests a loan of US$1,000 to purchase decorating materials to fulfill her customers' requirements. The loan will be helping this modern business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for fulfill her customers' requirements

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph U. owns a restaurant where he sells different cooked foods like eba, rice, amala, and drinks. He has a large number of customers who patronize his restaurant; demand runs very high for his cooked foods. He needs a loan of 81,000 N to buy more inventory which he can cook and sell to his customers. He is 31 years old and married with five children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina E. sells provisions and drinks. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 46 years old and married with six children. Paulina is happy because the festive season is approaching and subsequently she expects sales will increase. She needs the loan amount of 61,000 N to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy provision and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sakhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakhorn S., 56, and her husband, Mr. Thai Hong, 61, married in 1970. They have nine children, six sons and three daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside of the family home. The other children are either garment factory workers or construction workers. The youngest studies at the local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sakhorn and her husband have been farming for thirty years. They grow rice, hemp and lotuses on their farmland. They sell their yield to the middleman in the village. Sakhorn is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is a 44-year-old widow and mother of five. Victoria sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks from her shop. As a widow, her business has become her primary source of income. She needs the loan amount of 61,000 N to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyleak C., 25, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Phoeun, 22, lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 2006 and have one daughter.  

Mrs. Sreyleak and her husband have been garment factory workers in Phnom Penh for three years. The couple needs to buy a motorbike to drive to work but lacks the funds to do so. Therefore, Sreyleak is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Turayo

texts.en: Turayo A. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 36 years old and married with four children. She sews different styles of clothes for her customers, a business she's been in for many years. To meet the rising demand of wrappers (sarongs) by her customers, she decided to expand her sewing business to include them. She needs the loan amount of 32,000 N to purchase more wrappers (sarongs) to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more wrappers (sarongs) to sell

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun C., 49, and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Kek, 45, married in 1978. They have ten children, four sons and six daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside of the family home and the other five children study at the local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Savun and her husband have been farming for thirty years. They sell their yield to the middleman in the village. Besides farming, Chhorn also fishes. Savun is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticides, rice seeds.

loans.name: Phoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoy L. (on the right in the photo ), 34, is a widow with one daughter, who studies at the local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Phoy has been selling vegetables for over ten years, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She buys vegetables from villagers and sells them at the local market. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy H., 34, and her husband, Mr. Phalla Mok, 42, were married in 1990 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. All of them study in a local school.

Chanthy has been a tailor for five years, a skill she learned in 1995. Her husband has been farming for eighteen years, a skill he learned from his parents when he was young. The couple hopes that in the future they will be able to set up one grocery store at their home to earn an extra income.

Now, Chanthy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase one more sewing machine and one plowing machine for her husband's farming.

loans.use: To purchase one sewing machine and one plowing machine for her husband's farming.

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorm C. (pictured with her daughter and grandchildren), 47, is widow with two children, one son and one daughter. Her son is married and lives outside of the family home. She lives with her daughter and her two grandchildren. The family lives in a small village across from the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Lorm has been weaving silk for ten years, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She buys silk and thread from Phnom Penh and sells her finished products to middlemen who market her products in Phnom Penh. Her daughter is also a silk weaver. Lorm is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter's loom.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving silk.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mr. Vanna S., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Sophal Thann, 46, live along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for twenty three years and have six children, two sons and four daughters. Two of their children are employed full time and the other four children are in high school.

Vanna has been a motorcycle repairer for fifteen years. He buys spare motorcycle parts from the market in Phnom Penh and sells them at his shop, which is in front of his house. He is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more  spare parts for resale and for repairing motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Parveen Kala Masih Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of K. M. and lives in the city of Kasur, Pakistan, which is known for its sweetmeat. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 30 years. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. Her son works with his father in a leather business. Her daughters are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Parveen baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of the family. She is applying for a loan to buy more leather for her husband’s leather business.

This is a group loan, and she is joined by three other members. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. Shahnaz baji, Rashidan baji, and Staila baji each want a loan to buy leather to sell as well. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to resell

loans.name: Hamidan Rahmat Ali Group

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is the wife of R. A. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son has a shuttering business. Her younger son is an electrician.

Hamidan baji’s husband is a building contractor. Hamidan baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy wooden beams for her son’s shuttering business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Rani baji wants a loan to buy a horse cart to carry loads. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart to carry loads. Nawab baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wooden beams for shuttering business

loans.name: Narong

texts.en:
Mrs. Narong N., 33, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Hul, 36, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1992 and have three children, one son and two daughters. They all are students.

Narong has been selling vegetable for sixteen years. She buys vegetables from villagers and sells them at Dem Kor market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nargis Zafar Masih Group

texts.en:
Nargis baji is the wife of Z. M. and lives in the city of Kasur, Pakistan, which is famed for its sweetmeat. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. Nargis baji is the mother of three sons. Her first two sons drive a donkey cart, while her youngest son works in his father’s leather business. Nargis baji’s husband has been selling leather for the past 10 years. Nargis baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of the family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy more leather for her husband’s business to try and increase their profits.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by three other members. Azra baji, Wazir baji, and Alas baji each wants a loan to buy leather to resell as well. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to resell

loans.name: Arsala Shouqat Masih Group

texts.en:
Arsala baji is the wife of S. M. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats. She has been living in this city for the past 15 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Arsala baji’s husband works in a school as a guard but he has a part time job also. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Arsala baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Ashran baji and Sharifan baji each want a loan to buy leather to re-sell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy chickens to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Jamila Riaz Masih Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is the wife of R. M. and resides in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 20 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son has a saloon. Her younger son has a donkey cart which he uses to deliver different items (wheat, fruits and vegetables) from one place to another.

Jamila baji’s husband has a leather-selling business. He has been selling leather for the past 10 years. Jamila baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more leather to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Rani baji and Shakeela baji and Taj baji each want a loan to buy leather to re-sell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy wooden beams for her shuttering business. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy milk for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to re-sell

loans.name: Mary Ngwe

texts.en:
Mary is married with six children and lives in Nchaubuh, Bamenda, in Cameroon. Mary has a successful business selling second hand shoes. She hopes to diversify and purchase more stock. She will invest this loan in green spices, tomatoes, second hand shoes, and fowls. She is going to invest 450,000 CFA ($900 USD) of her own personal savings towards her business. Mary has taken time to understand her customers' needs and is happy with the site of the business as there no competitors nearby. She intends to take the green spices and tomatoes purchased in Bamenda to sell in Douala where she believes she will make a larger profit.

This is Mary’s second loan from GHAPE. With the profits from her ventures, she plans to reinvest in her businesses to help them grow. She hopes that one day her income will grow enough that she will be able to help the poor increase their incomes as GHAPE and Kiva have helped her.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Second hand shoes, fowls, tomatoes and green spices

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, ubicado en el Jr. Angamos Mz. A Lt. 40 AAHH Eduardo del Águila, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en venta de jugos. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con dos motokar como herramienta de trabajo, los cuales hace trabajar todos los días para tener otros ingresos económicos.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 llantas y 6 amortiguadores, y tapizará los asientos, cambiará los frenos, etc.  

Rosa se siente contenta porque gracias a la ayuda que recibe de Manuela Ramos ha mejorado su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the community bank "Corazon de Jesus" located at Jr. Anagamos Mz. A Lt. 40 AAHH in Eduardo del Agila, within the district of Calleria in the province of Coronel Protillo in Ucayali. She is 39 years old and she is mother of 3 children who are still minors and still depend on her. She is married and her husband is the driver of a moto-car. With her first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, amounting to S/.300, she invested the funds in juice sales. She has been with the community bank for the past 8 years.

Currently she has two moto-cars as work tools, which she runs during the days to have another source of income.

With this loan of S/. 1300, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 4 tires and 6 shocks. She will also recover the seats and change the brakes etc.

Rosa feels very happy because the help she receives from Manuela Ramos she has improved her financial stability.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 4 tires, 6 shocks, will recover the seats and change the brakes etc.

loans.name: Rubith

texts.es:
La señora Rubith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, ubicado en el Jr. Virgen del Pilar Mz. H Lt. 2, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años de edad, es madre de una hija menor de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de autos, es chofer. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la crianza de pollos. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una motokar como herramienta de trabajo. Se dedica a su hogar y a la administración de su movilidad. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará una llanta y focos, también arreglará la motokar, tapizará los asientos, etc. 

Rubith se siente feliz por haber logrado tener una movilidad propia y agradece al banco comunal por confiar en su persona.
texts.en:
Rubith belongs to the community bank "Corazon de Jesus" located in Jr. Virgen del Pilar Mz. H Lt. 2, in the district of Yarinacocha in the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 26 years old and she is the mother of a girl, still a minor and dependent on her. She is married and her husband is a driver. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, amounting to S/.300, she decided to raise chicken. She has been with the community bank for the past year.

Currently she has one moto-car as a work tool. She is a homemaker and she also runs her taxi business.

With this loan amounting to S/.1000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase a tire and head lights, she will also repair the moto-car by refinishing the seats,etc.

Rubith feels happy because she has been able to set up her own taxi business and she is grateful to the community bank for their financial support.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a tire, head lights, and to repair the moto-car by refinishing the seats etc.

loans.name: Sadith Belmira

texts.es:
La señora Sadith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, ubicado en el Jr. Virgen del Pilar Mz. H Lt. 2, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 47 años D. edad, es madre D. 5 hijos, 4 mayores D. edad y uno que aún depenD. D. ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. frutas y comida. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad trabaja en el programa D. WAWA WASI. Cuenta con una motokar como herramienta D. trabajo para mejorar su estabilidad económica.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 llantas, 4 focos, también arreglará el motor y tapizará los asientos. 

Sadith se siente agradecida con Manuela Ramos porque ha logrado comprar una movilidad propia para el beneficio D. su menor hija.
texts.en:
Sadith belongs to the community bank "Corazon D. Jesus" located at Jr. Virgen del Pilar Mz. H. Lt. 2, in the district of Yarinacocha in the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 47 years old and she is the mother of 5 children, 4 of whom are of age and one that still depends no her. She is married and her husband works in dependently. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos, amounting to S/.300, she decided to invest in the sale of fruit and prepared food. She has been with the community bank for the past 2 years.

Currently she is working within the program of WAWA WASI. She has a moto-car as a work tool and she uses it to improve her financial stability.

Sadith feels grateful for Manuela Ramos because she has been able to purchase her own transportation, and it is for the benefit of her young daughter.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 tires, 4 head lights, and to repair the motor and refinish the seats.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
La señora Tania pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en el PSJ. Las Almendras Mz. C Lt. 2, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). En las mañanas atiende su hogar y por las tardes reparte sus productos a sus clientes.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 perfumes de varón, 6 colonias, 6 lápiz labial, cremas, etc.

Tania es una mujer trabajadora. Está contenta por contar con personas cumplidas y responsables para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Tania belongs to the Community Bank "Mujeres Perseverantes" (meaning Persevering Women), located at the PSJ. Las Almendras Mz. C. Lt. 2, within the district of Yarinacocha in the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 33 years old and she is the mother of 3 children who are still minors and still depend on her. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, amounting to S/.300, she invested in the purchase of beauty products (EBEL). She has been with the community bank for the past 2 years.

Currently she continues with the same business, selling beauty products (EBEL). In the morning she tends to her home and in the afternoons she distributes products to her clients.

With this loan amounting to S/.1000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 4 men's perfumes, 6 colognes, 6 lipsticks, skin creams, etc.

Tania is a hardworking woman. She is happy that she can count on honest and responsible individuals for work.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase men's perfumes, 6 colognes, 6 lipsticks, skin creams etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
This will be the second loan cycle for this group of five women.  With this loan, they will be trying to expand their small businesses. Leonie is the representative of this group, and with her first loan she started a small beauty salon in her house. She experienced a lot of success with her first loan, but her business is still very small. With this loan she hopes to increase the size of her salon and the variety of products she sells. She really feels that with this loan she can start to grow the business. Leonie is the young mother of three children, and dreams of education for all of them. She hopes to improve her business so she can provide a good life for her loved ones. She is a very hard-working woman and is on the path to a better life.

On behalf of Leonie, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Equipment for a small beauty salon

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Trabajadoras group 2" is a group of five people who are looking to receive loans. This is the second loan for this group, and all of them will be trying to increase the size of their small businesses. Melania is the representative of this group; she has a small barber shop. She hopes to use her loan to increase her inventory and her clientele. She is a very hard-working mother, and feels that this is the way to change not only her life, but also the lives of her family and loved ones. She dreams of education for her children, and hopes to have her very own thriving business some day. She and the rest of the group are hoping to get many loans in the future, and are on the right path to success and a better life.

On behalf of Melania, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Equipment for a barber shop

loans.name: Juan Leonardo

texts.es: El señor Juan Leonardo V. tiene la edad de 65 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla junto a su esposa y uno de sus hijos que ya esta casado y le ayuda a don V., este señor es agricultor desde hace 25 años el señor nos solicita un monto de C$ 15,000.00 cordobas para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos ya que necesitan los insumos necesarios para que pueda dar un buen fruto y así poder vender en buen precio  don Juan con sus propios esfuerzos y el financiamiento de AFODENIC ha logrado mantener sus cultivos .
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Leonardo V. is 65 years old and lives in an area called Juan Ramón Padilla with his wife and one of his married children who helps him. This man has been a farmer for 25 years. He is requesting a loan for 15,000 córdobas (US$775) to maintain his crops because they require certain supplies in order to produce a good fruit that will get a good price. Juan, with his hard work and the financing provided by AFODENIC, has been able to maintain his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insecticide and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.en:
"La Amistad" is a large group of men and women receiving loans. This particular loan is going to 15 of the group members. This group is a great example of the success that microcredit can bring. The members of this group are looking for their seventh or eighth loans, and all have had a taste of success. Each member started out with virtually nothing, but now each has a small business and great hope for the future. Inocencia is the group representative, and she has a small clothing business. She is an extremely hardworking mother of four children, and is really excited about the way her business is going. She feels like she can proviD. for her family, and that is a feeling she has never had before. She dreams of all her children attending universities, and she is on her way to fulfilling that dream. This whole group is all moving up in life, and want to continue expanding and growing their businesses. Everyone is excited about the future and what it will bring for this hardworking group.

On behalf of Inocencia, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To support a clothing business

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
This is a group of 5 women applying for their second loan with Esperanza International. With the first loan all the women were able to get started on their small businesses, and taste a little bit of success. Fatima is the group representative; she is a very hard-working mother. She has a very small business selling food in her area. She hopes to use this loan to increase the variety of food she sells, and grow her business. She wants to have her own restaurant someday, and dreams of sending her children to good schools and a university some day. She is ready to start changing her life for the better.  The other women in the group also want to increase the size and revenue of their businesses with this loan. 

On behalf of Fatima, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy an increased variety of food to sell

loans.name: Ebenezer Group 4

texts.en:
This is a group of five women from the group "Ebenezer", which is a bigger group of 20 people. These five women are looking to receive a loan to help increase their small businesses. This will be the second loan for these women, and each has a very small business they started in the last 6 months. Jesula is the representative of this group, and she has a small salon in her house. She used her first loan to buy all the necessary items to start this business. She is dedicated mother who hopes to have her own salon some day, and be able to proviD. for her family. She dreams of being able to travel with her children, and show them the world outsiD. the Dominican Republic. She had some success with her first loan, but thinks this loan will make a big difference in her business. This whole group is very excited about this opportunity, and ready to take advantage of it.

On behalf of Jesula, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Supplies to run salon

loans.name: Florian

texts.es:
El Señor Florián cuenta con 37 años de edad, su pareja es la Señora. Constancia Alvarenga,  aún no tienen hijos y viven en una casa arrendada.
El Señor Florián tiene un local con venta de bebidas varias y comidas rápidas, para poder comenzar con este negocio,  Florián, desde el año 1998 hasta aproximadamente 2004, había trabajado en un bar en la capital del país, donde pudo ahorrar un pequeño capital y así montar dicho negocio, nos cuenta que comenzó con   aproximadamente $ 130, esto mas la experiencia que había adquirido en su anterior trabajo y gracias a su espíritu emprendedor, actualmente es uno de los lugares con más concurrencia de personas, por la buena atención y  la calidad de los productos ofrecidos.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de bebidas gaseosas e ingredientes para la elaboración de las comidas rápidas.
Su meta es la de tener una casa propia en donde pueda establecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Florián is 37, his partner is Señora Constancia Alvarenga. They do not yet have children and are living in a rented house. Señor Florián has a shop selling various beverages and quick meals. In order to start this business, Florián worked in a bar in the capital from 1998 until approximately 2004, where he was able to gather a little capital to get his business going. He tells us that he started with approximately $130 plus the experience gained from his former job and thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit, it is now one of the places with the most clients, because of his excellent service and the quality of the products offered. The requested loan is to purchase soft drinks and ingredients for preparation of the quick meals. His goal is to establish his business in a house of his own.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and ingredients for quick meals

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es:
La Sra. Miryan tiene 44años de edad, está  casada hace  22 años, con  Jorge Sánchez con tiene 3 hijos de 18, 9 y 7 años  de edad respectivamente, la hija mayor ya está trabajando y los menores están en edad escolar.
Su esposo  trabaja  como cajero en un restaurante en el centro y aporta económicamente en la casa.
Viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, en donde la Sra. Miryan tiene una casilla y los fines de semanas elabora comestibles para vender como: hamburguesas sándwich de milanesas, de jamón y queso, también vende gaseosas, cervezas y en el verano tiene venta de helados.
 Cuenta que  de lunes a viernes trabaja hace 20 años en una panadería familiar en donde se elaboran panificados exclusivos de los Mennonitas (descendientes alemanes), cuenta que allí aprendió  la elaboración de masitas, confites y panificados.
 Nos dice además que el crédito es muy útil para ella porque le permite acceder a mayores mercaderías, y en este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas, helados, y además en la reparación del techo de su casa, ya que llega la época de mucho calor  y necesita un poco mas de ambiente fresco para la elaboración de su comestibles.
texts.en:
Señora Miryan is 44 years old. She has been married for 22 years to Jorge Sánchez. They have three children,18, 9, and 7 years of age respectively. The eldest daughter is already working; the younger children are still in school. Her husband works as a cashier in a restaurant in the central business area, and supports the home economically. They live in their own home in the city of Villa Elisa, where Miryan has a hut and on the weekends she makes food to sell like hamburger, milanesas (thin breaded cutlets of meat) sandwiches, ham and cheese sandwiches, and she also sells soda pop, beers, and in the summer she sells ice cream. She has been able to work Monday through Friday for the past 20 years in a family bakery where she makes exclusive Mennonite (of German decent) baked goods. She has learned to make corn snacks, comfits, and other baked goods. She says that credit is very useful for her because it allows her to gain access to the best markets, and that this loan would be invested in the purchase of soft drinks, ice creams, and also for the repair of the roof of her home, as the season of intense heat has arrived and she needs a little more fresh air in order to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, ice creams, and to repair the roof of Miryan's house

loans.name: Susan Karin

texts.es:
Susan es socia de Bancomunal El Pino. Sonia es conviviente y tiene 24 años, no tiene hijos por el momento.     
Susan tiene su negocio de venta de ropa hace 1 año, ella entrega  pedidos  de ropa que le hacen sus clientes, Susan vende mas en asentamientos Humanos. 
Susan necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.    
Susan sueña con tener una tienda  de ropa propia.
texts.en:
Susan is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. Sonia, her roommate, is 24 years old. Susan doesn't have children at this time. She has had a clothing business for a year. She delivers orders of clothes to her clients and sells more in the Humanos neighborhood. Susan needs a loan for 400 soles that she will use to purchase clothing. Her dream is to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Jessica Beatríz

texts.es:
Jessica es socia de Bancomunal El Pino. Jessica es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos de 5 años y 10 meses. El mayor de sus hijos está en inicial.       
Jessica tiene su negocio de venta de comida, ella vende desde el día Miércoles hasta el Domingo, al costado de sus casa en un local. Antes hacia trabajos de cerámica. 
Jessica desde que recibe los préstamos ha crecido en su negocio, ha invertido mas.
Jessica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas, sillas, y otras cosas que le hacen falta para ampliar su negocio.
Jessica sueña con ampliar su negocio, abrir otro local y  arreglar  su casa.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. She is married, 33 years old and has two children ages five years and 10 months. Her oldest child is starting school. Jessica has a business selling food. She sells from Wednesday to Sunday from a locale next to her home. Before, she made ceramics. Since Jessica started receiving the loans she has grown her business and invested more. She needs a loan of 1,000 soles, money that will be used to purchase tables, chairs and other things that she needs to increase the size of her business. Jessica dreams of growing her business, opening another location and making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs and other items needed to grow the business

loans.name: Ruby Minerva

texts.es:
Ruby es socia de Banco Comunal El Pino. Ruby es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 3 hijos de 8, 5 y 1 año.Dos de sus hijos están en el colegio.       
Ruby tiene su negocio de venta de ropa como ambulante, ella empezó vendiendo a sus familiares y luego se fue expandiendo, vendía a sus vecinos, amigos. Desde que recibe los préstamos ha mejorado comenzó a comprar mas mercadería.
Ruby necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa, porque tiene pedidos que entregar por campaña navideña. 
Ruby sueña con tener un local grande para poder vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Ruby is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. She is a common-law wife, 26 years old and has three children ages eight, five and one. Two of her children are in school.

Ruby has a business selling clothing as a street vendor. She started selling to her family and later expanded as she began to sell to neighbors and friends. Since she has received the loans, things have improved and she started to buy more merchandise.

Ruby needs a loan for 800 soles, money that will be used to purchase clothing because she has orders to fill during the Christmas season. She dreams of having a large locale where she will be able to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell during the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Estefani Paz

texts.es:
Estefani es socia de Banco Comunal El Pino. Estefani es soltera , tiene 24 años, y no quiere tener hijos por el momento       
Estefani tiene su negocio de venta de ropa interior al por mayor, Estefani empezó con este negocio hace 2 años, sus tíos son comerciantes ellos confeccionan la ropa interior y Estefani la vende.
Estefani desde que recibe los prestamos se siente mas tranquila porque puede trabajar mas y tiene otro ingreso.Estefani actualmente tiene a su padre operado.
Estefani necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de mercadería (medias, truzas)por campaña.
Estefani sueña con comprar una  máquina para confeccionar medias.
texts.en:
Estefani is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. She is single, 24, and currently does not want to have children. Her business is selling wholesale underwear. Estefani started this business 2 years ago, relatives make the underwear and she sells it. Estefani has felt more comfortable since she received her loans because she is able to work more and bring in more income. Estefani currently is in business with her father. Estefani needs a loan of $400 that will be invested in merchandise (stockings, socks) for a sales campaign. Estefani dreams of buying a machine to knit stockings.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (stockings, socks) for a sales campaign

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La señora Mónica Rodríguez Q. tiene 33 años pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II, es secretaria y vive en la calle Desamparados  701 del balneario Buenos Aires Norte, distrito de Víctor Larco provincia de Trujillo La Libertad Perú.
Mónica no contaba con el apoyo paterno para continuar sus estudios, pero gracias a su empeño y dedicación terminó sus estudios secundarios en la Nocturna, trabajaba durante el día para poderse mantener, tiene 2 hijas y un hijo, dependen de ella solamente una hija y su hijo.
Se inicia en el negocio haciendo postres y papa rellena, gracias a Manuela Ramos amplió su negocio, pudo comprar material para hacer collares, aretes y postres helados, es tan emprendedora que actualmente también hace ondulaciones, teñido de cabello y cortes, su negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas, completó para comprar su refrigeradora y pudo hacer raspadilla, gelatina, torta helada, etc.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará mesitas y un espejo para la ambientación de su local.
Mónica sueña con tener un lindo salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Señora Mónica Rodríguez Q. is 33 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Mujeres Emprendedoras II (Hardworking Women II). She is the secretary and she lives in the street Desamparados 701 in the region of Buenos Aires Norte, in the district of Victor Larco, in the province of Trujillo La Libertad Perú. Mónica did not have any parental help with her education, but thanks to her determination and dedication she finished her secondary studies at the Nocturna, working during the day in order to be able to carry on. She has two daughters and one son. One daughter and her son depend on her entirely. She began her business making desserts and fried potatoes, and thanks to Manuela Ramos grew her business. She was able to buy materials to make necklaces, earrings, and frozen desserts. She is so hardworking that currently she is also doing hair styling, doing hair and cuts. Her business is located in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in 4 instalments, she completed the purchase of her refrigerator and was able to have shaved ice, gelato, frozen cake, etc. With this loan of 800 soles that she would repay in 6 installments, she would buy little tables and a mirror for the ambiance of her location. Mónica dreams of having a pretty beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and mirrors

loans.name: María Castillejo

texts.es:
Maria es socia D. Banco Comunal El Pino. Maria es casada, tiene 51 años y 3 hijos D. 28, 26 y 19 años. El ultimo D. sus hijos esta en la universidad, los otros dos trabajan.       
Maria tiene su negocio desD. hace un año ella venD. abarrotes, golosinas, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes,(arroz, azúcar, dulces, etc.)   
María desD. que recibe los prestamos empezó a comprar mas mercadería, abarrotes, comenzó a surtir su tienda. Maria sueña con ampliar su negocio tener una tienda bien surtida y granD..
texts.en:
María is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. She is married, 51 years old and has three children ages 28, 26 and 19. Her youngest child attends university and the other two work. María has had a business for a year selling groceries and candy. She has a small store in her home. She needs a loan for 1,200 soles, money that will be used to purchase groceries (rice, sugar, candy, etc.). When she began to receive the loans, María started to purchase more merchandise and began to stock her store. She dreams of growing her business and having a store that is large and well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La señora Mónica Rodríguez Q. tiene 33 años pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II, es secretaria y vive en la calle Desamparados  701 del balneario Buenos Aires Norte, distrito de Víctor Larco provincia de Trujillo La Libertad Perú.
Mónica no contaba con el apoyo paterno para continuar sus estudios, pero gracias a su empeño y dedicación terminó sus estudios secundarios en la Nocturna, trabajaba durante el día para poderse mantener, tiene 2 hijas y un hijo, dependen de ella solamente una hija y su hijo.
Se inicia en el negocio haciendo postres y papa rellena, gracias a Manuela Ramos amplió su negocio, pudo comprar material para hacer collares, aretes y postres helados, es tan emprendedora que actualmente también hace ondulaciones, teñido de cabello y cortes, su negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas, completó para comprar su refrigeradora y pudo hacer raspadilla, gelatina, torta helada, etc.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará mesitas y un espejo para la ambientación de su local.
Mónica sueña con tener un lindo salón de belleza.

loans.use: Compra de mezas y espejo.

loans.name: Mercedes Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes Graciela A. O., tiene 28 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía nuestros Pasos  II y vive  en el Pasaje Peatonal Mz. 9 lote 37 del distrito de Florencia de mora, provincia de Trujillo departamento de La libertad Perú.
Estudio Primaria completa, pero por razones económicas no pudo continuar estudiando la secundaria. Se casó a los 21 años de edad y tiene dos hijas mujeres de 9 y 6 años respectivamente.
Mercedes Graciela vende gaseosa y cerveza, helada y sin helar, lo hace en su propia casa.  Los clientes van a la casa y compran la cerveza para llevarla a tomar a sus domicilios o en otros lugares.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas, compró insumos para su negocio e incremento con más cerveza.
Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas incrementará la compra de cerveza y gaseosa.
Mercedes sueña con tener la distribución mayorista de cerveza y gaseosa.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes Graciela A. O. is 28 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II (God Guides our Steps II) and she lives in Pasaje Peatonal Mz. 9 lote 37 of the district of Florencia de Mora, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad Perú. She finished primary school entirely, but for economic reasons she was not able to continue studying through secondary school. She was married at 21 years of age and she has two daughters, who are 9 and 6 years of age. Mercedes Graciela sells soda pop and beer, cold and warm. She does this from her own home. The clients come to her house and buy the beer to carry away and drink in their own homes or other places. With her first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in 4 installments, she bought ingredients she needed for her business and also bought more beer. With this loan of 300 soles that she would repay in 4 installments she would buy more beer and soda pop. Mercedes dreams of having the best distribution network of beer and soda pop.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more soda pop and beer

loans.name: Ginger Bihey

texts.es:
Ginger es socia de Banco Comunal El Pino. Ginger es conviviente, tiene 23 años y un hijo de 5 años , que esta en el jardín.      
Ginger tiene su negocio de venta de ropa como ambulante. 
Ginger necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa y  juguetes para la campaña de navidad, pues ya tiene pedidos.    
Ginger sueña con finalizar su educación. Pues todavía esta en secundaria.
texts.en:
Ginger is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. She is 23 and lives with her partner and 5-year-old son who is in kindergarten. Ginger sells clothing in the street. Ginger needs a loan of $150 that will be invested in clothing and toys for the Christmas season, for which she already has orders. Ginger dreams of completing her education, since she is still at the secondary level.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (clothing and toys) for the Christmas season

loans.name: Claudia Aurelia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia D. Banco Comunal El Pino. Claudia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos D. 22 y 18 años. El mayor D. sus hijos trabaja en las tiendas Ripley y el otro estudia en el universidad.      
Claudia tiene su bodega en su casa desD.  hace 3 años, ella venD. abarrotes, golosinas, regalos, y otras variedades. 
Claudia necesita un préstamo D. 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mercadería para la bodega, ahora por campaña naviD.ña salen mas los juguetes. Claudia sueña con poner mas bodegas.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the El Pino (The Pine Tree) microfinance institute. Claudia has a domestic partner and 2 children ages 22 and 18. Her eldest child works at a Ripley store and the other is currently attending college. Claudia has had a general store insiD. her home—in which she sells groceries, gifts, and other goods—for 3 years. Claudia needs a loan of 400.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing goods for her general store because the Christmas season is approaching, and toy sales are increasing. Claudia dreams of opening more general stores.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Flor Johanna

texts.es:
Flor es socia de Banco Comunal El Pino. 
Flor es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años. El mayor esta en la escuela. 
Flor tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos como ambulante empezó con este negocio desde hace 2 años, le hacen pedidos y los reparte a las casas de sus clientes.Flor vende todos los días.
Flor desde que recibe los préstamos ha mejorado , porque puede traer mas pedidos y le mas ganancias y tiene otra entrada económica.
Flor necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa y zapatos pues ya tiene sus pedidos.
Flor sueña con tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the El Pino (The Pine Tree) microfinance institute. Flor is a 32-year-old woman who has a domestic partner and 2 children ages 9 and 2. The eldest child is in school. Flor sells clothing and footwear as a street vendor for a living. She started this business 2 years ago. Her customers order merchandise, and then she distributes it to their homes. She works everyday. Ever since she has received the loans, Flor’s economic situation has improved because she can fill more orders and bring in more profits with this extra income. Flor needs a loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing clothing and footwear to fill existing orders. Flor dreams of having her own boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and footwear

loans.name: Narda

texts.es:
La señora Narda Córdova  Murrugarrra tiene 29 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Elena II y vive en MZ A 39 lote 15 Manuel Arévalo II etapa del distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Narda estudió Enfermería Técnica, pero no ejerce su profesión debido a que se casó a los 23 años y se dedicó a cuidar a sus 2 hijos una niña y un niño, este último con rasgos de semi autismo al cual tiene que dedicar mucho tiempo.
Actualmente vende productos de belleza y joyas por catálogo. A partir del siguiente mes tendrá una pequeña bodega en su casa, donde venderá productos de primera necesidad.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas, compró y vendió productos naturales de salud.
Con este crédito de 1300 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas surtirá su bodega, comprando artículos básicos como; arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.
Narda sueña con el día en que pueda ver a su hijo completamente sano.
texts.en:
Señora Narda Córdova Murrugarrra is 29 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Santa Elena II, and she lives at MZ A 39 lote 15 Manuel Arévalo Il Etapa in the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad Perú. Narda studied technical nursing, but she didn’t go into her professional because she was married at 23 years old and she dedicated herself ot caring for her two children, one daughter and one son. The son has the challenges of being semi-autistic and so he requires a lot of time to care for. At the moment she sells beauty products and jewelry by catalouge. At the end of the next month she will have a small store in her home, where she will sell products of basic necessity. With her first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in 4 installments she created her store, buying basics like rice, sugar, oil, etc. Narda dreams of the day that she might see her son completely healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items for Narda's shop

loans.name: Nimia Idelsa

texts.es:
La señora Nimia Idelsa León M.  tiene 38 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Elena II y vive en la Mz A 28 lote 3 Manuel Arévalo II etapa distrito La Esperanza provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero ya no continuó estudios superiores debido a que vivía en la campiña y era difícil ir a la ciudad porque no había movilidad. Se casó a los 21 años y tiene 2 hijas que dependen de ella.
Nimia tiene una mini granja en la que cría pollos en escala, gallinas ponedoras y pollas ponedoras, su negocio lo realiza en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas compró comida para pollos.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará comederos y bebederos para sus pequeños galpones.
Nimia sueña con tener un establo porque le gusta mucho la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Señora Nimia Idelsa León M. is 38 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Santa Elena II and she lives at Mz A 28 lote 3 Manuel Arévalo II etapa, district La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad Perú. She finished secondary school completely, but she didn’t continue her studies further because she was living in the country and it was very difficult to go to the city because she didn’t have a way to get there. She was married at 21 years of age and she has two daughters who depend on her. Nimia has a small farm in which she raises baby chickens, laying hens, and stud roosters. She runs her business from her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, she bought chicken feed. With this loan of 500 soles that she would repay in 4 installments she would buy food troughs and drinking fountains for her small farm. Nimia dreams of having a stable because she really likes raising animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy implements to care for Nimia's animals
