loans.name: Norma Marcela

texts.es:
La señora Norma Marcela López R. tiene 43 años , pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II, vive en la Avenida 28 de Julio Mz.1F lote 134 del distrito Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no siguió estudiando porque se fue a vivir con su pareja desde los 17años, actualmente tienen 2 hijos varones que ya trabajan y una hija mujer que todavía tiene 9 años y estudia primaria.
Norma confecciona y vende calzado de acuerdo a la estación, lo hace en Florencia de Mora y luego va a vender en Casa Grande. Ahora como ya se acerca la época de verano confecciona sandalias.
Con el primer préstamo que fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compro diversos materiales que se utilizan en la confección, por ejemplo; pegamento, plantillas y cuero sintético.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas comprará material como, cueros, pegamento, plantas, etc.
Norma sueña con terminar toda su casa y tener un gran taller.
texts.en:
Señora Norma Marcela López R. is 43 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II (God Guides Our Steps II). She lives at Avenida 28 de Julio Mz.1F lote 134, district Florencia de Mora, province Trujillo, department of La Libertad Perú. She finished secondary school completely, but she didn’t continue studying because she was lived with her partner since she was 17. At the moment they have 2 boys who are already working and one daughter who is currently 9 years old and is studying in primary school. Norma makes and sells footwear at the station. She does this in Florencia de Mora and later she goes to sell at Casa Grande. Now she is close to the time of summer, when she will make sandals. With her first loan of 300 soles, that she repaid in 4 installments, she bought various materials that she used in her craft, for example glue, insoles, and synthetic leather. With this loan of 500 soles that she would repay in 4 installments she would buy materials like leather, glue, insoles, etc. Norma dreams of finishing her house and to have a big workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for shoemaking

loans.name: Rocio Magaly

texts.es:
La señora Rocío Magaly L. Díaz  tiene 30 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Elena II y vive en MZ A 39 lote 14 en Manuel Arévalo II etapa distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de La Libertad Perú. 
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando debido a que se casó de 16 años y ahora tiene 4 hijos, 2 hombres y 2 mujeres, los 4 estudiantes.
Rocío Magaly se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, también vende joyas y otros productos que se puedan ofrecer por catálogo, lo realiza en su casa o ambulatoriamente.
Su primer crédito fue de 200 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, fue con ese préstamo que se inició en la venta de cosméticos.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en comprar cosas para su futura bodega.
Rocío sueña con tener su casa propia y ser directora de Unic
texts.en:
Mrs. Rocío Magaly L. Díaz is 30 years old and a partner in the Santa Elena II Community Bank. She lives at MZ A 39 lote 14 in Manuel Arévalo II in the La Esperanza district of the La Libertad province in Peru. Rocío completed secondary school but wasn't able to continue her education because she married at age 16. Now she has four children: two boys and two girls. All four of them are students. Rocío Magaly sells cosmetics, jewelry, and other products from catalogs. She works from home and also travels to continue selling. Her first loan was for 200 soles, which she repaid in four installments. With this loan she began to sell cosmetics. Rocío will use a loan of 1200 soles to buy supplies for her future store. She'll repay the loan in six installments. Rocío dreams of owning her own home and becoming the director of Unic.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to start a store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La  señora Rosa L. R. tiene 21 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II  y vive en la calle Jorge Chávez 391 del balneario de Buenos Aires Norte de la provincia de Trujillo del departamento de La Libertad.
Terminó la educación secundaria pero por  falta de medios económicos no continúo estudiando. Tiene una hija que depende de ella.
Rosa responde en dos negocios, uno que lo hace por su cuenta y consiste en la venta de ropa interior en el mercado de su sector, lo realiza en las mañanas y otro negocio que es familiar y lo realiza por las tardes en su casa es un locutorio.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas compró algunas cosas para el negocio familiar y prendas de ropa interior.
Con este crédito de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas ampliará el negocio comprando otra clase de ropa.
Rosa es emprendedora y le interesa mucho sacar adelante a su hija, enseñarle lo bueno y lo malo de la vida, incentivarla a continuar sus estudios y guiarla de tal manera que sepa sus derechos y obligaciones como mujer. 
Rosa sueña con tener un negocio muy grande, bien implementado y muy bonito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa L. R. is 21 years old and belongs to the Enterprising Women II Community Bank. She lives at Jorge Chávez 391 in the Buenos Aires North resort in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department. Rosa finished secondary school, but wasn't able to continue her education due to economic factors. She has one daughter, who depends on her. Rosa has two businesses. She sells underwear in the local market each morning, and is the sole proprietor of this business. She also runs a family business in the afternoons, which is a shop where people can pay discounted rates to make international phone calls. With her first loan of 300 soles Rosa bought some things for her family business, and also supplied her underwear business. She repaid the loan in four installments. With this loan of 300 soles she'll expand her business by purchasing different types of clothing. She'll repay the loan in four installments. Rosa is a hard worker and very motivated to help her daughter get ahead, to teach her about the good and bad things in life, and incentivize her to continue her studies. Rosa would like to guide her daughter so that she knows her rights and obligations as a woman. Rosa dreams of having a large, well-run, and beautiful business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy underwear wholesale.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Rosario del Pilar M. Chávez  tiene 28 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal  Santa Elena II, vive en Mz. A 39 lote 16 Manuel Arévalo  II etapa del distrito La Esperanza provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Rosario es Auxiliar Contable, pero no ejerce su profesión, se casó y tiene  un hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Rosario del Pilar se dedica a la venta de productos de Unic, es vendedora 3 estrellas eso indica que es una mujer emprendedora  y que lo que se propone lo cumple.
Recuerda que el primer crédito de 200 soles  que fue devuelto en 4 cuotas sirvió par incrementar su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá, una parte en su negocio y otra parte la tendrá como capital.
Rosario tiene un gran sueño y seguramente lo logrará porque es una mujer emprendedora y con mucha visión de negocio, ella sueña con ser directora de Unic y lograr el auto unic.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario del Pilar M. Chávez is 28 years old and belongs to the Santa Elena II Community Bank. She lives at Mz. A 39 lote 16 Manuel Arévalo II etapa in the La Esperanza district of the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. Rosario del Pilar is a Junior Accountant but she doesn't practice her profession. She is married and has one child who is economically dependent on her. Rosario del Pilar sells Unic products. She is a three star saleslady, which indicates that she is a hard worker and finishes what she starts. Her first loan of 200 soles was repaid in four installments. Rosario del Pilar used the loan to grow her business. This loan of 1200 soles will be repaid in six installments. Rosario del Pilar will invest a portion of the money in her business and the other portion she'll use as working capital. Rosario del Pilar has a big dream, and because she is a hard worker with great business vision she'll surely achieve it. She'd like to be the head of Unic and earn the Unic car.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products. Capital

loans.name: Santos Doris

texts.es:
La señora Santos Doris A. G. tiene 30 años  y pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos, vive en la calle 8 de Setiembre 317, distrito de El Porvenir de la provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta el primer año de secundaria, pero lamentablemente no pudo continuar con sus estudios porque su situación económica no le permitía.
Ahora será madre soltera ya que se encuentra embarazada y muy pronto tendrá un bebé.
Santos Doris vende gelatina en el mercado La Hermelinda de Trujillo. Por las tardes se dedica ha hacer gelatina y combinado de gelatina con flan, normalmente hace 80 vasitos de gelatina y combinados, además bolsitas con gelatina. Por la mañana vende gelatina y combinados desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas, compró gelatina, flan, vasos y cucharitas.
Con este crédito de 600 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará; gelatina, vasitos, azúcar y bolsas.
Doris sueña con tener un negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Doris A. G. is 30 years old and belongs to the God Guides Our Steps Community Bank. She lives at calle 8 de Setiembre 317, in the El Porvenir district within the Trujillo province of the La Libertad department in Peru. Doris studied through the first year of secondary school but her economic situation didn't allow her to continue her studies. Now Doris is pregnant and will soon be a single mother. She sells gelatin in the La Hermelinda market in Trujillo. In the afternoons she makes up to 80 cups of gelatin and gelatin and flan combinations, plus small bags of gelatin. Doris sells the gelatin and combinations from 7am until 2pm. With her her first loan of 300 soles she bought gelatin, flan, cups, and spoons. She repaid the loan in four installments. With this loan of 600 soles she'll buy gelatin, cups, sugar, and bags. She'll repay the loan in four installments. Doris dreams of having a business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and packaging

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos tiene 67 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos, vive en la Avenida 12 D. Noviembre 1212 del distrito Florencia D. Mora en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta segundo año D. Primaria en el distrito D. Huaranchal en la provincia D. Otuzco. No continuó estudiando porque sus padres eran muy ignorantes y no les interesaba que sus hijos estudien.
Se casó D. 22 años y ahora tiene 4 hijos, todos casado, a su cargo tiene un nieto.
Santos se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. zapatos, busca compradores, los que van a su casa a comprar el calzado por docena.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas, empezó a trabajar por docena, es decir ha hacer zapatos en serie.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará material para hacer zapato en serie.
Santos sueña con ir a ver a su hija a Argentina.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos is 67 years old and belongs to the God Guides Our Steps Community Bank. She lives at Avenida 12 D. Noviembre 1212 in the Florencia D. Mora district of the Trujillo province within the La Libertad department of Peru. She studied through the second year of primary school in the Huaranchal district of the Otuzco province. Santos wasn't able to continue her studies because her parents were very ignorant and were not interested in their children's education. Santos married at age 22 and now she has four children, all of whom are now married. Santos cares for one of her grandsons. Santos makes and sells shoes. She looks for buyers who can come to her home and buy footwear by the dozen. With her first loan of 300 soles she began to work by the dozen, or rather, to produce shoes in a series. She repaid the loan in four installments. With this loan of 500 soles Santos will buy material for a new series of shoes. She'll repay the loan in four installments. Santos dreams of visiting her daughter in Argentina.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make footwear.

loans.name: Luzmila Yovanni

texts.es:
La señora Luzmila  tiene 34 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias  al Éxito II  y vive en la calle Gamarra 793 del Puerto de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La libertad Perú.
Estudió su secundaria completa, pero ya no pudo continuar estudiando debido a que quedo huérfana de madre  y su papá no se dedicó a ella.
Se casó a los 20 años con Aldo Mecola y tienen 6 hijos, 3 varones y 3 mujeres, muy bien educados y con grandes habilidades.
Yovanni prepara postres por las mañanas como son; mazamorra, arroz con leche, flan y los vende por la tarde de manera ambulatoria, por todo el puerto.  Los días de fiesta y los domingos hace anticuchos para venderlos también de manera ambulatoria.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles  devuelto en 4 cuotas compró utensilios para los postres, como vasitos y cucharitas descartables, también fuentes.
Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará utensilios y materiales como azúcar, arroz, flan.
Yovanni sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales y  construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luzmila is 34 years old and belongs to the Successful Businesswomen II Community Bank. She lives at Gamarra Street 793 of the Salaverry Port in the Trujillo province of the La Libertad department in Peru. Yovanni finished secondary school but couldn't continue her studies because her mother died and her father didn't care for her. When she was 20 years old she married Aldo Mecola and now they have six children, three boys and three girls. All of the children are well educated and very talented. Yovanni spends her mornings preparing deserts, such as mazamorra, rice with milk, and flan. She sells the deserts in the afternoon, traveling throughout the port. On holidays and Sundays Yovanni makes and sells kebabs. With her first loan of 300 soles she bought utensils, such as disposable cups and spoons, as well as serving dishes. Yovanni repaid the loan in four installments. With this loan of 300 soles, Yovanni will buy utensils and sugar, rice, and flan. She'll repay the loan in four installments. Yovanni dreams of seeing her children become professionals and building her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies wholesale

loans.name: Zoila Karina

texts.es:
La señora Zoila Karina C. Ucañán tiene 24 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias al Éxito II y vive en la calle Lambayeque Mz C lote 41 del Puerto de Salaverry de la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió Enfermería Técnica en un Instituto de Moche, pero actualmente no puede ejercer su profesión porque se caso a los 23 años y tiene una bebé de 4 meses de nacida, entonces para poder contribuir a la economía del hogar se asoció con su madre para hacer parrilladas y polladas los días domingo, sábados y feriados.
Actualmente también hace pasteles, queques, alfajores que los reparte a las tiendas para venderlos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 meses compró materiales para hacer los pasteles y alfajores como por ejemplo; manjar, azúcar impalpable, harina, mantequilla, vainilla.
Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado en cuatro cuotas implementará para vender también embutidos y cosas para las parrilladas. 
Zoila sueña con tener un local propio con todas sus comodidades y además trabajar en su profesión.
texts.en:
Zoila Karina C. Ucañán is 24 years old. She is a member of the communal bank "Las Empresarias al Exito II" and lives at Lambayeque Mz C lote 41 del Puerto de Salaverry in the province of Trujillo in the department La Libertad Peru. Zoila studied technical nursing at the "Instituto de Moche." She currently cannot practice her profession since she was married at the age of 23 and has a four month old baby. In order to contribute to the household economy, she partnered with her mother to sell grilled meats and poultry on Sundays, Saturdays and on holidays. She also makes a variety of cakes which she sells to different stores. She repaid her first loan in four months. She used her first loan to purchase materials to make her cakes such as sugar, flour, butter and vanilla. The current loan she is requesting in the amount of $100 will be repaid in four payments and will be used in her sales of cured meats and grilling supplies. Zoila dreams with having her own stall with all the conveniences and also to work in her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cured meats and grilling supplies.

loans.name: Maria Celene

texts.es:
Maria es socia de Banco Comunal El Pino. Maria es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos de 17, 7 y 3 años. Todos estan en la escuela.       
Maria tiene su negocio de venta de salchipapas,ella vende desde hace 2 años tiene un carrito sanguchero,  atiende todos los días por las noches , su negocio está ubicado en una zona comercial.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de insumos para su negocio (paltos descartables , bolsas)todo al por mayor.
María desde que recibe los prestamos ha producido un poco mas. Maria sueña con  comprar mas carritos sangucheros para trabajar en otras zonas.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank El Pino. Maria is 37 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children ages 17, 7 and 3. All are in school. Maria has a business selling potato and sausage kebabs which she has been selling for two years. She sells her kebabs from a cart which she runs every night in a commercial zone. Maria needs a loan in the amount of $400 which she will invest in purchasing supplies for her business (disposable plates, bags) all at wholesale. Since she has been receiving loans, Maria has been able to produce more. She dreams of buying more carts so that she can work in other areas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her business such as disposable plates and bags.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho.
Olga es madre soltera, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo, Olga vive junto a sus padres en la comunidad de San Miguel de Ayacucho, que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Olga tiene una tienda en donde vende abarrotes, bebidas. Además Olga junto a sus padres se dedican a la agricultura de verduras.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, gaseosas, cerveza.
Los sueños de Olga son tener casa propia para brindar comodidad a su hijo y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the communal bank San Miguel de Ayacucho. She is 35 years old, she has one child and is a single mother. Olga lives with her parents in the community of San Miguel de Ayacucho which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Olga has a store where she sells groceries and drinks. In addition, Olga, along with her parents, dedicates herself to growing vegetables. Olga needs a loan in the amount of $500 which she will invest in purchasing sugar, soft drinks and beer. Olga's dreams are to have her own home so that she can provide comfort to her son and that her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho.
Teodora es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Teodora en la comunidad de Maizondo, que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Teodora se dedica a la agricultura de verduras variadas, dependiendo de la época y demanda del mercado, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Teodora necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y semillas.
Los sueños de Teodora son tener casa propia en la ciudad de Ayacucho y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the communal bank San Miguel de Ayacucho. Teodora lives with her partner. She is 44 years old and has five children. Teodora lives in the Maizondo community which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Teodora dedicates herself to growing a variety of vegetables, depending on the season and the market demand. She makes her sales at the market in the city of Ayacucho. Teodora needs a loan in the amount of $500 which she will invest in purchasing fertilizer and seeds. Teodora's dreams are to have her own home in the city of Ayacucho and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando H. R. is a member of a community bank called San Miguel de Ayacucho. He is married with five children. Orlando is a farmer and works daily on his vegetable farm. He will invest his loan of 900 soles into his land, to purchase soap, water and seeds. He is currently saving his money for potential problems he might have in the future. His dream is to have his children become professionals and to continue improving his business.

loans.use: He will invest his loan of 900 soles into his land, to purchase soap, water and seeds

loans.name: Domitilia

texts.en: Domitilia Lupe Lourenita is a member of a community bank called San Miguel de Ayacucho. She is a vegetable farmer and takes her vegetables to the market every day to sell. She will invest her loan of 1500 soles into her land and purchase seeds, soap and water. She is saving up for potential problems she might find in the future. She hopes to continue being successful in her current line of work as a farmer.

loans.use: She will invest her loan of 1500 soles into her land and purchase seeds, soap and water.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una persona  a la que le gusta luchar y que no se da por vencida fácilmente, madre de 4 hijos:   Armando de 18 años estudiante universitario; Uriel de 13 años estudiante de secundaria; Luís de 6 años estudiante de primaria y Marlen de 4 años estudiante de pre-primaria.
 El negocio lo comenzó su esposo en al año 1975, y trabajaba con varias editoriales. Al fallecer él en al año de 1993, aprovechando la cartera de clientes que existía y el contacto con las editoriales, ella decidió continuar  con el negocio al que él se dedicaba, que es la venta de libros de texto y guías para estudiantes, ya que es un negocio que  conocía y le gustaba, además  era una actividad que le permitiría estar mas tiempo con sus hijos para no descuidar su educación. Hoy en día mantiene un buen número de clientes, principalmente maestros de escuela primaria y secundaria.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir libros y surtir los pedidos que le hacen los maestros, ya que ellos necesitan estar actualizados con las guías de estudio y exámenes. Con tu apoyo ella podrá continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca is a person who loves to work hard and does not give in easily. She is the mother of 4 children: Armando, age 18, college student; Uriel, age 13, middle school student; Luis, age 6, elementary school student; and Marlen, age 4, pre-school student. Her husband started the business in 1975, and he worked with various publishers. Upon her husband’s death in 1993, Francisca took advantage of his established client-base and his publishing company contacts. She decided to continue with his business selling text books and student guides because it was a business in which she already had experience and which she liked. Furthermore, it was a business that would allow her to spend more time with her children so that she would not neglect their education. Today, she maintains a good number of customers, especially elementary and middle school teachers. She needs a loan of $10,000.00 Mexican pesos, which will be repaid in 6 months, in order to purchase books and fill the teachers’ orders because they need to stay current with their study guides. With your help, she will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase books

loans.name: Yitza Margarita

texts.es:
Doña  Yitza Margarita M. Q. tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada, esta Señora tiene un hijo de la edad de la edad de 18 años que esta cursando el 2 año de secundaria, también tiene un nieto a su cargo de la edad de 12 años y cursa el 2 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora de comerciante, los deseos que ella tiene son de sacar adelante a su hijo quien tiene problemas en el cerebro y cubrir los gastos que tiene de su enfermedad ya que los medicamentos  son muy caros  y el mejor medio de ayuda para ella es por este negocio por lo que la fundación le brindo la ayuda por medio de este crédito y tener así su línea de crédito.

Esta señora tiene la actividad económica de mercadería de ropa en  general  por lo que a sus clientes les ofrece los productos de: ropa para damas, para caballeros, sabanas, calcetines para caballeros, Doña Yitza tiene 4 años de tener su negocio, sus inicios comienzan por la idea de buscar un trabajo que le generara ingresos a su familia debido a que las ganancias que su esposo aportaba no eran las suficientes para sufragar los gastos de la casa así como los de su hijo y fue por esto que ella decide establecerse en su casa logrando atraer a sus clientes y ofrecerse la variedad de productos que ella dispone, el motivo del financiamiento es para invertir en su capital de trabajo ya que las compras las realizara en Managua donde tiene la posibilidad de comprar al por mayor y así recibir un promedio de ganancia mas alto y mantenerse en el mercado de una forma activa   y agradece el la oportunidad que fundación León 2000 le ha brindado por medio del financiamiento.
texts.en:
59-year old Doña Yitza Margarita M. Q. is married and has an 18-year old son who is in his second year of secondary school. She is also responsible for her 12-year old grandson who is in the second grade of primary school. Her partner is a businessman. Doña Yitza’s wishes are to see her son do well—he is mentally challenged--and to be able to cover the cost of his medications which are very expensive. Her main source of help is through her business which the Foundation is supporting through this loan and a line of credit. Doña Yitza’s business is selling clothing, and she offers her customers the following products: clothing for women and men, sheets, and men’s socks. She started the business four years ago with the idea of finding work that would bring in an income for her family, as the money that her husband earned was not enough to cover the household’s costs as well as those of her son. So she decided to set up a business in her home managing to attract customers and offer them a variety of products. The purpose of this loan is to provide capital so that she can make purchases in Managua at wholesale prices and thus earn a higher profit on what she sells. In this way she will maintain an active presence in the market. She is grateful for the opportunity that the León 2000 Foundation has given by providing her with financial assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Various Services Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn thị N. năm nay 45 tuổi Ms 01030004 là một phụ nữ rất năng động, hàng ngày chị làm nghề sửa chữa xe máy và chồng chị là thợ cắt tóc. Hiện tại chị có 2 con đi làm công nhân nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng khá ổn định từ 200.000VNđ/ ngày. Chị và nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua 2 chu kỳ đèu trả rất tốt, chị rất thích hình thức vay trả này vì nó giúp chị được trả dần, đồng thời tiết kiệm tiền để lo cho con cái chị có công việc làm ổn định. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua phụ tùng về bán và sửa chữa xe máy. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên như sau:
  Chị Đặng thị N. Ms 01030001 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh và sửa chữa điện thoại .
 Chị Lê thị Quý Ms 01030003 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng. 
 Chị Đặng thị ngọc Thanh Ms 01030005 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua đồ sửa chữa máy tính.
 Chị Nguyễn thị H. Ms 01030035 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh và bán nước giải khát.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Nguyen, 45 years old, is a hardworking woman. She works as a motorscooter mechanic and her husband works as a barber. Currently they have two children who are working as factory workers, so their income is relatively stable at 200,000 VND per day. She and the group has been participating in the Fund for two cycles, and have done well in repaying their loans. She very much enjoys this method of borrowing and repayment, since it allows her to repay slowly while saving money to care for her children and make sure they can work steadily. In this round of funding she registered to borrow 4,704,000 VND to buy equipment to fix and sell motorscooters. Her group also includes: Mrs. N. Thi Dang, borrowing 4,704,000 VND to do business in fixing telephones; Mrs. Quy Thi Le, borrowing 4,704,000 VND to do business buy running a breakfast service; Mrs. Ngoc Thanh Thi Dang, borrowing 4,704,000 VND to computer repair equipment; Mrs. Hoa Thi Nguyen, borrowing 4,704,000 VND to do business selling beverages.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: motorscooter repair, telephone/computer repair, breakfast/beverage sales

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Lan Group

texts.vi:
Bác Nguyễn thị L. năm nay 69 tuổi Ms 01030010, là một người tuổi đã cao nhưng sức khỏe rất tốt. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình cũng rất thuận lợi nhờ việc vào tính toán và điều hành công việc của bác. Hàng ngày gia đình bác kinh doanh tre, nứa, nên rất bận rộn. Vì vậy hàng ngày có con trai phụ bác bán hàng nhưng công việc kinh doanh rất tốt, nên bác phải thuê thêm 2 công nhân giúp bác trong việc bán hàng. Mức thu nhập của gia đình cũng khá thuận lợi thu nhập từ 180.000đ/ ngày. Bác cùng thành viên trong  nhóm rất thích hình thức vay trả này, vì được trả dần, đông thời tiết kiệm để có kế hoạch cho tương lai. Bác L. tham gia vay vốn qua 2 chu kỳ đều trả rất tốt, chu kỳ này bác đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để đầu tư vào việc kinh doanh. Các thành viên trong nhóm của bác như sau :
 Chị Nguyễn thị N. Ms 01030007 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua gạo làm bánh. 
 Chị Nguyễn thị C. Ms 01030008 vay mức 3.808.000VNđ để buôn bán. 
 Chị Lê thị N. Ms 01030024 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để bán giải khát. 
 Chị Nguyễn thị L. Ms 01030027 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để kinh doanh.
 Chị Nghiêm thị L. Ms 01030036 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để kinh doanh hàng điện tử.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi L. (ID Number 01030010) is 69 years old but still in good health. Her family's business runs smoothly thank to her management. Her family is busy selling bamboo everyday. The business is really good, so even though her son helps out, she still has to hire 2 more salemen. Her family's daily income is about 180,000VND. Other group members and her really like this method of repaying in installment, as they can slowly repay and still be able to save for the future. Mrs. L. borrowed twice from the Fund and repaid fully. This time, she would like to borrow 4,256,000VND to invest further in her business. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi N. (ID Number 01030007), borrows 4,704,000VND to purchase rice to make cakes.
  • Mrs. N. Thi C. (ID Number 01030008), borrows 3,808,000VND to do business.
  • Mrs. Le Thi Ngan (ID Number 01030024), borrows 4,256,000VND to sell drinks.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Lien (ID Number 01030027), borrows 4,256,000VND to do business.
  • Mrs. Nghiem Thi L. (ID Number 01030036), borrows 4,256,000VND to sell electronic products.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling bamboo

loans.name: Fahim

texts.en:
Fahim Q., 25 is married but he doesn't yet have any children. He studied up through grade 10 and he lives in Jalalabad city, Behsod Meran village. He is a hard worker. He was working as a tinsmith before he began working with his uncle and now he has his own shop.

Fahim has four brothers and four sisters. They live all together in their own small house in the village. His one brother is studying in the public school in Jalalabad city and three others are small. Fahim wants to expand his business because his income is not enough for his whole household and he wants to take a loan in the amount of 50,000 AF (US$ 1075) as an individual loan from AFSG.

So he is requesting AFSG to give him this individual loan for 18 months. That way, he can buy necessary inventory for his shop. He says that small loans are a good way for poor people to make a change in their lives, thanks to Kiva. It is good to provide these loans for poor people in the developing countries. Thanks once again Kiva!

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Mr. Khoeun K. is a villager in Prey Run village in Takeo Province. He is president of his village. His wife, Mrs. Nup Net, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land so she can cultivate rice. In order to plant her crops, she always hires a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. So Mr. Khoeun K. is requesting a loan buy buffalo for breeding and to plow his field which will reduce his expenses. Mr. Khoeun K. is 32 years old and the father of three children who are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To purchase buffalo for breeding and to plow his field

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mrs. Khom K. is a villager in Prey Run village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Because her field is infertile soil and she does not have much money to hire a laborer to support her production, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and hire a laborer to support her field to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Chan Soern, is a construction worker. Mrs. Khom K. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire a laborer to make her crops more productive

loans.name: Ngi

texts.en: Mrs. Ngi C. was born in 1988 and lives in Pour Dos village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Chiev Deng, is a motorbike driver. Even though, Mrs. Ngi C.’s family members have different businesses, they still do not earn enough money to save for a better living condition. Mrs. Ngi C. is requesting a loan to buy cow for breeding and to expand her business. This will increase her income. She is a mother of child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding and to expand business.

loans.name: Maria Lídia

texts.pt:
Maria Lídia C. é natural de Maputo e tem 45 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 15, 12, 10 e 5 anos respectivamente. Todos ainda estudantes e Apenas sustenta os filhos.

Maria Lídia estudou até 4ªclasse e parou quando se juntou, desde a infância até ao casamento sempre viveu com os pais aos 19 anos se juntou, o marido é mineiro trabalhando na africa do sul.

Maria dedica se ao negocio de venda de frangos, trabalhando sozinha. Ela aprendeu com um primo a 6 anos atrás, compra pintos por 16,00mt e vende por 90,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 4000,00mt. Vive numa casa própria. Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva.

Maria tem planos para futuro construir mais aviários e ampliar o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo, Mozambique, Maria Lídia C., 45, is married and has four children (ages 15, 12, 10 and 5), all enrolled in school. Her studies were interrupted after 4th grade. She lived with her parents until the age of 19, when she got married. Her husband works as a miner, in South Africa. In order to help support the family, she started a poultry raising business--an activity she learned 6 years ago, from a cousin, and does on her own. She currently buys baby chicks for 16,00 and sells the adult chicken for 90,00 mt. Her monthly profit is of 4000,00 mt. This is her first with Hluvuku and Kiva, and she will use it to buy more baby chicks. In the future, she hopes to be able to build more chicken coops to grow her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy C. is a villager in Trapaing Soam village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Mrs. Sophy C. is requesting a loan to buy pig foods and seven piglets so she can expand her business and increase her income. Her husband, Mr. Om Vasna, is a farmer. She is 36 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, four other children are attending the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase pig foods and seven piglets to expand her business

loans.name: Maly

texts.en: Mrs. Maly N., born in 1966 and living in Trapaing Soam Village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who cultivates rice for a living. Despite the fact that her husband, Mr. Phoun Sophy, is a construction worker, they still do not have enough money to support adequate living conditions, so Maly is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach C., who lives in Sambour Village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Nhoem Lor, is a fish paste seller who does not have a motorbike of his own and so always hires one to sell his product. Therefore, Thach is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to help his business.

She is 35 years old and the mother of five children, two employed in a garment factory, one attending the local school, and two who are yet too young to study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to help her husband’s business.

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Voeun Srey was born in 1970 and now lives in Trapaing Thmor Village in Takeo Province where she and her husband, Mr. Pream Mam, are farmers who own a piece of land upon which they cultivate rice for a living. They have five children, one a garment factory, another a construction worker, and three others students at the local school.

Since their first child’s workplace is far from home, Voeun is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for that child to commute to work in order to reduce transportation expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra N. est détentrice d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Womé, un village situé à environ 10 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 39 ans, Abra est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle souhaite augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des cartons de savons, de boîtes de conserves, des sacs de riz et autres marchandises. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients et de gagner plus d’argent pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abra N'kutia is the owner of a general goods store in Womé, a village located about 10 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Abra is 39 years old, married and the mother of two (2) children. She is hoping to increase the size of her business by buying cartons of soap, boxes of preserves, sacks of rice and other merchandise. This would allow her to meet the needs of her customers and earn more money to improve the conditions of her family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey C., 34, and her husband, Mr. Sam-ang Om, 35, live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1993 and have two children: one son and one daughter who are in school.

Mrs. Srey has been weaving for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her neighbors when she was thirteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been farming for sixteen years. He grows cucumbers and tomatoes in his farmland.

Srey is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase thread and silk for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase thread and silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Torng

texts.en:
A resident of Sleng Koung Village in Takeo Province, Mrs. Torng M. is a 49-year-old farmer who owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Ouk Yet, presented on the right in the photo, is a construction worker. She is the mother of four children, one a garment factory worker, another a rice trader, another a construction worker and the fourth a student at the local school.

Even though the family members have various livelihoods, they do not have enough money for adequate living conditions. Therefore, with the hope of improving their income, Torng is requesting a loan to buy rice to resell.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy E., 47, and her husband, Mr. Seng Sun, 52, live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1979, and have four children; three sons and one daughter. The oldest son is a soldier, two are weavers, and the youngest son is in school.

Mrs. Savy has been a silk weaver since 1985, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She also buys them from other villagers to sell in other provinces. Her husband is a school principal. She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha C., a 42-year-old farmer in Oskoern Village in Takeo Province, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Chhin Chhoern, works in construction far from his house, thereby incurring high transportation costs. In order to reduce those costs, Sokha is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband’s commute.

Sokha is the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other two are yet too young to study. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband’s commute.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan P., 53, and her husband, Mr. Sokhem Ros, 56, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1979, and have six children; three sons and three daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. Other two children are in school. One daughter is a silk weaver and one son has full time employment in Phnom Penh.

Nan has been weaving for over thirty years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a mechanic who repairs machines and also repairs bicycles.

Nan is requesting a loan of $500 to buy silk and thread for weaving and to purchase bicycle spare parts for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy silk and thread for weaving and to purchase bicycle spare parts for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Il habite à Womé, un petit village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Afi est revendeuse des ustensiles de cuisine et des plastiques. Elle aimerait accroître son commerce en achetant plus de marchandises pour la revente.
texts.en:
Afi A., 42, is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Womé, a little village situated northwest of Lomé, the Togolese capital. Afi sells kitchen utensils and plastic articles. She would like to grow her business by buying more merchandise to re-sell.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying plastic items and kitchen utensils for re-sale

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. Thou Some, born in 1965 and residing in Toul Tror Village in Takeo Province, is a grocer who currently lacks sufficient funds to buy more goods to continue her selling. She is therefore requesting a loan to make those purchases, hoping to thereby increase her income and improve her living conditions.

Thou is the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Aung Sarin, presented on the left in the photo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice to earn a living.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S. (in picture with her daughter), 45, and her husband, Mr. Chhean S., 47, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1985 and have six children; one son and five daughters. One of their daughters is married, two children are in school, one daughter is a silk weaver, and one son is a horse-cart driver.

Sophal has been a silk weaver since she was young but has transferred her loom to her daughter while she spins threads for her daughter. Her daughter sells the finished products to the middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Chhean has been a boat builder for over ten years.

Sophal is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a horse for her son's horse-cart and to purchase silk materials for her daughter's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for her son's horse-cart and to purchase silk materials for her daughter weaving.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarun O., a resident of Trapaing Chhouk Village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upO. which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. O. Veak, is a palm juice collector. In order to increase family income and improve their living conditions, Sarun is requesting a loan to buy cement and hire laborers to build a piggery to start a new business. 

Sarum is 34 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented O. the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy cement and hire laborers to build a piggery to start a new business.

loans.name: Ae

texts.en:
Mrs. Ae T., 42, and her husband, Mr. Yun Leang, 45, live on an island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three of their daughters weave silk, two sons study in a local school, and the youngest daughter is still young and stays at home.

Ae has been farming and raising pigs for over ten years. She grows vegetables in her farmland. Her husband has been a mason since 1990. Besides construction work, he also does farming as well.

Ae is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her three daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her daughters' weaving.

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Mrs. Nai C., 41, and her husband, Mr. Buntha Chem, 37, live a long National Road Number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1993, and have four children; two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are in school and other two children stay at home.
 
Nai is a fruits pickler and fresh fruit seller. She sells many type of pickled fruit such as mangoes, jujubes, and other types of Cambodian fruits. She buys fresh fruit from the market, pickles it, and sells it in front of a garment factory near her village. Her husband is a taxi driver. He needs to repair his taxi but lacks the money.

Therefore, Nai is requesting a loan of $1000 to repair and purchase wheels for her husband’s taxi.

loans.use: To purchase new wheels and to repair her husband’s taxi.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo E. est revendeuse des bassines et  ustensiles de cuisines à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Pour accroître la capacité de son commerce afin de répondre aux besoins de se clients sont les raisons qui motivent Adzo à bénéficier de ce crédit. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adzo E., 42, sells basins and kitchen utensils in Womé, a village situated about 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is married and the mother of 4 children. Growing the capacity of her business and meeting the needs of her customers are the reasons that motivate Adzo to take advantage of receiving a loan. This opportunity will permit her to better support her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of basins, kitchen utensils, and ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mr. Chhon S. is a villager in Chrouy Pisey village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. In his plantation, he faces some problems because he does not have much money to spend on his fields. Thus, Mr. Chhon S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds and corn seeds. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan.

His wife, Mrs. Cheng Soeun, is a salesperson in the market. Mr. Chhon S. is 51 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other three are attending the local school. Both spouses are in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds  and corn seeds

loans.name: Nuch

texts.en:
Mr. Nuch K., a resident of Pour Dus Village in Kandal Province, is a rice seller who buys the commodity from other people. Because he currently lacks sufficient funds to support his business, he is requesting a loan to buy additional rice. He hopes to thereby increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

Nuch is 42 years old and the father of three children who are attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Soum Keo, presented on the left in the photo, is a tailor.

loans.use: To buy rice for his business.

loans.name: Akos

texts.fr: Akos N. est une revendeuse ambulante de pagnes à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 22 ans, Akos est une célibataire et exerce cette activité bientôt 2 ans. Elle désire par ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant plus de pagnes et aussi louer un magasin pour l’exposition de ses marchandises
texts.en:
Akos N., 22, is an ambulant salesperson in Womé, a village situated about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Akos is single and she has been selling "pagnes" (brightly colored lengths of African cloth that are used as sarongs, head wraps etc.) for almost 2 years. She would like to use this loan to grow her business by buying more "pagnes" and also to rent a store where she could display her wares.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase more "pagnes" and rent a store

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal T., a resident of Tboung Kdey Village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice for a living. Currently facing the problems of infertile land and low working capital, he is requesting a loan to purchase both fertilizers and rice seed.

Kosal is 43 years old and the father of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another four are attending the local school; the remaining two children are yet too young to study. His wife, Mrs. Mech Kam, presented on the right in the photo, is a tailor.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chukwudi

texts.en: O. Chukwudi is 33 years old and married with a child. Chukwudi sells video CDs and DVD plates. He started this business in 2005. His store is located at Oba market in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. The location of his store is convenient for his large number of customers. Chukwudi needs a loan of 140,000 N to purchase more video CDs and DVD plates to sell. Chukwudi is very grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more video CDs and DVD plates to sell

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng C., 48, started her grocery selling over one year ago out of her home in the area of Taskor Village. She currently earns approximately US$ 3 each day. She cares for five children, two of whom are working, and one other is married and living separately.

Her husband, Mr. Hok Luy, 47, is a fisherman. Recently, C. sold groceries till her store was empty and she wants re-stock the store. Hence she has decided to ask for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more groceries to sell. They all live in Sarikakao Commune, Kandal Province. The loan will help to increase their revenue to adequately support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry S., born in 1962 and a resdent of Boeng Village in Kandal Province, is a grocer currently facing the problem of low working capital. In order to solve this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery goods to replenish her inventory. She hopes to thereby increase income and improve her family’s living conditions.

Ry is the mother of a child employed in a garment factory while her husband, Mr. Doung Oul, presented on the right in the photo, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells drinks, provisions and foodstuffs like rice and beans from her shop. The demand for her foodstuffs is high. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time and is seeking a loan of 52,000 N to purchase more merchandise to sell. She is 66 years old and married with 12 children; she has a large extended family. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en:
Mr. Yoen P. and his wife Mrs. Chen Chea, who live in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province, are farmers cultivating rice to earn a living. Due to field infertility and low working capital, Yoen is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and petroleum for the farm pump.

Yoen P. is 64 years old and the father of seven children, three employed in a garment factory while others two are farmers and another two children are at home. His wife is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy seeds of rice, fertilizers, and petroleum.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther J. is a tailor who makes various designs for her customers. Esther is happy because the demands for her tailoring services will be high during the upcoming festive season. She is 37 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of 32,000 N to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang Y. is a villager in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal Province. She is a fruit seller as a way to earn her living. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some fruit to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Sacnh Mao, is a blacksmith who earns only a very small salary. Mrs. Eang Y. is 39 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other two children are too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some fruit to expand her business

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhorn Y., who lives in Moen Tra Village in Kandal Province, is a motorbike taxi driver. Because his motorbike is old, he is requesting a loan to get a new one. He hopes to thereby increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

Sokhorn is 41 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Sen Narith, presented on the right in the photo, is employed in a garment factory making only a small salary.

loans.use: To replace his old motorbike.

loans.name: Saong

texts.en: Mr. Saong S. was born in 1959 and now lives in the Steung village in Kandal Province. He earns income breeding pigs. His wife, S. Nouv, works in a grocery store. The couple has five children, one of whom works in a beauty salon, two others are grocers, while another two are still students. Currently, Mr. S. needs financial support to maintain and develop his pig-breeding business. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy food and medicine for the pigs in his farm. Mr. S. hopes to thereby improve the productivity of his business and, consequently, increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase of food and medicine for pigs

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix O. is 32 years old. He is married without a child. Felix sells foam and carpets of various colors out of his store which is open from 7:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily. Felix is determined to lift his business and family out of poverty. To this end, he needs a loan amount of 102,000 N to purchase more carpets and foam to sell. He says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foam and carpets to sell

loans.name: Kosar Khadim Hussain Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of K. H. and resides in the city of Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn is famous among travelers for its holy places and tombs. Kosar baji owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 40 years. Kosar baji’s husband is a property dealer. She is the mother of six children: four daughters and two sons. Her four youngest children don’t currently have employment. Her eldest two daughters help her embroider dresses that she sells in a boutique. She has been in the clothing business for the past six years, and she is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, cloth, and colored thread) to increase her output and business profits.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wholesale candies to sell. Kalsoom Mai baji wants a loan to buy thread to knit clothing to sell. Khurhseed baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell, and Mukhtayar baji wants a loan to buy video cassettes to sell. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Sok Kong Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan requested by three people. Mr. Sok K. is 35 years old and makes a living selling fish. He buys them at a local dock and then goes from village selling what he has bought. Sok is married to Mrs. Soklai K., 38, who also sells fish. The couple has two children, one of whom is student, while the other works as a security guard in Phnom Penh City. Both husband and wife have been in the fish-selling business for three years and are applying for a $150 loan to buy more inventory to sell. 

Sok leads a group with two other members. Mr. Pech C. is 45 years old, makes a living as a farmer and has applied for a $125 loan to go into the business of selling fish. Mrs. Chhunleang K., 31, is rice farmer and is applying for a $125 loan to buy fertilizer. 

All three members of this group live in Tongrong Commune, Kompong Cham Province.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell and fertilizer for a farm

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoun P. is 27 years old and lives in the Ang village in Kandal Province. She earns income cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Nget Heng, is a fisherman. The couple has two children who are still students and attend the local school. Mrs. Ngoun P.'s husband currently faces financial difficulties and needs help to maintain his business. Therefore, Mrs. Ngoun P. has applied for a loan to help her husband buy a boat and fishing nets. She hopes that Mr. Nget Heng will thereby be able to make more income, and that their family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: Purchase of a boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen Owuozo lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Helen is 34 years old; she is married with four children. Helen owns a boutique in Oba market where she sells bags, shoes and jewelry. Her clientele consists mostly of women. She sells lovely shoes and bags in many colors that keep her customers demanding more. She needs the loan amount of 102,000 N to purchase more shoes, bags, and jewelry to sell. Helen is determined to retain her customers by stocking her store with all that her customers need. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra T. est une revendeuse de poissons à Wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Mariée et mère de 3 enfants, Abra détient cette activité depuis 2 ans et espère relancer son commerce par ce crédit. Elle souhaite s’approvisionner auprès des gros fournisseurs afin de pouvoir augmenter sa marge commerciale. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abra T. sells fish in Wome, a village situated northwest of Lomé, the Togolese capital. Married and the mother of 3 children, Abra has been involved in this activity for 2 years and hopes to reinvigorate her business with this loan. She hopes to buy from wholesalers so as to increase her profit margin. This opportunity will permit her to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fish wholesale for re-sale

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn C. is 51 years old. She is a widow and currently lives in the Thom village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Yorn C. makes a living cultivating rice on a piece of land that she owns. She has four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the fourth one is attending the local school. Even though most of Mrs. Yorn C.’s family members are employed, they do not earn enough to cover the family's basic expenses. Therefore, Mrs. Yorn C. needs to take out a loan to help pay for repairs to the family's house.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Savin

texts.en: Mrs. Savin S. is 24 years old, married, and has two little children. She lives in the Ampil village in Kandal Province and earns a living cultivating vegetables on a small piece of land that she owns. Mrs. Savin S.'s husband, Mr. Chhoen San, is a fisherman. Even though both of them are employed, the couple's combined income is still not enough to both cover the basic living expenses and pay for repairs to their house. Therefore, Mrs. Savin S. is currently asking for a loan to be able to buy equipment for repairing the family's house.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for house repair

loans.name: Chantra

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantra P. is a villager in Sdouv Kanleng village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Bou Vin, are fishermen to earn their living. They face some problems with their business because they do not have much money to buy equipment for their fishing.

Mrs. Chantra P. has decided to request a loan to buy a boat and fishnets for her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 39 years old and she does not have any children yet. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishnets

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline O. is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells eggs in wholesale and retail. She sells eggs at Olomuza market in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. The demand for eggs in Nigeria is high because eggs are affordable and rich in protein. Roseline loves her egg business. She needs the loan amount of 102,000 N to purchase more eggs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz Bano Rauf Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz bano baji is the wife of R. A. and resides the city of Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn city is famous among travelers for its holy places and tombs. Shahnaz baji completed her education till 5th standard, after which point she stopped her education as her family couldn’t afford it. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son has a power loom machine (used to make clothes) and sells clothing in the market. Her younger son and her daughter are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Shahnaz baji’s husband is a transit driver and operates a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shahnaz baji herself has a knitting business. She knits clothes and sells them in markets to earn a profit. She has already successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. Shaista baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy clothing for their knitting businesses. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy cooking oil, lentils, rice, and spices for her Punjabi food business. And Shamim baji wants a loan to buy plastic shopping bags to resell. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin O. is 42 years old and married with 6 children. Toyin sells drinks wholesale and retail. She has a store where she sells these drinks to her customers. She is a hardworking woman. She needs the loan amount of N61,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Phoen

texts.en: Mr. Phoen C. is 39 years old, married, and has four children who all attend a local school. The family lives in the Trapaing Chrey village in Kandal Province. Mr. Phoen C. is a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Yan Nhey, is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables on a small piece of land that she owns. Unfortunately, her business has suffered from problems related to the low fertility of the soil and the large amount of pests that inhabit the area and damage the crops. In order to deal with these problems, Mr. Phoen C. is now asking for a loan to be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make his wife's agriculture business more productive.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides to increase agricultural productivity

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima A. is 30 years old and married with 3 children. Fatima sells foodstuffs and baby things. She sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, garri, etc. Her store is located at the front of her house on Textile Mill Road, Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Fatima is a client of LAPO [Kiva's Field Partner]. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and baby things to sell. She wants to expand her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and to LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and baby things to sell

loans.name: Azra Mai Abdul Razaq Group

texts.en:
Azra Mai baji is the wife of A. R. and resides in a city named Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn city is famous for its holy places and tombs. People often go there to visit these places. She is the mother of one son whose name is Akbar Suleman. His age is 16 and he does not have a job or go to school.

Azra baji’s husband and she are involved in a business of knitting clothes. They started this business in the past 15 years. First they started taking orders within their community and then they started taking orders from outside the community. Azra baji is applying for a loan to buy knitting tools and thread to fill the orders of their customers.

She is joined in her loan group by another member. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy material (clothes, colored thread, and sketches) to make embroidered dresses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed between the two group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other member is responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for knitting clothes

loans.name: Sroe

texts.en: Mrs. Sroe C. is 41 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another two attend a local school, while the youngest one is still too young to study. The family lives in the Trapaing Chrey village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sroe C. earns income as a farmer: she cultivates rice on a piece of land that she owns. Her agricultural business, however, is facing difficulties due to the low fertility of the soil and the large amount of pests that damage the rice crops. She is therefore asking for a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to increase the productivity of her business.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides to improve agricultural productivity

loans.name: Shams Ilahi M.akram Sajid Group

texts.en:
Shams Ilahi baji is the wife of M. S. and lives in the city of Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn city is famed among travelers for its holy places and tombs. She has been living in this city for the past 25 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son is a daily wage laborer, and her youngest son is a property dealer. Shams baji’s husband is retired. Shams baji herself has a clothing business. She buys clothing from different markets and nearby cities and then sells them in Shah Rukn. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy more clothing to sell and expand her business.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by three other members. Safia baji also wants a loan to buy more clothing to sell. Bashir baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell, and Kosar baji wants a loan to buy rice, lentils, cooking oil, and spices for her Punjabi food (Dal Chawal) selling business. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en: Mrs. Yom L. was born in 1952 and now lives in the Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Lunh Leng, have five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another one works as a construction worker, while the other three are attending a local school. Mrs. Yom L. and her husband are both farmers who cultivate rice and vegetables on a plot of land that they own. With the combined revenue, however, they still cannot cover the family's basic expenses, especially now that one of their children is sick. Therefore, Mrs. Yom L. is asking for a loan to be able to buy medicine for her child.

loans.use: Purchase of medicine

loans.name: Tasleem M.ashiq Group

texts.en:
Tasleem baji is the wife of M.Ashiq and resides in the city of Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn city is famous among travelers for its holy places and tombs. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 25 years. She is the mother of one daughter, aged four, who attends kindergarten. Tasleem baji’s husband has a grocery shop in the community. Tasleem baji herself has been selling knit clothing for the past 15 years. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy more knit clothing to expand her business.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. Fahmida baji wants a loan to buy spare vehicle parts to sell. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. And two women named Bashiran baji each want a loan to buy sketches, beads, and colored thread for their decorative embroidery businesses. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more knit clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera O. is 48 years old and married with 7 children. She is a client of LAPO [Kiva's Field Partner] and a leader of a lending group under LAPO microfinance. Vera sells yams and palm oil. She has been in this business for a long time. Vera has so many customers because yams and palm oil are essential foodstuffs that are used on a daily basis in Nigeria. Vera needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more yams and palm oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Khursheed Khursheed Ahmad Group

texts.en:
K. baji is the wife of K. A. and lives in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine of great Punjabi Sufi poet, Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkar. K. baji has been living in this city for the past 10 years. She is the mother of five sons. Her two eldest sons are transit drivers and operate auto-rickshaws (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The youngest three are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. K. baji’s husband is a watchman. K. baji herself sells milk and has been in this business for the past two years. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk selling business.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy wheat and flour to sell. Ameena baji and Isran baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk selling businesses, and Gulzaran baji wants a loan to buy blankets to sell. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo ro expand her milk selling business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael O. is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. Rachael is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She sells cooked foods like rice, beans, garri, etc.  Her customers love her cooked foods. In the future Rachael hopes to build a lodge where travelers can sleep and eat. She needs the loan amount of N81,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell and also to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Iziengbe

texts.en: Iziengbe I. is 34 years old and married with one child. Iziengbe is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She sells foodstuffs like garri, cocoa yam, beans, rice, etc. at Ikpoba Hill market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Iziengbe has been in this business of selling foodstuffs since 2004. She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes that this Kiva loan will enhance her business and family life. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.fr: Marissa A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuses des légumes depuis 5 ans à Wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit de FECECAV, madame Marissa désire se ravitailler afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Cette chance lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marissa A. is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three. She has been a retailer of vegetables for five years in Wome, a village located northwest of Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this FECECAV loan, Ms. Marissa would like to be resupplied in order to respond better to customer needs. This opportunity will enable her to earn more money to care for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs at Ugbiokho market in Benin City. She sells foodstuffs like beans, dried pepper, rice, tomatoes paste, etc. Gloria has lots of customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE (Kiva's Field Partner) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian O. sells beef at Ugbiokho market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She started this beef business in 2001. Marian says that selling beef is a good business. She has a table where she sells beef at the market. Her customers are mostly women because women in Nigeria do a lot of cooking. She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more beef from the abattoir to sell in the market. She is 41 years old and married with 6 children. She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner) and a leader of a lending group under LAPO microfinance. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Conciliant ses études coraniques à une activité génératrice de revenu en l’occurrence la couture, Assitan est de nos jours un maître tailleur couturier confirmée et reconnue. Après dix ans d’expériences elle jouit d’une notoriété et d’une réputation sans égale dans la ville de Ségou.
