Elle est une femme divorcée de 35 ans qui vit dans la famille paternelle avec son enfant adoptif et plusieurs autres de ses parents dans le quartier Missira de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après une formation en couture auprès de l’organisation non gouvernementale Mali Enjeux, elle décida d’ouvrir un atelier de coupe et de couture ou elle forme aujourd’hui une vingtaine de jeunes filles. Bien qu’elle ne soit pas une styliste reconnue toutes les dames de Ségou rêvent de porter les habits confectionnés dans l’atelier de Assitan D.. 
Pour agrandir son activité, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) avec une association de son quartier, tous correctement bien remboursés elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Ce prêt servira à acheter, une machine à coudre supplémentaire pour son atelier. Cette machine permettra d’augmenter la production et de respecter les délais de livraison. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes de tout age.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte avoir un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui lui permettra d’agrandir son activité et de subvenir à ses propres dépenses et de son enfant adoptif (qui fut abandonné devant son atelier par sa mère biologique).
texts.en:
Reconciling her Koranic studies with income-generating work, in this case, sewing, Assitan is these days a confirmed and renown master seamstress. After ten years of experience, she enjoys unmatched fame and reputation in the city of Ségou. She is a 35-year-old divorced woman who lives in her father's house with her adopted child and several other relatives in the Missira district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After getting training in sewing from the non-governmental organization Mali Enjeux, she decided to open a fashions workshop, where today she is training over twenty girls. Even though she is not a recognized stylist, all the women of Ségou dream of wearing clothing made in her workshop of Assitan D.. To expand her business, she is turning to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After three solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid with an association in her district, she is on her second individual loan. This loan will serve to buy an added sewing machine for her shop. This machine will enable her to increase her production and to meet delivery deadlines. Her customers are composed of men and women of all ages. With this loan, she intends to make a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will allow her to expand her business and to cover her own expenses as well as those of her adopted child (who was abandoned in front of her shop by his biological mother).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace Y. is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Grace is a fashion designer. She makes lovely Nigerian clothes for her customers. She has some girls that assist her in designing clothes. She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell to her customers and also to use in designing the clothes of her customers. She has a store where she sews clothes. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to use and sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith E. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Faith is a fashion designer. She makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. Faith also sells clothes to her customers. She has a store where she sells clothes and also sews clothes. She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Faith is grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE (Kiva's Field Partner) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate O. is 43 years old and married with 5 children. Kate lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells eggs and chicken. She has been in this business for a long time. Kate loves this business because she makes a lot of profit from it. She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more eggs and chicken to sell. She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She expresses her appreciation to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and chicken to sell

loans.name: Sharifan M.ashiq Group

texts.en:
Sharifan baji is the wife of M. and resides in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine of great Punjabi Sufi poet, Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkar. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. She has no children. Sharifan baji’s husband has had a mobile phone selling business for the past two years. He buys mobile phones from a big market named “Hall Road,” and then resells them. Sharifan baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy more mobile phones for her husband’s phone shop.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own businesses. G. Fatima baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. Parveen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy bicycles for her bicycle selling business, and Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil, and spices for her food business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones for their phone business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie O. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, plantains, eba, etc. She wakes up by 5:30am everyday to start cooking her foodstuffs to sell. She has so many customers. She needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Itohan O. is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks, and she also has a salon. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sueto

texts.fr: Sueto D. est une dynamique commerçante. Elle est revendeuse de produits génériques depuis 3 ans. Agée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Avec ce crédit, Sueto espère relancer son commerce en augmentant ses achats et en louant un magasin pour l’exposition de ses marchandises. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Sueto D. is an energetic shopkeeper, a retailer of generic pharmaceutical products for three years. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who are all in school. With this loan, Sueto hopes to reinvigorate her business by increasing her purchases and leasing a store for showing her products. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and lease a store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She owns a bakery where she bakes bread to supply to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more bakery materials to bake more loaves of bread to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE (Kiva's Field Partner) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more bakery materials to bake more bread to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen I. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She sells provisions in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She also sells clothes and jewelry. She travels to the North to purchase clothes and jewelry to sell in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more provisions, clothes and jewelry to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine A. is 42-years-old, married and has four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells basic foodstuffs like rice, beans, garri and yams. Josephine enjoys her business and would like to expand. With a loan from Kiva, she will purchase more food products to sell. She appreciates those lenders who will make her goal possible.

loans.use: To purchase more basic food products to resell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32-years-old, married and has four children. She has been very proactive in creating her business of selling kerosene to local people for use in their homes.

Josephine made a holding tank by fixing a pumping machine and writing “Kerosene for Sale” on the tank. She sells each liter for 64 naira (which is about 55 cents) and makes about ten cents of gross profit per liter. It takes a lot of time to get to a gas station to buy kerosene, which is why local households patronize her business.

Josephine is limited financially in her ability to purchase large quantities of kerosene that will fill her 7,000 liter tank, thus her reason for requesting the loan. She appreciates all of the people that help make this possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. owns a restaurant in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She buys the ingredients to cook her prepared foods for the restaurant from a local market in Benin City. Mary is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of those ingredients. She also hopes to open an additional restaurant in the future.

Mary is 37-years-old and is married with a child. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for preparing food for her restaurant

loans.name: Geoffery

texts.en: Geoffery A., 35, sells basic home provisions like toothpaste and detergent in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He is requesting the loan to purchase more of these products to sell to his customers. He thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINACE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more basic provisions to sell to customers

loans.name: Chukwuma

texts.en: N. Chukwuma is 34-years-old, married and has four children. He sells provisions like toothpaste, noodles and bathing soap. He is requesting a loan to purchase more basic provisions to sell to his customers. He thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell to customers

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en: M. Ifeanyi is 29-years-old and single. He has been selling basic home provisions like bathing soaps, toothpaste, brushes and detergents since 2000. He is requesting a loan to purchase more products to sell in his store. M. hopes to be a major distributor in the future. He thanks all of the people that will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more basic provisions for resale

loans.name: Chukwujekwu

texts.en: Chukwujejekwu E.,34, is a happy man who is married with three children. He sells flooring, including carpets and foam. The demand for his products are high. He is requesting a loan to increase his inventory of flooring products. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more carpet and foam for resale

loans.name: Osasogie

texts.en: A. Osasogie is 3-years-old, married and has five children. Her children are all in school. She sells drinks and provisions such as toothpaste, detergent, bathing soap and noodles. She is requesting a loan amount to increase her inventory of products for resale. She thanks all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more household provisions and drinks for resale

loans.name: Sherifat

texts.en: O. Sherifat, 39, lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria with her husband and two children. She is a newspaper vendor. O. is requesting a loan to purchase more newspapers to sell to her various customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more newspapers for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M., 68, sells sarongs and homemade ice cream at the local market. Her daughter-in-law assists her in making the ice cream at her home. She has been in this business for the past two years. Sarah is married and has three children.

She is requesting the loan to purchase more sarongs and ingredients for making ice cream. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for ice cream and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary O. started her business in 2004, selling rechargeable phone cards and owning a phone booth where she makes phone calls for customers. Rosemary also does pedicures and manicures for her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rechargeable phone cards for resale. Rosemary is 25-years-old, married and has two children. She thanks all people that will make her loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards for resale

loans.name: Nayah Odilia

texts.en:
Odilia lives in Bamenda, Cameroon, with her husband. She supports her five children with her street grocery stall. With her loan she will purchase engine oil, kerosene, bananas, sugar cane, oranges, papaya, and watermelon. She intends to contribute 25,000 CFA ($50 USD) of her savings towards her business.

She is confident that her polite and welcoming manner will mean that her customers will continue to purchase her items. Odilia is well presented and proud of her clean premises. With the profits from this loan, Odilia will reinvest in her business, help to pay her children’s school fees, support her husband in his business, and help her daughter to start a business.

This is Odilia’s second loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since 2007. Odilia is happy to be taking out a loan with GHAPE as they have educated her on how to use her money, while still providing her with a low interest rate. She hopes to pay her loan quicker than the loan term so that she can continue to increase her loan amount with GHAPE.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Engine oil, kerosene, bananas, sugar cane, oranges, papaya, watermelon

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Miriam vende pescado los días sábados y domingos en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada fin de semana. Además Miriam junto a su esposo tienen una cebichería en la casa de sus suegros, la atención es todos los días.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescados y para la mejora de su local.
Los sueños de Miriam son tener un local propio, construir su casa y tener una cadena de cebicherías.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the communal bank Totorilla. She is 32 years old and lives with her partner and three children. Miriam sells fish on Saturdays and Sundays at the fish market in the city of Ayacucho. She acquires her products in Lima where she travels to every weekend. Miriam also has a "cebicheria" with her husband which is located in her in-laws' home and which requires her daily attention. Miriam needs a loan in the amount of $425 which she will invest in the purchase of fish and in improving her stall. Miriam's dreams are to have her own stall, to build her home and to have a chain of cebicherias.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish and improve her stall.

loans.name: Manka Florance

texts.en:
Florance has a successful firewood business, is married with one child, and lives in Alakuma, just outside Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in a motorbike and purchase more firewood. She has taken out loans in the past to sell firewood which she purchases outside of town and sells to her community. The motorbike will be used as a taxi in the area. She has already found a driver for her bike that will pay her at the end of each day. Bikes are one of the most efficient forms of transport in and around Bamenda. The roads are poor so bikes are able to move quickly and suffer less damage than cars. She will continue her firewood business for extra income. With the profit from this loan, Florance plans to build her family a house and support her family's medical needs. She is confident she will be able to repay the loan as she has done in the past. This is Florance's fourth loan with GHAPE since she joined in 2004.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Motorbike, firewood, seedlings

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Marina es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Marina vive en la comunidad de Totorilla, en donde se dedica a la agricultura de verduras en especial culantro, perjil, en algunas oportunidades alquila terrenos para sembrar, sus productos los vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una chacra.
Marina sueña con construir su casa, tener un negocio estable, una tienda.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the communal bank of Totorilla. She is married, is 35 years old and has four children. Marina lives in the Totorilla community where she dedicates herself to growing vegetables especially cilantro and parsley. When she has the opportunity, she rents land to grow vegetables. She sells her products at the market in the city of Ayacucho. Marina needs a loan in the amount of $825 which she will invest on the partial payment of a farm. Marina dreams of building her home, having a stable business and a store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment on a farm.

loans.name: Ângela

texts.pt:
Ângela N. natural de Marrumeu um dos distritos da província de Sofala uma das províncias centrais de Moçambique. Tem 39 anos e é separada, mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 14, 12 e 9 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Ângela estudou até 10ªclasse e parou quando se juntou, aos 8 anos mudou se da província de Sofala para Maputo na companhia dos seus pais este transferidos pelos serviços, em 1993 juntou se com o pai dos seu filhos e em 2003 separou se, para o seu sustento decide abrir um negocio que consiste na compra de roupas e produtos alimentícios na africa do sul para revender em Moçambique.

Ângela com o negocio tem tida um rendimento que varia de 5000,00mt a 6000,00mt e faz poupanças as vezes, para Ângela este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva valor que pretende ampliar o seu negocio e já teve empréstimos noutros bancos nos valores seguintes 10000,00mt; 20000,00mt e 30000,00mt valores que aplicou neste negocio.

Ângela pretende futuramente construir uma mercearia para ampliar melhor o negócio de vende de roupas.
texts.en:
30-year-old Ângela Nhuntumbo is the mother of three children ages 14, 12 and 9. Born in Marrumeu, in the province of Sofala, Mozambique, she moved to Maputo at age 8. Her studies where interrupted in 1993, before she finished high school. She lived with the father of her children from 1993-2003, when they separated and she started a business of buying clothes in South Africa to resell at home, to support the family. Ângela's current monthly income is between 5000,00 and 6000,00 mt, which allows her to save some money. She plans to use her loan (the first with Hluvuku) to increase her clothing inventory and improve the business. She has taken out bank loans in the past, in the amounts of 10000,00, 20000,00 and 30000,00 mt, all invested in the business. She plans to open a small clothing store, in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Alcides Ramiro

texts.es:
Alcides es socio del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Alcides es casado, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Alcides tiene una tienda de abarrotes al por mayor y menor en la ciudad de Llochegua en la selva ayacuchana, en donde tiene una casa, además Alcides junto a su esposa tienen otra tienda en Totorilla en un local alquilado en donde venden abarrotes.
Alcides necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas.
texts.en:
Alcides is a member of the Communal Bank Totorilla. He is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children. Alcides has a grocery store in the city of Llochegua in the Ayacucho jungle, where he sells both wholesale and retail. There Alcides owns a home with his wife, and they also have another store in Totorilla in a leased space where they sell groceries. Alcides needs a loan of 2500 soles that he will use to buy rice, sugar and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alcides needs a loan of 2500 soles in order to buy rice, sugar, and sodas.

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Frida es separada, tiene 58 años y 8 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, Frida vive en la comunidad de San Jose de Viñaca que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde compra tara, cochinilla que luego de acopiar lo vende a los intermediarios. Además Frida junto a sus hijos se dedican a la agricultura de cereales que luego vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, también manda hacer leña que reparte según pedido.
Frida necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, tara.
Frida sueña con mejorar su negocio, tener mas capital y apoyar a sus hijos para que sean mejores.
texts.en:
Frida is a partner in the Sonrisa (Smile) Communal Bank. Frida is 58 years old and separated. She has eight children, three of whom live with her. Frida lives in the San Jose de Viñaca community, 40 minutes outside of Ayacucho. She buys tara and pillbugs in the city, which she stockpiles and sells to intermediary distributors. Frida and her children also grow grains that they sell in Ayacucho, and they chop firewood upon request. Frida needs a loan of 1200 soles which she'll invest in firewood and tara. Frida dreams of improving her business, having more capital and supporting her children to improve themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Frida needs a loan of 1200 soles which she'll invest in firewood and tara.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Lucia es separada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Lucia viaja a las ferias de la region como Andahuaylas, Huancayo y Cangallo de donde compra cereales variados, que luego de acopiar lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo vende por mayor a los comerciantes del mercado de abastos.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, haba.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Sonrisa Community Bank. She is 43 years old, separated, and has four children. She travels around to the markets in the region such as Andahuaylas, Huancayo and Cangallo where she buys various types of grain, collects it, and then transports it to the city of Ayacucho where she sells it at wholesale prices to the merchants in the market there. Lucia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy corn and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lucia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy corn and beans.

loans.name: Estilista

texts.es:
Estelista es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Estelista es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Estelista tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, en un local alquilado en el centro de la ciudad, Estelista cuenta con la ayuda de un personal permanente y en algunas oportunidades dependiendo de la demanda contrata a mas personas. 
Estelista necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de deudas contraídas con la muerte de su padre.
Estelista sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener mas personales, mayores ingresos y brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Estelista is a member of the Communal Bank “Sonrisa.” She is married, 40 years old, and has 3 children. Estelista has a seamstress shop in a rented space in the city’s center where she makes clothing. Estelista says that with the help of a permanent employee and depending on some opportunities she will hire more people. Estelista needs a loan of 400 soles to pay debts related to the death of her father. She dreams of expanding her business, have more assistants, greater income, and provide the best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay debts related to her father's death.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Paulina es casada, tiene 32 años y aun no tiene hijos, Paulina esta estudiando contabilidad en la universidad, Paulina vende ropa variada en las ferias de la región a donde viaja 1 vez por semana y de las ferias compra quesos, carne que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Paulina tiene un carro que alquila diariamente.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de niños.
Los sueños de Paulina son ampliar su negocio, culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Sonrisa Community Bank. She is 32 years old, married, and doesn’t have any children yet. She is studying accounting at university, and she also sells a variety of clothing in the local markets once a week. At the markets she buys cheeses and meat that she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Paulina also has a vehicle that she rents out on a daily basis. Paulina needs a loan of 800 soles to buy children’s clothing. Her dreams are to expand her business and to finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Nelly es soltera y tiene 23 años, Nelly vive con sus padres y estudia contabilidad en un instituto, Nelly vende ropa variada que ofrece a los comerciantes de los mercados, sus ventas son al crédito y cobra diariamente después de sus clases. Sus productos los adquiere de la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja los fines de mes.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería variada.
Lo sueños de Nelly son mejorar su negocio, ampliar y terminar de estudiar su carrera.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Sonrisa Community Bank. She is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is studying bookkeeping at an institute. As well, she sells a variety of clothing to local merchants on credit and collects the money daily after her classes. The goods are bought in Lima where she travels at the end of every month. Nelly needs a loan of 800 soles to buy various types of underwear. Her dreams are to improve her business, to further her studies, and to complete her professional education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various types of underwear

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia Al Progreso 1 Group

texts.en:
This group of five women has experienced great success. Each has started her own small business, and the businesses continue to improve with each loan cycle. Some of these women are on their seventh loan cycle and still want to grow. Maria F. is the group representative and a very hard-working mother of one child. She has a business selling clothing in her area. She buys the clothing for very low prices and then sells it in her small store. She started with almost nothing, and today is earning a income sufficient to feed her child and to provide his education. She is very thankful for all the help she has received and wants to continue improving her life. She dreams of traveling some day, and being able to have a nice house.

On behalf of Maria, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for resale

loans.name: Rocio Marleny

texts.es:
Rocio es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Rocio es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Rocio vende pollos para criar y hoja de coca que compra de la empresa nacional de coca, para lo cual cuenta con un registro, los pollitos los compra de las granjas, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región y de las ferias compra quesos, carnes que vende a las tiendas y casas.
Rocio necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollitos bebes.
Los sueños de Rocio son tener casa propia, brindar una buena educación a su hijo y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rocio is a member of the Legioncito Community Bank. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has a son. She sells chicks for people to raise, as well as coca leaves which she buys from the national coca leaf producer where she has an account. The baby chicks are bought from farms and then sold at various local markets from which she also buys cheeses and meat to sell in stores and from door-to-door. Rocio needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy baby chicks. Her dreams are to own her own house, to educate her son well, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby chicks

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Gloria es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Gloria vende comida variada en su casa que esta ubicada en la Av. Quinuapata, actividad que realiza por las noches y cuenta con la ayuda de sus sobrina. Además Gloria en sus ratos libres vende cosméticos por catalogo llamado Oriflame sus ventas son al crédito.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de  600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, y papa.
Los sueños de Gloria son tener una tienda de abarrotes, un restaurante y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Legioncito microfinance institute. Gloria is a 38-year-old married mother of 2 children. She sells assorted meals in her house, which is located on Quinuapata Avenue. With the help of her niece, she works evenings. Gloria also sells Oriflame cosmetics by catalog for credit in her free time. Gloria needs a loan of 600.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing sugar, rice, and potatoes. She dreams of having her own general store and restaurant, and of her children finishing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, and potatoes

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Vilma viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 2 veces a la semana, donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra quesos, cereales que luego vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho de casa en casa.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener un negocio estable, vender por mayor y que su hijo estudie y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Legioncito Community Bank. She is 23 years old, lives with her partner, and has a son. She travels around to the various markets in the area twice a week selling groceries and buying cheeses and grains which she then sells door-to-door in the city of Ayacucho. She needs a loan of 800 soles to buy sugar and rice. Vilma’s dreams are to have a profitable business, to sell wholesale, and to have a well-educated son with a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Feliciana es viuda, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Feliciana viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales, cereales y luego lo comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, en algunas oportunidades viaja a la feria de Condoray en donde vende carnes, pollos y compra cereales. Además Feliciana tiene un carro con el cual trabaja su hijo realizando transporte publico.
Feliciana necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de animales menores, cereales.
Los sueños de Feliciana son tener casa propia y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a member of the Communal Bank “Legioncito.” Feliciana is a widow, 48 years old and has 1 son. Feliciana travels to different markets in the region where she buys animals, grains and later sells them in Ayacucho city. Sometimes she travels to the Condoray market where she sells meat, chicken and buys grain. In addition, Feliciana has a car with which her son works providing public transportation. Feliciana needs a loan for 1600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of small animals and grains. Feliciana dreams of having her own home and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small animals and grain

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine O., 52, lives with her husband and six children in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and sarongs and has a good profit from her sales.The demand for her products is high because she is the only person selling these items in the area where she lives.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a generator, repair her refrigerator and also purchase more products to increase her inventory. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase one generator, repair her refrigerator and purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.es:
Yasmin es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Yasmin es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Yasmin es de profesión obstetriz, tiene 3 consultorios obstétricos, en los cuales brinda servicios de control prenatal, atención de partos entre otros servicios, además en uno de sus consultorios tiene una farmacia.
Yasmin necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza.
Los sueños de Yasmin es tener una clínica moderna, ampliar sus negocios y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yasmin is a member of the village bank Comunal Legioncito. Yasmin lives with her partner, is 38 years old, and has 3 children. Yasmin is an obstetrician, has 3 offices where she provides prenatal services, labor and delivery care, among other services. In addition, in one of her offices she has a pharmacy. Yasmin needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of beauty products. Yasmin's dreams are to have a modern clinic, expand her business and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 73340

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en:
Adesuwa A. is 53-years-old, married and has eight children. The family lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

She sells beverages, primarily soft drinks and pure water. Adesuwa has a refrigerator so she is able to cool her drinks. She would like to use her loan to increase her stock of beverages as her customers are increasing and the dry season is fast approaching. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and pure water to sell to an increased customer base

loans.name: Porvenir Femenina Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five members of a bigger group of people called "Porvenir Femenina". All of the people in this group are trying to increase their small businesses and improve their lives. Flavia S. is the group representative, and for good reason. She is an extremely hard-working, outgoing woman. She is dedicated to her work and to making sure all loan payments are made. She is the mother of four children, and those children's future is what motivates her. She wants to provide them with a comfortable life, and give them a chance at a better future. She has a small business selling food, and has slowly been increasing her business. She thinks this next loan is really going to make a big difference and help her business grow. She dreams of having her own house, and sending her children to college. She said she is ready to go out and achieve those goals instead of just hoping for them.

On behalf of Flavia, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchasing food to sell

loans.name: Aydee Rosaria

texts.es:
Aydee es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Aydee es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Aydee se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas, postres variados, que prepara en su casa con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos, sus postres los hornea en un horno alquilado.
Aydee necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y harina.
Los sueños de Ayde son tener una panadería, brindarles a sus hijos todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Aydee is a member of the Communal Bank Legioncito. She is 37 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Aydee makes pies and desserts, which she prepares in her home with the occasional help from her children, and then she bakes them in a leased oven. Aydee needs a loan of 800 soles which she will use to buy sugar and flour. Aydee dreams of having her own bakery and providing the best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Aydee needs a loan of 800 soles which she will use to buy sugar and flour.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie U. sells prepared foods like rice, beans and yams at the front of her house in the evenings (from 5:30–10:30PM). She lives along a busy road and attracts many customers due to the convenience of her location. She needs a loan to purchase more ingredients to cook food and sell to her customers. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare food for resale

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Edith es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Edith viaja a las ferias de la región los días sábados y domingos donde vende ropa variada, los demás días trabaja en la tienda de su mama vendiendo también ropa, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada 15 días.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería variada.
Edith sueña con tener una tienda propia de ropa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Communal Bank “Legioncito.” Edith is married, 30 years old, and has 2 children. Edith travels to the regional markets on Saturdays and Sundays where she sells a variety of clothing, on other days she works in her mother’s clothing store. She acquires her products in Lima, where she travels every 15 days. Edith needs a loan for 1000 soles which will be invested in buy a variety of lingerie. Edith dreams of having her own clothing store and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of lingerie

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero I. is 50-years-old and a widow with four children. She sells provisions like detergent, bathing soap and toothpaste in her shop, located close to a motor park. She is determined to lift her family above poverty.This location attracts alot of customers.

Vero has been experiencing a high turnover of products, thus she needs to increase her inventory. Her customers with their requests have outnumbered her supplies. She is requesting a loan to purchase more provisions to sell in her shop. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To increase inventory of provisions in the shop

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin O. owns a supermarket and sells medicines and household provisions. He buys the products and medicines from Onitsha, Lagos and Benin. Godwin is 50-years-old and is married with eight children, who are all attending school.

Because of the high demand for his goods from his customers, he needs a loan to increase his inventory of medicines and provisions. He expresses his profound gratitude to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. sells food products, drinks and other household provisions in front of her house. She also sells firewood. Mary is 45-years-old, married and has five children. (Standing with her in the picture are her children.)

She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for resale. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more food products, drinks and household provisions for resale

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es:
Doña Abelina tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, madre de 3 hijos que tienen familia, estudió el sexto grado de primaria y vive en el Jr. Loyola 417, distrito de J., provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de J.. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital para comprar material (bayeta y lana) para el negocio de bordadura. A los 30 años de edad empezó tejiendo para la artesanía “trenza de oro”, lugar donde trabajaba y exportaba al extranjero. No estudió porque sus padres la dejaron con una señora que la crió desde niña. Cuando se retiró de la artesanía inicio su propio negocio de confección de bordados de bayeta como cojines, manteles de mesa, cuadros, etc.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 100 metros de bayeta a  S/. 500 y 15 kg. de lana a S/. 525.00.

Su mayor deseo es seguir con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Abelina is 55 years old, married, mother of 3 children who have their own families. She completed 6th grade of primary schools and lives at Jr. Loyola 417, J. district, Chucuito province in the state of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank “Niño San Salvador” in J.. In the beginning, with a loan for S/.300, she increased her capital to buy material (cloth and wool) for her embroidery business. At 30 years old she began sewing for the artisan store “trenza de oro” (Braid of Gold), where she used to work and export to other countries. She didn’t study because her parents left her with a woman who raised her since she was a little girl. When she retired from the artisan store she began her own business making embroidered items such as pillows, table cloths, wall weavings, etc. With this loan for S/.1,700, which will be repais in 4 payments, she will buy 100 meters of cloth at S/.500 and 15 kilograms of wool at S/.525.00 Her greatest wish is to continue her business and improve the quality of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth and wool

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. sells clothes and wrappers (sarongs) where her family lives in Benin city, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 50-years-old, married and has four children. Her customers are mostly women and young girls.

Helen is requesting a loan to purchase more wrappers (sarongs) to sell to her customers. She thanks all people that will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell to customers

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 73350

loans.name: Dioméné

texts.fr:
Enfant d’une famille spécialisée dans la fabrication et la vente de boissons traditionnelles alcoolisées appelée Kutuku, madame Dioméné Kamaté a été très initiée aux activités génératrices de revenues (car ses parents n’ont jamais voulus qu’elle fréquente l’école). Après une longue phase d’apprentissage, elle décida de se spécialiser dans le commerce de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest) et de fancy. Agée aujourd’hui de 50 ans Madame Dioméné Kamaté vit avec ses 8 enfants dans sa famille paternelle au quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle dispose d’un magasin au grand marché de Ségou où défilent à longueur de journée les dames et quelques hommes. En plus de la vente de pagnes elle fait également de temps à autres la vente des céréales. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle rentre en relation avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes fancy et 18 pièces de pagnes wax auprès de commerçants grossistes de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Elle effectue ses ventes au marché château au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes et de quelques hommes.  Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui servira essentiellement à faire face aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Born in a family specialized in the making and selling of a traditional alcoholic beverage called Kutuku, Mrs. Dioméné Kamaté became rapidly familiar with money making activities (because her parents never wanted her to attend school). After a lengthy training period, she decided to specialize in the business of Wax and Fancy pagnes (highly prized cloth in Western Africa). Today, Mrs. Dioméné Kamaté is 50 years old and lives with her 8 children in her paternal family in the Darsalam neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She has a small shop in the grand market of Ségou, where women and a few men are passing by all day long. In addition to selling pagnes, she also occasionally sells cereals. To better satisfy her ever increasing and ever mode demanding clientele, she joined the micro finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After four solidarity loans (group loans) that were all repaid without problems, she's now seeking her first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy 20 pieces of Fancy pagnes and 18 pieces of Wax pagnes from wholesalers in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). She sells her products at the Château marketplace, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women and a few men. She counts on turning a monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80) , to be mainly used to pay for family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Wax and Fancy pagnes (highly prized cloth)

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, madre de cuatro hijos, estudió el tercer año de secundaria y vive en el Sector Orccomplaya del C.P. Uros Chulluni del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.
 
Es socia del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” en Puno. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital para comprar artesanías, negocio que empezó hace muchos años, desde los 5 años de edad. En la actualidad continua vendiendo en la Isla Los Uros.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados en bayeta para continuar con su negocio de artesanías.

Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio para tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old, married and a mother of four, she studied until third grade, junior high, and lives in Sector Orccomplaya of C.P. Uros Chulluni of the district, province, and department of Puno.

She is a partner of "Banco Comunal Melchorita Saravia II" in Puno. With the initial loan of S/.300 she increased her capital to buy crafts, a business she started many years ago at the age of 5. Presently she continues selling on the island "Los Uros".

With this loan of S/.500 to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy baize embroideries to continue with her business of crafts. It is her wish to move ahead with her business to increase earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baize embroideries.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Con 6 años D. puesta su tienda en el barrio donD. expenD. cervezas y gaseosas, la señora Margarita, con sus 52 años, ya no tiene que velar por sus hijos, ya todos mayores y bien emprendidos, por lo que se ha abocado D. fondo en su negocio y, más aún, debido a la fuerte competencia interna D. las cervezas preponderante en el país. Siendo así la situación, los sueños D. la señora Margarita van tomando forma en la medida en que adquiera cierta estabilidad en aras D. implementar un local donD. pueda vender comida china (chifa) y poder contrarrestar la decreciente venta D. cervezas.

Es por ello que la señora Margarita necesita D. 1000 soles, para poder solventar sus gastos, propios D. una señora digna D. pasar su adultez bajo una óptima calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
After 6 six years in her store in the neighborhood where she sells beer and soft drinks, Margarita, who is 52 years old, no longer has to lose sleep over her children. They are grown up and have their start in life. Margarita has dedicated herself to her business, even more so because of the strong competition for beer sales in the country. Because of this situation, Margarita dreams of having a certain level of stability so that she can open a small restaurant where she could sell Chinese food and therefore be able to counteract the effects of the falling beer sales. This is why Margarita needs 1000 soles, to be able to settle her expenses, as a lady deserving of passing her later years with an optimum quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have more capital, with the purpose of purchasing beers and supplies necessary for her store and to take advantage of such as a fruitful season as the upcoming holiday celebrations.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Armida

texts.es:
Doña Armida tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, madre de 2 hijos, culminó sus  estudios superiores y vive en el Jr. Loyola 410, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Desde hace 9 años, con e primer préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó el capital con la compra de bayeta y lana para bordados. Alos 48 años de edad se inicia con este negocio del bordado, paralelo a esto se dedica a tejer ropa de bebe que vende a sus clientes los cuales le hacen pedidos en Juliaca. Actualmente trabaja con ambos negocios.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bayeta y lana para confeccionar ropa de bebe, 11 paquetes de lana  a un costo de  S/ 110 y  20 metros de bayeta a S/. 70. 

Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa para bebes y aprender a tejer en máquina.
texts.en:
Doña Armida is 56 years old, married, mother of 2. She finished her high school studies and lives in Jr. Loyola 410, district of Juli, province of Chucuito, department of Puno.

She is partner and founder of Banco Comunal "Niño San Salvador" of Juli. 9 years ago, with a first loan of S/.300 she increased her capital and bought baize and wool for embroidery. At 48 years old she started with the embroidery business, and she also knits babies' clothing which she sells to her clients upon request. Presently she works both businesses.

With this loan of S/.300, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy baize and wool to make baby clothes, 11 packages of wool at S/.110 and 20 meters of baize at S/.70. It is her dream to open a store with baby clothes and learn to knit on a machine.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 11 packages of wool at S/.110 and 20 m of baize at S/.70.

loans.name: Graciela Alejandrina

texts.es:
Con 3 de sus 52 años puestos en la venta de menúes por pedido, la señora Graciela se muestra más empeñosa día a día con tamaña labor a pesar de la irregularidad de las ventas. Con 3 de sus hijos ya mayores, ella vela ahora por su última hija, una escolar de 12 años, para que pueda salir adelante tal y como lo hicieron sus hermanos a cargo de su madre. La señora aprovecha cuanta ocasión pueda para vender sus menúes: construcciones, grupos de trabajo de familiares, personas cercanas, etc. forjando así su propio desarrollo en base a su esfuerzo.

En aras de seguir empoderándose, la señora Graciela necesita de 1500 soles, los cuales le permitirían poder elevar su capital (para poder adquirir los insumos necesarios para su labor) y, por ende, sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Having dedicated 3 of her 52 years of life delivering meals, Ms. Graciela S. is more and more hard-working everyday with such a huge task despite inconsistent sales. She and her 3 grown up children watch over the youngest in the family, a 12-year-old school girl, so that she can get ahead in life just like her siblings did under their mother’s care. Ms. S. takes advantage of any chance she gets to sell her meals: construction sites, her relatives’ work groups, acquaintances, etc., thus forging her own development on the basis of her efforts. In order to keep empowering herself, Ms. Graciela S. needs 1,500.00 PEN, which will allow her to raise her capital (so that she can obtain the ingredients necessary for her meals) and in so doing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients necessary for meal preparation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
In this loan there are five women from the larger group "Shalom" who are applying for a loan. Each woman has tasted a little success in her business, and wants to continue to increase its size. Gloria is the representative of the group, and has three children she has to care for by herself. She is a very diligent worker and has always made her loan payments on time. She has a small food market where she sells a variety of products. She hopes to continue growing and open a larger store soon. She finally feels like she can take care of her children, but now she dreams of providing them a happy, healthy, and comfortable life. She is very dedicated to her children and wants nothing more in the world than for them to succeed. She would love to send her children to college so they can have a better life, and get out of their cycle of poverty.

On behalf of Gloria, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Buy products for small market

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa es soltera, estudió el quinto año de secundaria, tiene 21 años de edad y vive en el Centro Poblado Uros Chulluni, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” de Puno. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 500, compró bordados en bayeta de Juli para su negocio de artesanía. Desde los 16 años de edad ayudaba a su papá a vender en la Isla de Los Uros, después de unos años emprendió su propio negocio al que actualmente se dedica y trabaja todos los días.

Con este crédito de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará  bordados en bayeta a S/. 900. 

 Su deseo es ser una empresaria de éxito para vender por mayor a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is single, has finished the fifth year of high school, is 21 years old and lives in the Centro Poblado Uros Chulluni, district, province and department of Puno.

She is one of the associates of the community bank "Melchorita Saravia II" of Puno. She started with a loan of about $150 USD, with which she purchased embroidery on wool cloth from Juli for her crafts business. Since she has been 16 years old she has been helping her father to sell on the Island of Los Uros, and after a few years she started her own business which she currently runs and works at every day.

With this loan of $400 USD, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy embroidered wool cloth for $300 USD.

Her desire is to be a successful business woman and be able to sell wholesale to other establishments.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase embroidered cloth for $300.

loans.name: Denia

texts.es:
Con sus 55 años, 8 de ellos con su tienda, la labor que desempeña la señora Denia es admirable desde todo punto de vista. Porque ha tenido que ingeniárselas para poder darle a sus hijos lo mejor que pueda acorde con sus posibilidades, por lo cual ha venido desarrollando un sinnúmero de actividades: venta de salchipapa, lavado de ropa a domicilio, etc., es decir, todo en afán de la crianza de sus 4 hijos (aunque 2 de ellos ya mayores: de 29 y 24 años; los otros 2, menores, de 18 y 14 años, a quienes les solventa su educación). A pesar del tremendo esfuerzo en más de 25 años como madre, aún no puede terminar de construir su pequeña casa, yendo esto en detrimento de la calidad de vida de su familia y productividad de los negocios que expende desde y en casa, anhelando la finalización de su casa como tal.

Con ánimos de implementarse de insumos necesarios para afrontar la venidera campaña navideña, la señora Denia necesita de 300 soles, lo que le serviría como sustento a su capital en pos de mercadería y optimizando su nivel de ganancias.
texts.en:
Being 55 years old, owning her store for 8 of them, the work that Mrs. Denia does is admirable from all points of view. Because she has had to manage in order to give her children the best that she could according to her possibilities, she has been developing in a number of activities: selling kebab, laundry services in the homes, etc., in other words, anything she needs to do to raise her 4 children ( even though 2 of them are already grown, 29 and 24 years old, and the other two are 18 and 14 years old, for whom she pays their education) In spite of her tremendous efforts during 25 years of being a mother, she still cannot complete the construction of her small home, this being a detriment to the quality of life of her family and the productivity of the businesses that she runs from and in her home. She yearns to finish her house such as it is. With the desire to obtain the necessary supplies to be able to face the upcoming Christmas season, Mrs. Denia needs $100 USD, which will provide the capital for merchandise and will increase her level of income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be able to count on more funds and acquire more products at better prices which will increase her profits.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Amakuru (Greetings) from J. Musanabera in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! J. is 36 years old, married with 3 children of her own.

J. started her business selling bananas in a small shop in Kigali market way back in 1997. Her day starts as early as 5 am when she has to go board a taxi to go to the food market to buy bananas for her customers and transport them on a rental truck to her business area. Besides selling bananas, she also owns a small shop selling different items such as sugar, salt, maize flour, cassava flour, basins, sodas, etc.

Besides owning this business, this client does bee-keeping. She has been able to buy 10 modern bee hives where she is expecting to extract honey to sell in the near future. She employs one person to help her run the business. This client is looking for a loan worth 500,000 Frws to expand her business by buying more bunches of bananas to sell to restaurants and increase her stock, getting ready to serve her customers, especially during the Christmas season. The loan term is 8 months, repaid monthly.

loans.use: To expand her small business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 20 años de edad, es casada, madre de dos hijos, estudió el sexto grado de primaria y vive en el Sector Orcomplaya del C.P Uros Chulluni, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Desde hace dos años es socia del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” de Puno. Con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró bordados en bayeta, balsas, collares, joyeros, etc. para su negocio de artesanía en la Isla Flotante Los Uros. Sus padres no contaban con medios económicos y por esa razón no continuo sus  estudios. Actualmente sigue con el negocio de venta de artesanías.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados en bayeta como cojines, manteles, cuadros, etc.

Su deseo es mejorar su negocio para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Claudia is 20 years old, married and mother of two children. She finished through the sixth year of primary school and lives in the sector Orcomplaya del CP Uros Chullini, district, province and department of Puno.

For the last two years she has been a member of the Community Bank "Melchorita Saravia II" of Puno. With the loan of $100 USD she purchased embroidered wool, rafts, necklaces, jewelry cases, etc.for her crafts business on the Floating Island Los Uros. Her parents did not have the financial means and that is why she did not continue with her studies. She currently continues with her business of the sale of arts and crafts.

With the loan of $325 USD, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy embroidered wool cloth pillows, tablecloths, pictures, etc..

Her wish is to improve her business to be able to build her house.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase embroidered wool cloth pillows, tablecloths, pictures, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Tras una gran carrera como profesora, la señora Lidia con sus 67 años, aún sigue escalando las escarpadas D. la vida y afrontando las tempestades que ésta depara, por lo que hace 3 años se dedica a la venta D. medicina natural por pedido, D. una marca reconocida mundialmente, debido al insuficiente sueldo como pensionista que percibe por parte del Estado por sus servicios D. docencia. Incluso, la señora Lidia aspira a más: recientemente acaba D. ingresar al negocio D. otra marca D. medicina natural (adueñándose así D. lo que fuera “su competencia” por unas semanas), abarcando así la totalidad D. dicho rubro. Y, es que, la señora Lidia no deja el ser emprendedora y quiere forjar, junto con su esposo, un policía en retiro, un buen porvenir y disfrutar D. calidad D. vida óptima por todo lo aportado al país como docente tantos años.

Por ello, requiere D. 500 soles para poder adquirir más productos para su posterior venta, lo que incrementaría sustancialmente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
After a long career as a teacher, Lidia, who is 67 years old, continues climbing the steep terrain of life and confronting the storms that it makes. For this reason, she has for the past 3 years been selling natural medicine by special order, from a brand that is known world-wiD.. This is because of the insufficient pension salary that she receives from the state for her years of service as a teacher. Lidia aspires to more: recently she started in the business of selling another brand of natural medicine (taking over what was her “competition” for a few weeks). This way she is able to cover the totality of this area of sales. Lidia doesn’t give up being enterprising, and wants to make, along with her husband, who is a retired policeman, a good future and to enjoy an optimum quality of life because of what she contributed to the country as a teacher for so many years. In order to do this, she needs 500.00 soles to acquire more products that she can sell, which will substantially increase her income. .

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Since she works from product orders, she needs more capital with which to buy the natural medicine products that she sells.

loans.name: Doudou

texts.fr: Doudou est agé d' une trentaine d' année il est marié et pere de plusieurs enfants. N etant pas scolarisé il  a tres tot commencé à apprendre le metier de tailleur. Aujord'hui il gére son propre atelier de tailleur où il a en charge plus de cinq (05) jeunes apprentis qu 'il initie au metier .Il a adheré à la caisse depuis 3 ans ; il a eu à beneficier de plusieurs prets pour renforcer son activité .Il pret sollicité lui permettra d ' acheter une nouvelle  machine à coudre pour renforcer son parc et faire face à la demende.
texts.en:
Doudou is approximately 30 years old, married, and the father of several children. Since he was not attending school, he started to learn tailoring early on. Today, he manages his own shop where he trains more than five apprentices. He joined UIMCEC three years ago, and benefited from several loans to bolster his business. The loan he's seeking now will enable him to buy a new sewing machine to meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married and has two children. He has a small store where he sells sport clothing and underwear. The business is located in a small, beautiful town that attracts lots of tourists. They are his main clients. 

Mykola has been in this business for 10 years already. He runs it with his wife, Alexandra, who encouraged her husband to start this business and is very supportive even now. They have already invested 45,000 UAH in goods and would like to expand the business even more.

Mykola is requesting a loan of 3,000 UAH to purchase more goods. This business has its high season now. Mykola believes that opening second place of retail will give him an advantage over his competitors and provide his family with more profit in the coming Christmas season.

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: purchase more goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy 10 loads of potatoes for $50 USD and a sack of starch for $70 USD.

loans.name: Badeya (Fraternité Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq (5) femmes du groupe Badeya (4 mariées et 1 célibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Mancourani I de Sikasso (troisième région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté.  Elles mènent leurs activités d’’achat et de  vente de poissons fumés, de fruits, de bazins, de parfums, du magnokisèni (plantes exotique très prisées en Afrique de l’Ouest). d’encens,
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 5ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 100 mètres de bazin blanc, 4 cartons de poissons fumés, 3 chargements d’orange, 10 bouteilles de parfum et l’eau de cologne, 10kg de Guéni (encens naturel), 10kg de graine de magnokisèni, 5 boîtes de teinture de couleurs différentes. Les graines de guéni et magnokisèni seront mélangées avec des parfums et l’eau de cologne pendant un certains temps afin de donner à l’encens une bonne odeur. Quant aux bazins blancs, il seront teints avec différentes colories par des teinturières de metier. 
Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) pour le bazin et à Mopti pour le poisson fumé. Les marchandises sont vendues en détail, au comptant au marché de Sikasso à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes. Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce nouveau prêt, un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans leurs activités respectives.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Badeya (of whom four are married and one is unmarried) average 40 years of age and three children. They live in traditional extended families in the Mancourani I district of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and know one another through ties of community and kinship. Their work includes buying and selling smoked fish, fruit, damask, perfumes, incense, and magnokisèni (highly prized exotic plants in West Africa).

In order to satisfy their burgeoning customer base, this group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which it is on its fifth solidarity loan (group loan). All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, the group intends to buy: 100 meters of white damask, 4 boxes of smoked fish, 3 loads of oranges, 10 bottles of perfume and eau de cologne, 10 kg of guéni (natural incense), 10 kg of magnokisèni seeds, and 5 cans of dyes of different colors. The guéni and magnokisèni seeds will be mixed with perfumes and eau de cologne for a certain amount of time to provide a nice fragrance to the incense. As for the the white damask, these will be tinted with different colors using dyes of the trade.

They get their supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali) for the damask and in Mopti for the smoked fish. The goods are sold retail and in cash at the Sikasso marketplace to customers composed of women and men.

With this new loan, the group members each envision realizing an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to cover the loan interest, to provide for their families, and to invest the rest in their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Birane

texts.fr: Birane n' est pas marié il est agé de 26 ans . Il s' exerce le metier de tailleur  depuis plus de cinq ans Il y tire l' essentiel de ses revenus.son adhesion à la caisse remonte à 8 mois. Avec l approche de la fete de la tabasky,il fait face à une forte sillicitation  de la part de clients .le nombre de machines dont il dispose ne plus permet pas de repondre à cette demande ainsi il sollicite un pret pour acquerir une nouvelle machine à coudre.
texts.en:
Birane is unmarried and 26 years old. He's been a tailor for more than five years, a job that constitutes his main revenue. He joined UIMCEC eight months ago. With the Tabasky Feast (Eid al-Kabi) approaching, he experiences high customer demand, which he cannot meet due to an insufficient number of sewing machines. He's therefore seeking a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de cuatro hijos, estudió el segundo año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Manuel A. Quiroga Nº 360, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno, 

Es una nueva socia del Banco Comunal “Pequeña  Roma” de Juli.  No pudo estudiar porque eran muchos hermanos y sus padres no tenían medios económicos. A los 36 años se inició con el negocio de bordadura, en el cual continua trabajando.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bayeta y lanas de diferentes colores para continuar con su negocio.

Su deseo es que mejore el negocio para tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Doris is 46 years old, she is a partner and mother of four children. She finished the second year of high school and lives on Manuel A Quiroga Street No. 360, district of Juli, Chuchito province, department of Puno.

She is a new member of the Community Bank “Pequeña Roma” of Juli. She could not go to school because she had many siblings and her parents did not have the financial means. When she was 36 years old she started an embroidery business, at which she currently continues to work.

With this loan of $175 USD, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy embroidery cloth and yarn of various colors to continue with her business.

Her wish is that her business improve and that she produces more profits.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of embroidery cloth and yarn of various colors.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married and has a 9-year-old son. She owns a retail business located at the city market at Zydachiv. She sells various goods like fabrics, threads, colognes, perfumes, personal hygiene products, etc. Her monthly gross revenue amounts to 25,000 UAH; the net income is about 5,000 UAH.

Natalia has been working in this business for 8 years. When she started she realized that she liked this business and it can be successful. She began to increase number of goods and their variety. Hard work and a good reputation helped Natalia develop her business and reach sustainability and success. 

Natalia would like to get a loan for 4,500 UAH to buy goods for the coming winter season. Natalia hopes that increased sales will generate additional income and help her to pay for heating of her house during the winter.

loans.use: Increase the variety of her goods

loans.name: Balimaya (Convivialité) Group

texts.fr:
Avec une activité très diversifiée (vente d’huile d’arachide, de cigarettes, de pagne wax tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest, de condiments alimentaires et de produits de beauté) les cinq femmes du groupe Balimaya ont une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans, 03 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe) et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 sacs d’oignons, 14 pièces de pagne Wax, 50 habits pour enfants, 2 cartons de pommade pour le corps, 5 caisses tomate,  2 bidons d’huile d’arachide, 10 paquets de cigarette de qualités différentes, 10 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de chiw-gum, 20 paquets d’allumette, etc. La ville de Sikasso et les localités environnantes sont leurs principales sources d’approvisionnement .
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché et à domicile en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et des jeunes.
texts.en:
Having a very diversified business selling peanut oil, cigarettes, Wax pagnes (highly-prized cloth in West Africa), condiments, and beauty products, the five women of the group Balimaya average 24 years of age and three children. They live in large, traditional, extended families in the Médine district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

The group members are on their sixth solidarity loan (group loan), and all the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy: 5 sacks of onions, 14 lengths of 'Wax' pagnes, 50 outfits for children, 2 boxes of body ointment, 5 cases of tomatoes, 2 drums of peanut oil, 10 packets of cigarettes of different grades, 10 packets of candy, 10 packets of chewing gum, 20 packets of matches, etc. The city of Sikasso and the surrounding towns are their principal sources of supplies. The merchandise is sold retail, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed generally of women and youngsters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods for small-scale commerce, such as peanut oil, cigarettes, Wax pagnes, condiments, and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fabric and wool threads of different colors.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. 7 de Junio s/n, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción” de Yunguyo. Desde hace un año, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital y compró galletas, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, etc., para su tienda de abarrotes. A los 17 años de edad se fue a trabajar a Lima con su hermana y después de un año y medio regresó y puso una pequeña tienda cerca de la Plaza 2 de Mayo, en la que vende todos los días.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará dos sacos de arroz a S/. 280, dos sacos de azúcar a S/.140, fideos, gaseosas, etc.

Su deseo es tener una tienda grande y viajar a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Esther is 19-years-old, is single, and studied through her fifth year of secondary school. She lives in the area of "7 de junio" in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is a member of the communal bank, "Virgen de la Asunción" in Yunguyo. Since one year ago, when she started with a loan of 300 nuevos soles, she has increased her capital and purchased cookies, soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., for her general store.

At 17 years of age, she went to work in Lima with her sister, and after a year and a half, she returned and started a small store near the "2 de Mayo" Plaza, where she sells every day. With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of rice for 280 nuevos soles, 2 sacks of sugar for 140 nuevos soles, noodles, soft drinks, etc. Her dream is to have a large store and to travel to other places.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase 2 sacks of rice for 280 nuevos soles, 2 sacks of sugar for 140 nuevos soles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Balimaya (Convivialité) Group

texts.fr:
Unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage, les membres  du groupe se  sont spécialisés dans le petit commerce de pagnes wax, de Bazin (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest), de chaussures, d’e fruits et de matériels en aluminium. Elles sont au nombre de neuf (7 mariées et  2 célibataires avec une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et de 2 enfants) et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Mancourani I, un des quartiers du centre ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
