Ce groupe, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association de femmes de leur quartier (Laïdou c’est à dire la promesse). Il est à son premier prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe).
Avec ce premier prêt, elles comptent acheter 14 pièces de pagne Wax, 120 métres  de bazins moins riche, 143 paires de chaussure, 10 sacs d’orange, 15 sacs de patates, un important stock de condiments alimentaires (gombos, oignons, aubergines, aromes, concentré tomate, etc.) et  des materièls en aluminium. Les  matériels en aluminium sont amenés à la forge pour en faire des marmites avant de les revendre. Elles s’approvisionnent dans la ville de Sikasso, dans les villages environnants ainsi qu’à Bamako ( capitale de la république du Mali).
Les produits sont vendus en gros et en  détail,  au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de Sikasso et  dans les foires des villages environnants et quelque fois à Koutiala. Au retour, elles achètent des savons et de beurre de karité qui seront vendus au marché de Sikasso à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes surtout des foraines et quelques hommes.           
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune avec ce premier prêt un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir  aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités respectives.
texts.en:
United by bonds of family and neighborhood, the members of this group have specialized in re-selling “wax”-type pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African cloth), “Bazin” (a sort of damask that is often locally dyed and much prized in West Africa), shoes, fruit, and objects made out of aluminum.

There are 9 women in the group: 7 married and two single with an average age of 27 and, on average, 2 children. They live in big traditional families in Mancourani I, a neighborhood of downtown Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

In an attempt to satisfy the needs of their ever-expanding clientele, this group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso through an association of women from their neighborhood (Laïdou, i.e. promise). They are on their first solidarity loan (group loan). With this first loan, they intend to buy 14 lengths of the cloth known as “Wax pagne”, 120 meters of medium-quality basin, 143 pairs of shoes, 10 sacks of oranges, 15 sacks of sweet potatoes, a large amount of condiments (okra, onions, eggplants, flavoring, tomato paste, etc.) and some aluminum. The aluminum is taken to the blacksmith to have it made into pots before re-selling it.

They stock up in the town of Sikasso and in nearby villages as well as in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). The products are sold wholesale and retail, for cash or credit in the Sikasso marketplace to a clientele composed generally of women, especially those who come to buy and sell at the weekly markets, and a few men.

They each hope to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA from this first loan. The profit will be used to make payments on the loan and to help support their families, with any remainder being invested back into their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo A. est âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère vde 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse  de poissons depuis 3 ans à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit, madame Adjo souhaite accroître son commerce en achetant beaucoup plus de marchandises et aussi en diversifiant ses fournisseurs. Ce faisant, elle accroîtra son pouvoir d’achat et participera à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjo A., 47, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been selling fish for 3 years in Wome, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Mrs. A. hopes to grow her business by buying a lot of inventory and also by diversifying her suppliers. In this way, she will raise her buying power and participate in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish for re-sale

loans.name: Eufrasia

texts.es:
Eufrasia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos jóvenes, estudió el quinto año de primaria y vive en Jr. Chinchaya s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Desde hace 5 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/.300, aumentó su capital para comprar carne de la feria en Juli. A los 15 años de edad comenzó a trabajar vendiendo refrescos en el mercado, no estudió porque eran muchos hermanos y sus padres no tenían dinero para poder hacerlos estudiar, después de 25 años cambió de negocio y actualmente se dedica a la venta de carne.

Con este préstamo de 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 06 corderos a  S/. 120.00 cada uno.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda muy grande de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Eufrasia is 42-years-old, is married, has 2 young children, and studied through her fifth year of primary school. She lives in the Chinchaya area in the district of Juli, in the province of Chuchito, in the department of Puno. She has been a member of the "Niño San Salvador" communal bank for 5 years. She started with a loan of 300 nuevos soles and increased her capital to purchase meat at the Juli market. At 15 years of age, she started to work selling soft drinks in the market. She didn't continue her education because she has a lot of siblings, and her parents didn't have enough money to give them an education. After 25 years, she switched businesses, and currently she sells meat. With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 6 lambs at 120 nuevos soles each. Her biggest dream is to start a large general store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase 6 lambs at 120 nuevos soles each

loans.name: Las Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Las Carmelitas, esta ubicado en Huancavelica, que es una zona de extrema pobreza. El bancomunal tiene 10 socias.

Oscar C., es casado, tiene 4 hijos, su negocio es una tienda surtida de abarrotes, manifiesta que en las reuniones de su bancomunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, su sueño es incrementar mas productos en su bodega para poder asegurar a su familia.

Nora A., es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos entre 21 y 4 años, vende bistec y fritanga en las ferias, ahora esta muy preocupada pues la han desalojado de su casa (alquilada), esta en búsqueda de un lugar para vivir junto a sus hijos. Nora desea comprar un balon de gas pequeño para poder trasladar su negocio a diferentes lugares, y vender en diversas ferias.

Esther P., es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 8 años y otro de 5 meses, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, muy temprano compra leña, cargando a su bebita en la espalda va vendiendo entre ferias, tambien en ocasiones lava ropa.
texts.en:
The community bank, "The Small Candies," is located in Huancavelica, which is an area of extreme poverty. The community bank has 10 members. Oscar C. is married with 4 children. His business is a store stocked with groceries. He has shown in the community bank meetings that he has learned to save. His dream is to increase the offerings of this store so that he can provide for his family. Nora A. is a single mother with 4 children between 4 and 21 years old. She sells meat and fried food at fairs Now she is very worried because she has been evicted from her rented house, and is looking for a place to live with her children. Nora would like to purchase a small cylinder of gas so that she can move her business to different places and sell in many fairs. Esther Palominio is married with two children, 8 years old and 5 months old. She sells kabobs. Very early in the day she purchases wood, and goes to sell her kabobs at the fairs while carrying her baby on her back. Also, she sometimes washes cloths.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the businesses of 10 Community Bank members

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Doña Eulalia tiene 54 años D. edad, estudió el quinto año D. secundaria, es casada, madre D. 3 hijos y vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa s/n, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chuchito, departamento D. Puno.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” D. Juli. Con el préstamo D. S/. 300 aumentó su capital para comprar cosméticos y vender en la ciudad del Cusco. Trabaja con diferentes productos D. acuerdo a la temporada, por ejemplo en estos meses está vendiendo ponchos D. plástico para la lluvia, en el mes D. Diciembre venderá productos naviD.ños.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará  10 docenas D. ponchos impermeables y cosméticos que venderá en Cusco.

Su deseo es que su hijo menor sea profesional, ya que los mayores lograron serlo.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 54 years old. She finished the fifith year of high school, is married, is mother to three children and lives in Jr. Santa Rosa s/n, Juli district, Chuchito province, Puno department (region).

She is one of the founding members of Juli's "Small Roma" Community Bank. With the loan of 300 Soles, she increased her capital in order to purchase and sell cosmetics in the city of Cuzco. She works with different products according to the season. For example, in current months, she is selling plastic ponchos for the rain, but in December, she will sell Christmas products.

With this loan of 1,000 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy ten dozen waterproof ponchos and cosmetics which she will sell in Cuzco.

Her wish is that her youngest child becomes a professional since the older ones have managed to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ten dozen waterproof ponchos, as well as cosmetics.

loans.name: Benkadi (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement composé de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Mancourani I, de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  
Ce groupe a choisi de se spécialiser dans la fabrication d’attièkè (Patte alimentaire fait à base de manioc) et dans le commerce de  condiments alimentaires,  de pomme de terre, et de charbon de bois. Elles ont fait une apprentissage commune auprès de leurs mamans respectives qui sont des amies d’enfance. Le groupe Benkadi a eu trois prêts solidaires  et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt actuel que le groupe sollicite permettra aux membres d’acheter, 20 sacs de pommes de terre, 30 sacs de manioc, 8 sacs de charbon de bois et de se faire un stock de condiments alimentaires (aubergines, oignons, gombo,10 d’aromes, 10 boîtes de concentré de tomate). La principale source d’approvisionnement de ce groupe est la ville de Sikasso auprès des  paysans producteurs et de commerçants grossistes. Les marchandises ainsi achetées sont vendues au comptant au marché ou de façon ambulante (de porte en porte) à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
 Avec ce prêt, elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans leurs activités respectives. Les femmes de ce groupe ambitionnent devenir un jour des grossistes.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of seven women, all married, who average 34 years of age and four children. They live in traditional extended families in the Mancourani I district of the city of Sikasso (third adminstrative region of the Republic of Mali). This group has chosen to become specialized in making attièkè (a dough or mash made of cassava) and in selling condiments, potatoes, and charcoal. Theirs has been a shared apprenticeship with their respective mothers, who are friends from childhood.

The Benkadi group has had three solidarity loans, which have all been correctly repaid. The current loan that the group is requesting will enable the members to buy: 20 sacks of potatoes, 20 sacks of cassava, and 8 sacks of charcoal, and to create a stock of condiments (eggplants, onions, okra, flavorings, 10 boxes of tomato paste). The principal source of supplies for this group is in the city of Sikasso from peasant producers and wholesale merchants. The merchandise purchased in this way is sold for cash at the marketplace or door-to-door to customers essentially composed of women.

With this loan, they each envision realizing an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA per month, which will be used to support their families and to invest the remainder in their respective businesses. The women of this group have the ambition to become wholesaler sellers one day.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cassava, potatoes, charcoal, and condiments

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. 8 hijos, estudió el tercer grado D. primaria y vive en el Jr. La Paz s/n, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chuchito, departamento D. Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” D. Juli. Al inicio, con el préstamo D. S/. 300, compró bordados en bayeta. A los 13 años D. edad empezó a estudiar el primer grado D. primaria porque sus padres no la apoyaban. Cuando pasaron unos tres años más tuvo su esposo y su hijo. No contó con el apoyo suficiente D. su esposo, lo que la obligo a  dedicarse al bordando y a la venta del mismo en Puno, En la actualidad sigue con su negocio D. bordado y a veces cuando no le alcanza el tiempo compra D. la gente del campo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprara 3 ganados ovinos para engorD. a S/. 360.00 y 2 ganados porcinos.

Su deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales mientras ella siga trabajando.
texts.en:
Francisca is 51 years old, married, and a mother of 8 children. She studied until third graD. and lives on La Paz Street in the district of Juli, province of Chuchito, department of Puno. She is a member of the Niño San Salvador Communal Bank in Juli. At first, with her loan of 300 soles ($100), she bought embroidered cloth. At 13 years old, she began to study first graD., because her parents did not support her. When three more years went by, she got married and had a son. She didn’t get enough support from her husband, so she decided to start embroidering and sell the embroidery in Puno. Currently she continues with the embroidery business and sometimes when she doesn’t have enough time, she buys them from people in the country (rural area). With this loan of 2,000 soles ($650), which will be repaid over 4 months, she will buy 3 sheep to fatten for 360 soles ($117) and 2 pigs. Her wish is that her children become professionals while she is still working.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 3 sheep to fatten and two pigs

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa was born in 1965. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town and she has settled in the Fizuli region, in a Bahmanli village.

Latifa is a mother of three children. She has been in cattle breeding business for six years. Now she needs a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) for buying two calves for improving her business.

loans.use: She would like to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Virgen D. Fátima  esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Huando, distrito D. Huando, en el departamento D. Huancavelica, esta comunidad es una zona agrícola, ganadera y comercial. Hay bastante movimiento económico puesto que al pasar omnibuses, carros, etc se venden bollos, empanadas y chicharrones.

Lilia C., es madre y padre para sus 3 hijos, Lilia se dedica a bordar fustanes talqueados y venD. en Huando cuando hay pedidos, pero mas venD. en Santiago desD. pequeña, Lilia lucha por sus hijos día a día. Solicita un préstamo para comprar animales para vender y también comprar hilos D. bordar tela castilla. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales, tener burdaduría granD..

Vicenta T., es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Vicenta tiene una tienda donD. venD. diversas cosas, poco a poco a  ido incrementando su negocio con verduras bebidas gaseosas y cerveza. Vicenta usará su préstamo e comprar mas mercadería como golosinas, gaseosas y frutas para su negocio. Vicenta sueña con que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar.

Giovanna L., es conviviente, tiene una hija D. 10 meses, Giovanna se dedica a la venta D. fósforo, agradece por los prestamos y por confiar en ella, Giovanna quiere salir adelante y ahorrar para poner una bodega.
texts.en:
The Virgin of "Fátima" Community Bank is located in the community of Huando, in the district of Huando in the suburb of Huancavelica. This community is in an agricultural, ranching and commercial area. There is enough economic activity, as they sell buns, empanadas and cracklings to passing busses and cars.

Lilia C. is a single mother to her 3 children. Lilia sells embroidery in Huando when there are orders, but sells more in Santiago. Lilia fights for her children day after day. She is asking for a loan to purchase animals to sell as well as to purchase embroidery floss to make cloth. Her dream is to watch her children become professionals.

Vicenta T. is married and has 4 children. Vicenta owns a store where she sells many things. Little by little she has expanded her business, and now sells vegetables, soft drinks and beer. Vicenta will use the loan to purchase more merchandise such as sweets, and fruit. She dreams that her children complete their education.

Giovanna L. cohabits and has a 10 month old daughter. She sells matches. She is thankful for the loans and for your trust in her. Giovanna wants to come out ahead and save money so that she can open her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the businesses of 13 Community Bank members

loans.name: Benkadi (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de soeurs et de cousines, ce groupe s’est spécialisé dans le commerce des condiments alimentaires, du charbon de bois, des céréales, des poissons. En plus de ce commerce, elles font également la production du beurre de karité et la préparation de la bouillie de mil, d’haricots etc. Composé de 8 femmes (toutes mariées et ayant en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants), elles vivent dans des foyers polygames dans le village de Ziékorodougou situé à environ 38 km de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Collaborant avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 6 ans, elles sont à leur 11ème cycle de prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe)et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter,  4 sacs de sel, 10  paquets d’aromes, 10kg de cola, 10kg de poissons fumés, 50kg de noix de karité, 2 sacs d’arachide, 150kg de haricot, 60kg de mil et 25kg de sucre. Les noix de karité après cuisson sont pilés soit à la machine soit traditionnellement pour en faire de beurre de karité et le mil aussi est pilé, vanné, et cuit pour en faire de la bouillie ou du couscous.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement dans la ville de Sikasso, les villages de Heremakono (frontière Mali- Burkina Faso) et Koloko (1er village bukinabé après le Mali).  Les marchandises sont achiminées à Heremakono les jours de foire pour être vendues au comptant, et au détail à une clientèle composée très généralement des femmes et surtout des foraines. Certaines vendent leurs marchandises à Ziékorodougou au bord de la route Mali-Burkina Faso. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce 11ème prêt un bénéfice moyen de 10.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement à renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
This group of sisters and cousins became specialized in the commerce of condiments, charcoal, grain, and fish. In addition to commerce, they also make karité butter and porridge made from millet, beans, etc. The group is composed of eight women (all married and averaging 40 years of age and four children), who live in polygamous households in the village of Ziékorodougou, located about 38 km from the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

Having collaborated with Soro Yiriwaso for six years now, they are on their eleventh cycle (solidarity loans, i.e., group loans), and all the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan they intend to buy: 4 sacks of salt, 10 packets of flavorings, 10 kg of cola nuts, 10 kg of smoked fish, 50 kg of karité nuts, 2 sacks of peanuts, 150 kg of beans, 60 kg of millet, and 25 kg of sugar. The karité nuts are first cooked and then pounded, either with a machine or in the tradition manner, to make karité butter. The millet is also pounded, winnowed, and cooked to make porridge or couscous out of it.

They get their supplies essentially in the city of Sikasso, the villages of Heremakono (bordering Mali and Burkina Faso) and Koloko (first village of Burkina Faso after Mali). The merchandise is taken to Heremakono on market days to be sold in cash at the retail level to customers composed generally of women and especially of market vendors. Some group members sell their merchandise in Ziékorodougou on the side of the road that leads to Mali and Burkina Faso.

With this eleventh loan, they each envision realizing an average profit of 10,000 francs CFA per month, which will essentially be used to boost their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 30 años de edad, estudió el sexto grado de primaria, es conviviente, madre de una niña de 2 añitos y vive en el jr. Zapana Nº 325, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Con el préstamo de S/.300 compró galletas, chocolates, gelatina, dulces, gaseosas, etc. A los 12 años de edad se inició con su negocio de venta de golosinas en la Plaza de Armas. Le agradó más trabajar y por eso dejó de lado los estudios. Cuando tuvo su esposo continuo vendiendo y ambos comenzaron el negocio de la venta de medicina natural. Desde que integró el banco comunal empezó a vender golosinas en el mirador de Juli, lugar donde llegan bastante turistas que muchas veces le compran sus productos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 5 cajas de galletas a S/.78, 5 paquetes de gaseosas a S/. 40, chocolates a S/. 140 y un saco de mana a S/. 40.

Su deseo es construir su casa y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a 30-year-old woman who completed the sixth grade. She is married and has a 2-year-old daughter. They live on Nº 325 Zapana Street, in the Juli district of the Chuchito province, department of Puno. She is a member of the “Niño San Salvador” microfinance institute in Juli. With the 300.00 PEN loan that she received, she purchased cookies, chocolate, gelatin, candy, soft drinks, etc. At the age of 12, she started her own candy business in the Plaza de Armas. She liked working more than studying, so she left her schooling aside. When she got married, she continued with her business, and then they both started a holistic medicine business. Ever since she joined the microfinance institute, she started selling candy at the scenic viewpoint in Juli, where there are many tourists who often times purchase her products. With this loan of 600.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase 5 boxes of cookies at 78.50 PEN, 5 crates of soft drinks at 40.00 PEN, chocolate at 140.00 PEN, and a sack of Peruvian marzipan at 40.00 PEN. She wishes to build her own house and continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cookies, soft drinks, chocolate, and Peruvian marzipan

loans.name: Gumercinda Elvira

texts.es:
Gumercinda tiene con 43 años de edad, es viuda, madre de tres hijos, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 189, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Al principio con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró bayeta y lana para su negocio de bordadura. A los 20 años de edad empezó a confeccionar artesanías que vendía en Juli. Cuando tuvo su esposo dejó el negocio para dedicarse a su casa y después de casi unos 10 años su esposo falleció. Hoy continúa trabajando con el negocio de bordados para sacar adelante con sus hijos.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará lana de alpaca (11kg a S/.135) y lana de varios colores.
 
Su mayor deseo es exportar sus productos para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is 43 years old, is widowed and is the mother of 3 children. She studied through the 5th year of secondary school, and lives at 189 Jr. Alfonoso Ugarte, in the district of Juli, in the province of Chuchito, in the province of Puno. Gumercina is one of the founding members of the community bank "St. Savior Child" of Juli. With the first loan of 300 soles, Gumercinda purchased cloth and wool for her embroidery business. When she turned 20, she began to make crafts and sold them in Juli. When she got married, she closed her business to make time to take care of the house, but after almost 10 years her husband passed away. Today Gumercinda continues working in the embroidery business to support her children. With this 500 soles loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase alpaca wool (11 kg for 0.135 soles) and wool of various colors. Her greatest desire is to export her products to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alpaca wool

loans.name: Faragnogokan (Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Spécialisées dans l’achat et la vente de friperie, de savons, de sucre, de bois de chauffe,  de vêtements pour enfants etc, les cinq (5) femmes du groupe Faragnogokan de l’association  Laïdou ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants et  vivent dans le quartier Mancourani I de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Après deux prêts solidaires remboursés sans difficulté, ce groupe est à son troisième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 balles de friperie, 10 cartons de savon, 4 sacs de sucre,1 chargement de bois de chauffe et 200 vêtements pour enfants. Elles s’approvisionneront auprès de grossistes du marché de la ville de Sikasso et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale du Mali) pour la friperie,  le savon, les vêtements pour enfants et le sucre. Quant au bois de chauffe, elles se ravitailleront auprès des paysans producteurs dans les villages environnants de Skasso. Les ventes se font au marché de Sikasso et dans les foires des villages. C’est au retour de ces différentes foires, qu’elles achèteront des sacs de charbon de bois qui seront vendus aux marché de Sikasso et dans leurs domiciles respectives à une clientèle contituée des femmes et des hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 40.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement à aider les conjoints à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Specialized in buying and selling second-hand clothing, soaps, sugar, firewood, and clothing for children, the five women of the group Faragnogokan of the association Laïdou average 31 years of age and four children. They live in the Mancourani I district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After having repaid without difficulty two solidarity loans, this group is on its third loan, which will used to buy: 2 bales of second-hand clothing, 10 boxes of soap, 4 sacks of sugar, 1 load of firewood, and 200 pieces of children's clothing. The group members get their supplies from Sikasso wholesalers and sometimes in Bamako (capital of Mali) for the second-hand clothing, the soap, the children's clothing, and the sugar. As for the firewood, they will be resupplied from peasant producers in villages surrounding Sikasso.

Sales are made at the Sikasso marketplace and in village fairs. On the way back from these village fairs is when they will buy sacks of charcoal that will be sold at the Sikasso marketplace and out of their respective homes to customers composed of women and men.

They each envision realizing an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA per month that will be used essentially to assist their husbands provide for their families.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods (second-hand clothing, soap, sugar, children's clothing, firewood

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda tiene 40 años de edad, está felizmente casada pero aún no tiene hijos, estudió el quinto grado de primaria y vive en el Sector Orcomplaya del C.P. de Uros Chulluni, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” de Puno. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital y compró bordados en bayeta, vasijas de arcilla, balsas, etc. para implementar el negocio de artesanías que tiene en la Isla Flotante de los Uros. Desde los 15 años empezó a trabajar en la pesca y en la artesanía. Cuando tenia 20 años de edad  tuvo su esposo y ambos continuaron con este negocio al que se dedican y venden en el lugar antes mencionado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados a S/. 500 (20 unidades) 25 manteles de mesa a S/. 625.

Su deseo es mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 40 years old, and is happily married, but does not yet have children. She studied through the fifth year of primary school, and lives in the Orcomplaya sector of C.P. of Uros Chulluni, in the district, province and suburb of Puno. Hermelina is one of the founders of the "Melchorita Saravia II" community bank of Puno. At the beginning, with the 300 soles loan, Hermelina purchased cloth, a clay pot and a raft to begin her crafts business in the Uros floating Island. Since she was 15 years old, she began to work in the fishing and artisan industries. When she was 20 years old, she got married and they both worked in this business. With this loan of 1,700 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase embroidery at .500 soles (20 units), and 25 table cloths at .625 soles. Her desire is to improve her business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 units of embroidery and 25 table cloths.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 4 hijos, estudió el primer grado de primaria y vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 462, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” de Juli. Al comienzo, hace  06 años, con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró frutas para vender por al mayor. A los 20 años de edad se inicia con este negocio con el que continua trabajando para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos porque no cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Paralelo a este negocio también se dedica al bordado en  bayeta, el cual vende los días de feria.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 30 metros de bayeta a S/.150 y lana a S/. 200.

Su deseo es continuar con su negocio para que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 36-year-old mother of four and lives with her partner. She has a first-grade education and lives at 462 Santa Rosa in Juli, Peru. She is the founding member of the "Little Rome" Community Bank of Juli. It started six years ago with a small loan for her to purchase fruit to sell at wholesale. She started in this business at 20 years old and has continued to work to make headway for her children because she cannot count on the support of her husband. Along with the fruit selling business she also makes a living embroidering cloth, which she sells at the open-air market. She is requesting a $175 loan, which she plans to repay within four months, to purchase 30 meters of cloth and wool. Her wish is to continue with her business so her children can become successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 30 meters of cloth and wool

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Isabel  enviudó hace 9 años, es madre D. nueve hijos, D. los cuales dos formaron su familia, estudió el quinto año D. secundaria y vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 424, distrito D. J., provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno.

Es socia del Banco comunal “Pequeña Roma” D. Puno. Con su primer préstamo D. S/.300 aumentó su capital y compró mercadería como ropa interior, medias, etc. para vender en la Ciudad D. Arequipa, lamentablemente se enfermó y se encuentra un poco delicada D. salud y decidió dejar D. lado su negocio hasta que se encuentre mejor. Por el momento se encuentra dedicada al bordado en bayeta, el cual venD. en Puno y J..

Con este préstamo D. S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mas bayetas para seguir trabajando los bordados.
 
Su deseo es mejorar su salud  para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Isabel became a widow 9 years ago. She is the mother of 9 children, two of whom now have families of their own. She studied through high school and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Rosa, Number 424, J. district, Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She is a member of the communal bank “Pequeña Roma” D. Puno. With her first loan of S/.300, she increased her capital and bought merchandise such as underwear, pantyhose, etc. to sell in Arequipa City. Unfortunately, she got sick and she is a little delicate of health and decided to put her business to the siD. until she got better. Currently she is working in embroidery, which she sells in Puno and J.. With this loan of S/.300, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will buy more cloth so she can continue working in embroidery. Her greatest wish is to improve her health so that she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cloth for embroidery.

loans.name: Jiguiseme (Espoir Group

texts.fr:
JIGUISEME est un groupe de cinq femmes (quatre mariées et une veuve) avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 03 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens d’amitié et de parenté.  Leurs principales activités sont entre autres l’achat vente de bananes, d’huile d’arachide, de poisson fumés et la transformation du manioc en attièkè .
Ce groupe est à son 5ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe) avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, après avoir remboursés tous les prêts précédents. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 30 sacs de manioc, 3 tonnes de bananes, 5 bidons d’huile d’arachide, 3 cartons de poissons fumés. Leurs sources d’approvisionnement  sont la ville de Sikasso auprès de grossistes (pour les bidons d’huiles et le poisson fumé) et les villages environnants (pour le manioc et la banane)auprès des producteurs. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché où elles ont chacune une place avec une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout des forains. Avec ce prêt, elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 42.000 FCFA par mois.
texts.en:
Jiguiseme is a group of 5 women (four married and one widow) with an average age of 36 and 3 children, living in big traditional extended families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They met because of bonds of friendship and family. Their principle businesses are, among other things, buying and re-selling bananas, peanut oil, smoked fish, and making manioc into “attièkè” (a traditional Malian dish).

This group is on their 5th solidarity loan (group loan) with the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, after having reimbursed all the preceding loans. With this loan, they expect to buy 30 sacks of manioc, 3 tons of bananas, 5 jerry-cans of peanut oil, and 3 cases of smoked fish. Their sources for purchasing their goods are in the town of Sikasso, from wholesalers (for the jerry-cans of oil and the smoked fish,) and the surrounding villages (for the manioc and bananas) where they buy from producers.

The goods are sold at the market where each of them has a stand, with a clientele generally composed of women and especially of big-city merchants who come to the markets to purchase food for re-sale. With this loan they each expect to make an average profit of 42,000 F CFA per month.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy various articles to be sold retail such as manioc, bananas, peanut oil, and smoked fish

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
ELLE EST UNE VENDEUSE DE LEGUMES AU MARCHE DE BAMBEY DANS LA REGION DE DIOURBEL.
SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER DES LEGUMES PUIS LES REVENDRE.
AVEC LE PRET ELLE COMPE S'APPROVISIONNER DIRECTEMENT DIRECTEMENT CHEZ LES PRODUCTEURS DE LEGUMES.
CECI LUI PERMETTRA D'AUMENTER SA MARGE BENEFICIAURE.
ELLE EST MARIEE ET A 03 ENFANTS A CHARGE.
texts.en:
She sells vegetables at the Bambey market in the Diourbel region. Her business consists of buying vegetables and then reselling them. With the loan she hopes to get her stock directly from the vegetable farmers. This will enable her to increase her profit margin. She is married with three children under her care.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling of vegetables

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de dos niños pequeños,  estudió en el Instituto Superior Tecnológico en Puno y vive en el sector Orccomplaya del C.P Uros Chulluni, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” de Puno. Con el primer préstamo aumentó su capital para comprar bordados en bayeta y cerámica. Desde los 20 años de edad, cuando tuvo su esposo, comenzó con este negocio, antes trabajaba como empleada del hogar en Puno. Nos cuenta que en los meses de Octubre y Noviembre sus ganancias se incrementan por la llegada de más turistas. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 10 calendarios de piedra a S/. 200, 10 bordados de familias a S/. 450, collares, cojines, etc. 

 Su deseo es terminar de construir su casa y que sus ganancias crezcan.
texts.en:
Julia is 25 years old, is married, is a mother of two small children, studied at the Higher Institute of Technology in Puno and lives in the area of Orccomplaya of C.P. Uros Chulluni, district, province and department of Puno. She is a member of the Communal Bank "Melchorita Saravia II" of Puno. With the first loan she increased her capital to buy embroidered cloth and ceramics. From the age of 20, when she married her husband, she started this business. Previously she worked in domestic service in Puno. We are told that in the months of October and November her earnings are increased by the arrival of more tourists. With this loan of 1200 soles (US $400), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 10 stone calendars for 200 soles (US $ 65), 10 embroidered items from families for 450 soles (US $145), necklaces, pillows, etc. Her desire is to finish building her house and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10 stone calendars, 10 embroidered items, necklaces, pillows, etc.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal San Gabriel. Gregoria tiene 26 años y 2 hijos de 9 y 4 años, sus 2 hijos están en la escuela.
Gregoria tiene su negocio de venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas, vende todos los días en una esquina, en  una avenida donde transita mucha gente, cerca de su casa, Gregoria empezó con este negocio hace 2 años. 
Gregoria necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la reparación y mantenimiento de su carrito sanguchero sándwich 
Gregoria sueña con salir adelante con su negocio y en el futuro tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the San Gabriel microfinance institute. She is a 26-year-old mother with 2 school age children, ages 9 and 4. Gregoria sells hamburgers and salchipapas (Peruvian street food made of pan-fried sausages and French fries) for a living. She works everyday on a corner of a very busy avenue near her home. Gregoria started this business 2 years ago. She needs a loan of 400.00 PEN, which will be invested in the maintenance and repair of her food cart. Gregoria dreams of moving her business forward and opening up her own store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of food cart

loans.name: Justa Pastora

texts.es:
Justa tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. 06 hijos, estudió el sexto grado D. primaria y vive en la Av. Revolución Nº 198, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno.

DesD. hace 05 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” D. Juli.  Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 compró 3 alpacas. A los 16 años D. edad  tuvo su esposo y su primer hijo. Sus padres no tenían medios económicos y por esa razón no pudo continuar la secundaria. A la edad D. 23 años inició el negocio D. compra y venta D. carne D. alpaca, el cual vendía en el mercado D. abastos D. Juli, también se dedica al engorD. D. ganado ovino. Actualmente continua con su negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  aumentará su capital para comprar una máquina cortadora D. carne a un costo D. S/. 2.400. 

Su mayor deseo es comprar una maquina congeladora para mejorar su negocio y así poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Justa is 46 years old, is married, the mother of 6 children, studied until the sixt thraD. of primary school and lives in Av. Revolución Nº 198, Juli district, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. For five years she has been a member of the Communal Bank “Niño San Salvador” of Juli. With the first loan of 300 soles (US $100) she bought 3 alpacas. When she was sixteen she had her husband and their first child. Her parents did not have the economic means and for that reason she could not continue to high school. At the age of 23 she started the business of buying and selling alpaca meat, which she sold in the supply market of Juli. She is also dedicated to fattening sheep. Currently she is continuing with her business. With this loan of 2000 solesn(US $650), which will be repaid in 4 months, will increase her capital to buy a machine for cutting meat at a cost of S /. 2400 (US $ 770). His greatest wish is to buy a freezer to improve her business and through this support her children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine for cutting meat

loans.name: Sabali(Patience) Group

texts.fr:
Spécialisées dans la vente de bananes, de pomme de terre et d’oranges, les femmes du groupe Sabali (5 femmes toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso (troisième région administrative du Mali). 
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leur activité, afin de satisfaire une clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle sont à son à leur 5ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 tonnes de banane, 1 chargement de camionnette en d’orange et 16 sacs de pomme de terre auprès des paysans producteurs des vllages environnants de la viile de Sikasso. Elles vendent une partie de leurs marchandises  aux revendeurs venant des grandes villes les jours de foire. L’autre partie est vendue de façon ambulante dans le quartier. La vente se fait généralement au comptant, à crédit, en gros et en détail à une clientèle est composée généralement des femmes.
texts.en:
Specialized in the sale of bananas, potatoes, and oranges, the women of the Sabali group (5 married women) have an average age of 36 and on average 3 children. They live in big extended traditional families in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

With the intention of expanding their businesses so as to satisfy an ever-growing clientele, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their 5th solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With this loan they intend to buy 4 tons of bananas, 1 truckload of oranges, and 16 sacks of potatoes from the farmers who produce them in the villages around the town of Sikasso. They sell part of their merchandise to merchants who come from the big towns on market day. The rest is sold door-to-door in their neighborhood. The sales are generally for cash, on credit, wholesale or retail to a clientele composed mainly of women.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bananas, potatoes, manioc, and oranges

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Doña Justina tiene 64 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. cinco hijos mayores D. edad,  estudió el tercer grado D. primaria y vive en el sector Santa Maria Cucho del Centro Poblado D. Uros Chulluni, distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” D. Puno. Al inicio, con el préstamo D. S/. 300 pudo comprar más verduras, papa, carne, etc. para poder seguir preparando viandas (comida). Este negocio lo inició a los 22 años D. edad y aún continua con el. Recientemente y paralelo al otro negocio abrió una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará arroz, fideos, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc.

“Gracias a los créditos del Banco Comunal puD. construir mi casita” nos dijo muy alegre Doña Justina.

Su deseo es ampliar el negocio y así incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justina is 64 years old, is married and mother of five adult children, she studied up until the third graD. and lives in the area of Santa Maria Cucho of Centro Poblado Uros Chulluni, district, province and department of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank “Melchorita Saravia II" of Puno. At the start, with a loan of 300 soles (US $100) she bought more vegetables, potatoes, meat, etc. to continue developing tubers (food). This business was started when she was 22 years old and she still continues with it. Recently, parallel to her other business, she opened a small grocery store. With this loan of 500 soles(US $175), which will be paid off in 4 months, she will buy rice, noodles, sugar, milk, oil, etc. "Thanks to the loans from the Communal Bank I could build my house" a very happy Doña Justina told us. Her desire is to expand the business and thereby increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia es soltera, tiene 27 años de edad, estudió en el Instituto Superior Tecnológico de Juli y vive en el Jr. Arequipa 252, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Desde hace 06 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró bayetas, lana, agujas, crochet, etc para hacer bordados, negocio que decidió empezar a los 22 años de edad  para poder estudiar y al mismo tiempo, en los días de feria en Juli, se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará relojes y/o artículos de limpieza de Desaguadero para el negocio que recién piensa emprender.

Su gran deseo es tener una Farmacia en Juli para dedicarse solamente a ese negocio.
texts.en:
Lilia is single, is 27 years old, studied at the Higher Institute of Technology of Juli and lives at Jr. Arequipa 252, Juli district, province of Chuchito, department of Puno. For 6 years she has been a member of the Communal Bank “Niño San Salvador” of Juli. At the start, with a loan of 300 soles (US $100) she bought rags, wool, needles, crochet, etc to do embroidery, a business that she decided to begin when she was 22 to be able to study and at the same time, on market days in Juli she sells clothes. With this amount of 500 soles (US $175), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy watches and / or cleaning articles from Desaguadero for the business that she has been thinking of undertaking. Her great hope is to have a pharmacy in Juli and devote herself solely to that business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase watches and/or cleaning supplies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de dos hijos, estudió el segundo año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. San Juan s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Hace cuatro años es socia del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” de Juli. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital para comprar lana y continuar trabajando en el negocio de venta de lana que lleva varios años. A los 21 años de edad comenzó con este negocio. Vende los días miércoles en la feria de Juli.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará 12 Kg. de lana de diferentes colores a S/. 360. 

Su deseo es continuar con su negocio y salir adelante para que sus hijos menores puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 28 years old, is living with her partner, is the mother of two children, studied through the second year of high school and lives at Jr. San Juan s / n, Juli district, province of Chuchito, department of Puno. For four years she has been a member of the Communal Bank “Pequeña Roma” of Juli. At the start, with a loan of 300 soles (US $100), she increased her capital to purchase wool and continue working in the business of selling wool for several years. When she was 21 years old she started with theis business. She sells on Wednesdays at the Juli market. With this loan of 700 soles (US $225), which will be repaid in 4 months she will by 12 Kg. of wool in different colors for 360 soles (US $ 115) Her desire is to continue her business and move forward so that her children can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 12 kg. of wool in different colors

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de dos hijos, estudió el segundo año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Lima 115, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. En un inicio, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró fruta para vender en el mercado. A la edad de 12 años empezó a vender frutas en diferentes ferias de Juli. Manifiesta que le era muy difícil aprender en la escuela y por eso se retiró para dedicarse solamente al negocio de venta de frutas. Actualmente en sus tiempos libres trabaja en bordados y continua con el negocio de venta de frutas.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 cajas de mango a S/.120 y 3 cajas de manzanas a S/.180.00.

Su sueño es construir su casa y poner un negocio en ella.
texts.en:
Lucila is 32 years old, is married, a mother of two children, she studied until the second year of high school and lives at Jr. Lima 115, Juli district, province of Chuchito, department of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank “Niño San Salvador” of Juli. With her first loan of 300 soles (US $100), she bought fruit to sell at the market. At the age of 12 she began selling fruit in different markets in Juli. She said that it was very difficult to learn at school and so she left to dedicate herself solely to the business of selling fruit. Currently, in her free time, she works with embroidery and continues her business selling fruit. With this loan of 500 soles (US $ 175 ) which will be paid off in 4 months, she will purchase 3 boxes of mangoes for 120 soles (US $40) and 3 boxes of apples for 180 soles (US $ 55 ) Her dream is to build her own house and put a business in it.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 boxes of manggoes and 3 boxes of apples

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
Doña Maria es madre soltera y tiene un solo hijo. Actualmente tiene 60 años de edad, es profesora cesante y vive en el Jr. Yunguyo s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital y compró lana para tejer chompas. Desde los 28 años de edad empezó a trabajar tejiendo en Artesanías de Puno. Luchó por sacar adelante a su hijo y este negocio la ayudo a poder apoyar económicamente a su hijo que en ese momento estaba estudiando. En la actualidad teje chompas en palillo y los vende según el pedido que le hacen.

Con este préstamo de S/. 400, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 Kg. de lana para tejer a S/.114 y otros materiales que necesita para dar el acabado a las prendas que teje.

Su deseo es sacar al mercado sus prendas y así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a single mother and has just one son. Currently she is 60 years old, she is an unemployed teacher and lives at Jr. Yunguyo (no house number), Juli district, Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the “Niño San Salvador” Communal Bank of Juli. With the first loan of S/. 300 she increased her capital and bought wool to knit sweaters. When she was 28 years of age she started to work weaving in Puno Crafts. She struggled to provide opportunities for her son and this business helped her to be able to economically support her son when he was studying. She currently weaves sweaters and sells them according to the orders that are placed. With this loan of S/. 400, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy 3 Kg. of wool to weave at S/.114 and others materials that she needs to finish the items that she weaves. Her wish is to bring her items to market and through this obtain more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 3 kg. of wool at S/.114.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria es casada, madre de tres niños pequeños y realizó estudios superiores. Actualmente tiene 38 años de edad y vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró lana para tejer ropa para bebes. Desde los 12 años de edad empezó a tejer para vender en la Plaza, después trabajó en artesanía donde también aprendió más sobre tejidos. En la actualidad se dedica a confeccionar ropa de bebes, los cuales teje y los envía a Chile donde le hacen pedidos cada 15 días.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará lana de diferentes colores para tejer chompas, chalecos y ropa de bebes.

Su sueño es progresar mucho más y no tener problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Maria is married, has three young children and completed her secondary education. She is currently 38 years old and lives in Jr. Alfonso Ugarte (no house number), Juli district, Chuchito province, departament of Puno. She is one of the members of the "Niño San Salvador” Communal Bank of Juli. With the first loan of S/. 300 she bought wool to weave baby clothing. When she was 12 years old she started to weave to sell in the Plaza, then she worked in crafts where she also learned more about weavings. At the present time she works making baby clothing, which she weaves and sends to Chile where they place orders every 2 weeks. With this loan of S/. 500, which will be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy wool of different colors to weave sweaters, jackets and baby clothing. Her dream is to progress much more and not have economic problems.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy different colors of wool.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 30 años de edad, está separada, es madre de un niño de 02 añitos, estudió en el Instituto Superior Tecnológico de Juli y vive en el Jr. Yunguyo s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró una bayeta y lana para confeccionar bordados. Desde muy joven aprendió a bordar, ello le sirvió para sacar adelante a sus hijos y para vender sus bordados en la ciudad de Puno. Al mismo tiempo vende papa en el Mercado de abastos de Juli.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará  40 metros de bayeta a S/. 152 y lana a S/ 52.50.

Su deseo es que su negocio crezca y ser independiente.
texts.en:
Mery is 30 years old, is separated, is the mother of a 2 year old child, studied at the Superior Institute of Juli and lives at Jr. Yunguyo (no house number), Juli district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is a member of the "Niño San Salvador” Communal Bank of Juli. With the loan of S/. 300 she bought fabric and wool to make embroideries. From a young age she learned how to embroider, which allowed her to support her children and sell her embroideries in the city of Puno. At the same time she sells potatoes in Juli's food market. With this loan of S/.500, which will be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy 40 meters of fabric at S/. 152 and wool at S/ 52.50. Her wish is for her business to grow and to be independent.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 40 meters of fabric at S/.152 and wool at S/.52.5

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula cuenta con 42 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. 05 hijos, sólo asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización durante 2 meses y vive en el Jr. Arica Nº 470, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chuchito, Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” D. Juli. En un inicio, con el préstamo D. S/. 300 compró lanas D. diferentes colores para confeccionar mantas (aguayos). DesD. los 13 años D. edad empezó a tejer mantas. Sus padres no tenían medios económicos para que estudié por esa razón aprendió a tejer para ganar dinero. Cuando tuvo su esposo continuo con el tejido D. mantas y con eso pudo ayudar a sus hijos. Paula sigue tejiendo y vendiendo en la plaza D. Juli los días D. Feria.

Con este crédito D. S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprara 20 paquetes D. lana D. distintos colores a S/. 200 y bayeta para bordar.

Su deseo es comprarse un terreno para darles a sus hijos para que puedan vivir felices.
texts.en:
Paula is 42 years old, is married, is the mother of 5 children, she attended the literacy program for 2 months and lives at Jr. Arica Nº 470, Juli district, Chuchito province, Puno. She is a member of the "Niño San Salvador” Communal Bank of Juli. In the beginning, with the loan of S/. 300 she bought wool of different colors to make blankets. She started to weave blankets when she was 13 years old. Her parents did not have the economic means for her to go to school and for this reason she learned how to weave to earn money. When she got married she continued with blanket weaving and with this she could help her children. Paula continues weaving and selling in the plaza of Juli on market days. With this loan of S/. 500, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy 20 packages of different colored wool at S/. 200 and cloth to embroider. Her wish is to buy herself a piece of land to give it to her children so that they can live happily.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 20 packages of different colored wool at S/.200 and cloth to embroider.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. seis hijos (todos con familias), estudió el quinto año D. primaria y vive en el Jr. Chambilla Nº 341, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chuchito, departamento D. Puno.

DesD. hace cuatro años es socia del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” D. Juli. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 pudo comprar más prendas D. vestir (ropa) para seguir vendiendo en el mercado. Este es el negocio al que se dedica por varios años. Para apoyar a su hijo que decidió viajar a los Estados Unidos trabaja sin descansar desD. los 51 años D. edad ya que no contaba con el apoyo D. su esposo. En la actualidad continua con su negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará  más prendas D. vestir para seguir con su negocio.

“Gracias a los créditos que obtuve del Banco Comunal he incrementado mi negocio y mis ganancias”, manifestó muy contenta Paulina.

Su mayor deseo es volver a ver a su hijo que se encuentra muy lejos y poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Paulina is 58 years old, is married, is the mother of six children (all with their own families), she studied until the 5th year of primary school and lives in Jr. Chambilla Nº 341, Juli district, Chuchito province, Puno department. For the past four years she has been a member of the “Pequeña Roma” Communal Bank of Juli. With the first loan of S/. 300 she could buy more articles of clothing to continue selling in the market. She has worked on this business for various years. To support her son who decided to travel to the Estados Unidos has worked without rest since she was 51 years old as she did not have her husband's support. She currently continues with her business. With this loan of S/. 500, which will be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy more articles of clothing to continue with her busines. “Thanks to the loans that I obtained from the Communal Bank I have expanded by business and my earnings”, Paulina said very happily. Her greatest wish is to see her son again who is very far away and to be able to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Rosali

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, madre de 3 hijos, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 456, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” de Juli. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/: 300, compró gas para vender en el mercado, como este producto subió de precio y no tenia salida cambio de negocio, es así que continua tejiendo mantas de lana, los cuales vende a S/.150 en Juli y a veces los lleva a Desaguadero.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas. comprará materiales para continuar confeccionando mantas.

Su deseo es salir adelante y seguir con su negocio para poder sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 43 years old, married, the mother of 3 children, studied up to the fifth year of secondary school and lives at Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 456, Juli district, Chuchito province, departament of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the “Pequeña Roma” Communal Bank of Juli. In the beginning, with the loan of S/: 300, she bought gas to sell in the market. As this product went up in price and there was no way out she changed her business and she continues weaving wool blankets, which she sells at S/.150 in Juli and sometimes she brings them to Desaguadero. With this loan of S/. 300, which will be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy materials to continue producing blankets. Her desire is to improve her life and continue with her business to be able to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy materials.

loans.name: Salomina

texts.es:
Salomina tiene 43 años de edad, cursó sus estudios del quinto grado de primaria, es casada, madre de cuatro hijos y vive en el sector Santa Maria Cucho del Centro Poblado Uros Chulluni, distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno.

desde hace un año es socia del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” de Puno. Con el préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital para comprar golosinas. Desde los 20 años de edad comenzó con este negocio, sus padres no trabajaban y por eso no estudió. Salomina vende todos los días en el paradero de Uros Chulluni.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará galletas, caramelos y gaseosas.

Su mayor deseo es construir su casa para que sus hijos puedan vivir tranquilos.
texts.en:
Salomina is 43 years old and studied until fifth grade in primary school. She is married and is the mother of four children. She lives in the area of Santa Maria Cucho of Centro Poblado Uros Chulluni, in the district of Puno in the region and state of Puno.

She has been a member of the Melchorita Saravia II Community Bank in Puno for a year. With a loan of 300 soles, she increased her capital to buy sweets. At the age of 20, she began this business. Her parents didn’t work and, therefore, she couldn’t finish school. Salomina works every day at the bus stop in Uros Chulluni.

With this loan of 500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy cookies, candy, and soda.

Her biggest dream is to build a home so that her children can live peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, candy, and soda

loans.name: Segunda Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de trece y nueve años, realizó estudios superiores y vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una nueva socia del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” de Juli. Desde los 34 años de edad se inició en este negocio, el cual le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, aumentará su capital para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan tener lo que ella no tuvo y que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Elisa is 42 years old and is a single mother of 2 children, who are 13 and 9 years old. She did her higher education and lives in the Jr. Sanra Cruz s/n, in the district of Juli, Chuchito, Puno.

She is a new member in the Pequeña Roma Community Bank in Juli. At the age of 34, she started her business, which allows her to take her children forward.

With this loan of 200 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will increase her capital so that she can buy more merchandise for her business of selling clothes.

She dreams that her children can have what she didn’t have and that they can be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Yuly Angela

texts.es:
Yuly tiene 19 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de una niña recién nacida, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. La Paz s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador”-Juli. Con el primer préstamo de S/: 300 aumentó su capital y compró un carrito salchipapero. A los 18 años de edad tuvo su esposo y tuvo  empezar a trabajar vendiendo salchipapas en el Jr. Cusco, por esa razón no continuo sus estudios superiores. Al mismo tiempo hace trabajos en bordados de bayeta que vende en el mismo Juli.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado 4 cuotas, comprará insumos para preparar salchipapas como salchichas, aceite, pollo y papa.

Su mayor deseo es tener un Restaurante en Juli o Puno donde pueda trabajar con comodidad.
texts.en:
Yuly is 19 years old, is married, and is the mother of a new-born daughter. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school and lives in Jr. La Paz s/n, in the district of Juli, Chuchito, Puno.

She is member of the Niño San Salvador Community Bank in Juli. With her first loan of 300 soles, she increased her capital and bought a kebab cart. At 18 years of age, she got married to her husband and had to being selling kebabs in the Jr. Cusco. As a result, she didn’t continue her education. At the same time, she does cloth embroidery that she sells in Juli.

With this loan of 500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy ingredients, like sausages, oil, chicken, and potatoes, to make kebabs.

Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant in Juli or Puno, where she can work in comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sausages, oil, chicken, and potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: working capital to manage her business

loans.name: Emilia Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Emilia Andrea A. A. tiene 53 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos, vive en el Barrio 3B Mz I lote 3 Alto Trujillo del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Emilia Andrea nació en Santiago de Chuco, donde vivió sus primeros años de vida, trabajó desde muy pequeña como ama de un bebé en Lima, para ser precisos desde los 8 años de edad, por lo que estudió en la nocturna.
Se casó a los 15años  y tiene 2 hijos y una hija, esta última residente en Chile por lo que Emilia tiene que velar por sus nietas que son dos.
Trabaja haciendo menú y manda confeccionar calzado, el cual lo vende por pedidos.
El primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas,  compró material para menú.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará más calzado para  volver a vender y también algunos insumos para hacer menú.
El gran sueño de Andrea es tener una casa cómoda,  para vivir con sus hijos cómodamente.
texts.en:
Emilia Andrea A. A. is 53 years old and belongs to the community banking group, "God Guides our Path." She lives at 3B Mz I lot #3 in the Alto Trujillo neighborhood of the El Porvenir district, in the province of Trujillo, located in the department (state) of La Libertad, Perú.

Emilia Andrea was born in Santiago de Chuco, where she spent her first years of life. She worked since she was very young as the caretaker of a baby in Lima, since she was 8 years old, to be exact, and as a result - she had to do her studies at night.

She married when she was 15 and had two boys and a girl. The girl resides in Chile and so Emilia watches over her two granddaughters.

She works making meals and shoes made to order. The first loan was for 300 soles which she returned in four installments. She bought ingredients for the meals. With this loan of 1200 soles, which will be paid back in four installments, she will buy more shoes to resell and also will make some reinvestments to make meals.

Andrea's dream is to have a comfortable home, to live with her sons comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase reinvestments to prepare meals and to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Cabrera

texts.es:
El señor O. B. Cabrera tiene la edad de 42 años su estado civil es soltero, no tiene hijos, solo un hermano el cual le ayuda en este negocio, uno de sus propósitos no se relacionan solamente con su negocio sino que son también personales y es mantener activo su negocio ya que este le ha generado ingresos, otros de sus propósitos  es suministrarle mejoras a su vivienda como seria: la instalación de piso, agua potable entre otras cosas ya que para el estas son una de las necesidades que ocupan mayor relevancia para el en lo personal por lo que sus propósitos son salir adelante y lograr lo que se ha propuesto para si mismo satisfacer sus necesidades.

El se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de bisutería en la que vende los productos de: golosinas, agua, tajaditas, galletas y jugo su ubicación es en León el tiempo que Don Estaciono tiene de poseer el negocio es de  20 años el inicio de este negocio se dio por una pequeña canasta la que contenía cigarrillos y caramelos y obtuvo afluencia de clientes y al ver que no cubría la demanda decide invertir mas en su negocio es por eso el motivo del financiamiento para  incrementar en su producto por lo que es necesario la compra de estos productos ya que Don Estaciono realiza las compras en las diferentes distribuidoras de león por lo que le resultas mas favorable y agradece trabajar con  fundación León 2000    y otras organizaciones que le facilitaron este tipo de crédito.
texts.en:
O. B. Cabrera is 42 years old and single. He doesn't have any children, just a brother who helps him in this business. One of his goals is a personal matter, as well as a business matter: to keep his business active since it is generating income. Another of his purposes is to make improvements to his home, such as floor installation, potable water, and other items, since for him, these are some of the needs that are of the greatest relevance for him personally. His goals are to get ahead and achieve what he has proposed to meet his needs. He sells costume jewelry and also sells sweets, water, cookies, and juice. He is located in León. Don Estaciono has had the business for 20 years. It began as a small stand that had cigarettes and caramels and grew due to customers. When he saw that demand wasn't met, he decided to invest more in his business. For this reason, he seeks financing to increase his products, and to buy those products from different distributors in León. This results in a more favorable pricing. Don Estaciono is grateful to work with Fundación León 2000 and other organizations that facilitate these types of loans.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Armida Elena

texts.es:
La señora Armida Elena H. Rodríguez tiene 22 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras y vive en la calle Desamparados 792 en el Balneario Buenos Aires Norte del distrito Víctor Larco de la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento d La Libertad Perú.
Estudió auxiliar de contabilidad en un instituto tecnológico, pero no pudo continuar por falta de medios económicos. Es madre soltera de un lindo bebe.
Es vendedora ambulante, empezó vendiendo las golosinas  y fruta en baldes grandes, gracias a su esfuerzo y a los prestamos de Manuela pudo completar para comprar un triciclo. Ahora va por las calles vendiendo, golosinas y fruta, llegada la tarde, mas o menos las 4 de la tarde hace mini parrilla que le llaman parrillita en una pequeña parrilla.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles pagados en 4 cuotas, amplió su negocio vendiendo raspadilla porque fue en tiempo de verano.
Con este crédito de 750 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas piensa terminar de pagar un segundo triciclo y pintarlo para que tenga presencia, manifiesta.
Elena sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Armida Elena H. Rodríguez is 22 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” and lives at Desamparados Street 792 in the resort community North Buenos Aires in Victor Larco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She studied accounting assistant in a technical institute, but she couldn’t continue because she lacked economic means. She is a single mother of a beautiful baby. She is a street vendor, she began selling candy and fruit in large buckets. Thanks to the loans from Manuela she was able to save enough to buy a tricycle. Today on the street she sells candy and fruit, and in the afternoon around 4 she sets up a mini grill. Her first loan for 300 soles was repaid in 3 payments and she expanded her business to include selling shaved ice because it was summer. With this loan for 750 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she is planning to pay for a second tricycle and paint it so that is has a noticeable presence. Elena dreams of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase a tricycle

loans.name: Benigna Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Benigna Amelia P. HU. tiene 50 años, pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Desamparados 677 balneario de Buenos Aires Norte del distrito de Víctor Larco provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa pero no pudo seguir estudiando por motivos económicos, ya que vivía en la sierra donde no había educación superior, es de Santiago de Chuco.
Benigna es madre soltera, tiene un hijo por el que tiene que trabajar y luchar para mantenerlo y darle una vida digna.
Trabajaba vendiendo  insumos para el calzado, pero actualmente se dedica a elaborar adornos para el calzado, aprendió a hacerlos y ahora es su actual negocio.  También trabaja en un taller de costura. El negocio es en su propia casa.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas con lo que compró materiales para los adornos.
Con este crédito de 350 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas ampliará su negocio, comprando cueros, lencería y otros materiales.
Su sueño es darle una vida cómoda a su hijo y verlo profesional.
texts.en:
Benigna Amelia P. HU. is 50 years old, is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras II community bank and lives at Desamparados 677 in the Buenos Aires Norte neighborhood in the Víctor Larco district, Trujillo Province, La Libertad department in Perú. She is from Santiago de Chuco and finished primary school but couldn't continue studying for economic reasons, since she lived in a mountainous region where there wasn't higher education. Benigna is a single mother, has a son for whom she has to work and fight to support and provide with a dignified life. She worked selling materials for shoe stores but currently works actually making decorations for shoes. She learned to make them and now it is her current business. She also works in a sewing workshop. The business is in her own home. Her first loan was for 300 Soles, repaid in 4 months with which she purchased materials for her decorations. With this loan of 350 Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will expand her business, buying leather, linens, and other materials. Her dream is to provide a comfortable life for her son and see him become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather and other materials for shoe decorations

loans.name: Betsabe Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Betsabe C. Gormás tiene 45 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos, vive en la Mz. J lote 6 Barrio 3B distrito El Porvenir D. la ciudad D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo D. Secundaria porque se casó a los 17 años, tiene 7 hijos 6 hombres y una mujer, 3 D. los cuales  son independientes y 4 dependen D. ella.
Betsabe se dedica a la compra venta D. carne, compra carne D. res, carnero, cerdo, pollo D. los camales y venD. en un pequeño puesto del mercado Nuevo Futuro D. su barrio.
Con el primer préstamo D. 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, invirtió en su negocio comprando un poco más D. carne D. res y D. cerdo.
