Bringing palm oil and vegetables from her farm to her community will reduce the transportation costs of her clients. These clients will be able to purchase these items nearby.  She is confident that this loan will allow her to provide more products and therefore sell more.

With the profits from this loan, Mary hopes to expand her business and farming activities.  She also plans to support her children, improve their education, and increase her family`s living standards. She knows she will not have a problem with her repayments because her loan schedule is designed so that her payments are small and regular.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil, cultivate farm land, and invest in transportation

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Habitante du village de Téné, les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames dans la préfecture de San(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Unies par des relations de parenté, de voisinage et professionnel, ces femmes font à majorité l’achat et la vente de céréales. Une seule fait le métier de tailleur en plus de son commerce de céréales.
Les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 100.000 FCFA pour le quatrième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de céréales (fonio haricot, petit mil, maïs etc.)dans les différentes foires des villages environnants auprès des producteurs et quelques fois sur place à Téné. Elles revendent ces produits aux commerçants venant des grandes villes telles que San, Koutiala, Bla, Ségou et Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) généralement au comptant, en détail, en gros et à crédit. 
En raison de la rotation rapide et de la marge bénéficiaire importante, les femmes comptent réaliser en moyenne 100 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Residents of the village of Téné, the members of the group Benkadi are married women averaging 42 years of age and five children. They live in polygamous families in San Prefecture (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). United by ties of kinship, community, and profession, these women mainly do buying and selling of grain. One of them is a seamstress by trade in addition to her commerce in grain. The group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. The loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 100,000 francs for the fourth loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The current loan will be used to buy sacks of grain (fonio, beans, pearl millet, corn, etc.) in different markets in surrounding villages from producers and sometimes locally in Téné. They sell these products to merchants from big cities, such as San, Koutiala, Bla, Ségou, and Bamako (capital of Mali), and generally in cash at the retail level and on credit at the wholesale level. Due to the high turnover and sizable profit margins, the women intent to realize an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA per cycle that will serve to cover the loan interest and to cope with typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods to resell them

loans.name: Seldina Esperanza

texts.es:
Seldina es socia de Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Seldina es conviviente, tiene 51 años y tiene 3 hijos de 28, 21 y 17 años. El mayor de sus hijos trabaja en una farmacia, el segundo hijo está en el instituto y el ultimo esta en el colegio. 
Seldina tiene su negocio de venta de gas en su casa, empezó hace 3 años con este negocio. También tiene negocio de Internet, Seldina antes vendía dulces en la calle como ambulante, ahora se siente alegre porque puede trabajar en su casa, es mas tranquilo y ya no tiene que caminar de acá para allá todo el día. 
Seldina necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas. 
Seldina sueña con seguir creciendo en  su negocio que ahora tiene y poner mas adelante otro negocio  una librería.
texts.en:
Seldina is a member of the San Gabriel Community Bank. She is 51 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children, ages 28, 21 and 17. The eldest works at a pharmacy, the middle child studies at an institute and the youngest is in high school. Seldina sells gas at her home, a business she started three years ago. She also has an Internet service business. Previously she sold candy on the streets, and now she feels happy because she can work at home, is more relaxed and doesn't have to walk this way and that all day. Seldina is requesting a $150 loan to invest in the purchase of gasoline. Her dream is to keep growing her business and later open a book store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gasoline

loans.name: Katherine Gina

texts.es:
Katherine es socia de Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Katherine es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año, el mayor de sus hijos está en el jardín. 
Katherine tiene su negocio de comida, prepara desayuno, ella  empezó con este negocio  hace 7 años. Catherine reparte desayuno a obras que le hacen pedidos . 
Katherine necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de insumos para la comidas y desayunos que va a repartir. Ella antes vendía pasteles, dulces, pero vio que ganaba mas en las comidas.
Katherine sueña con poner un restaurante, ya que sabe preparar ricos desayunos, comidas y también dulces .
texts.en:
Katherine is a partner in the Saint Gabriel Community Bank. She is 20 years old and lives with her partner. Katherine has two children. Her four year old is in kindergarten, and she also has a one year old. Katherine sells meals, a business which she started seven years ago. She prepares meals and delivers breakfasts by request. She needs a loan of 400 soles which she'll use to buy ingredients for her meals. She used to sell pastries and candies, but saw that she could earn more by selling meals. Katherine dreams of having a restaurant, because she now knows how to prepare delicious breakfasts, meals, and sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Katherine needs a loan of 400 soles, which she'll invest in ingredients for her meals. She used to sell pastries and sweets, but she saw that she could earn more money by selling meals.

loans.name: Aseh Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a widow with seven children. She lives in Mbengwi, a town about an hour outside Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in selling palm oil and rearing pigs. More specifically, this loan will be used for pig feed and the purchase of palm oil. She intends to invest 30,000 CFA (60 USD) of her personal savings in her businesses.

This is Lydia's fourth loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since 2004. The prime location of her business will help her succeed. As well, her children can help her whenever she needs an extra hand or if she is ill. She also has the security of large pigs to sell if she ever needs extra capital.

The profits from this loan will be used to take care of her young grandchild and pay the school fees for her two children under 15. She profited largely from her past loans and was able to exchange ideas, problems, and solutions with other members and credit assistants. This exchange of information has helped her business skills greatly.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Pig feed, a male pig, a female pig, palm oil

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Téné de la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali), les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes ayant en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles se connaissent parfaitement car pratiquant la même activité économique, à savoir l’achat et la vente d’un condiment alimentaire appelé le fakoye et la fabrication d’une boisson alcoolisée locale appelée le Tchapalo.  Le fakoye est une feuille sauvage de couleur verte très appréciée par la population malienne et entrant dans la préparation des sauces surtout des régions nord du Mali. Le Tchapalo est fait à base de mil fermenté. 
Obtenant des commandes de toutes les régions du Mali, les membres du groupe ont décidé de chercher des ressources financières supplémentaires auprès de l’institution de Microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après trois prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de fakoye et de mil auprès de producteurs dans villages environnants de Téné. Tandis que les sacs de Fakoye sont envoyés à Gao(septième région administrative du Mali) pour la vente, le mil est transformé en Tchapalo et vendu dans les cabarets et sous des hangars aménagés dans les maisons. La vente se fait en gros et au comptant aux ménagères et aux restaurateurs.
Elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 125 000 CFA. de bénéfice le long du prêt qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Living in traditional extended families in the village of Téné (San Prefecture, the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali), the members of the group Benkadi are women who average 42 years of age and four children. The women know each other quite well because they do the same work, namely buying and selling a condiment called fakoye and making a local alcoholic beverage called tchapalo. Fakoye is a wild leaf, green in color and highly valued by the people in Mali. It is used in making sauces, especially in northern Mali. Tchapalo is made from fermented millet. Obtaining orders from all regions of Mali, the group members decided to look for additional financial resources from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After three solidarity loans, all correctly repaid, they are on their fourth loan. The current loan will be used to buy sacks of fakoye and millet from producers in villages surrounding Téné. While the sacks of fakoye are sent to Gao (7th administrative region of Mali) to be sold, millet is transformed into tchapalo and sold in cabarets or out of covered stalls that are set up in homes. These are wholesale transactions made in cash to homemakers and restauranteurs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and millet

loans.name: Fotemogoban (La Valeur Humaine Est Intarissable)) Group

texts.fr:
Vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies (avec les enfants, les coépouses, et les autres parents de la belle famille) dans le village de Téné de la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali), les membres du groupe fotemogoban sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 39 ans et 7 enfants. Ce groupe fait essentiellement le commerce de céréales (fonio, haricot et poids de terre.) et d’autres divers petits articles. 
Travaillant depuis deux ans avec l’institution de Microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 125.000 FCFA pour le quatrième prêt. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de fonio, d’haricots et de pois de terre à Fangaso et à Djeli pour les revendre dans les marchés des préfectures de San et de Koutiala à des revendeurs venant des villes de Ségou et de Bamako. La rotation de l’activité est très rapide car le cycle (achat-vente) est hebdomadaire. Ainsi la marge bénéficiaire est importante et les membres du groupe fotemogoban envisagent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA le long du prêt.
texts.en:
Living in extended traditional families (with children, co-spouses, and in-laws) in the village of Téné in San prefecture (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), the members of Fotemogoban group are women who are married, and on average are 39 years old with seven children. The group is primarily involved in trading crops (fonio, beans, and peas) and other small items. Working for the past two years with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, the loan amounts have gone from 50,000 the first time to 125,000 FCFA for the fourth loan. The current loan will be used to buy bags of fonio (a kind of millet), beans, and peas in Fangaso and Djeli to retail them in the markets in San and Koutiala prefectures to retailers who come from Ségou and Bamako. Turnaround is very quick because the cycle (purchase-sale) is weekly. Thus the profit margin is significant and the members of Fotemogoan group plan to make an average profit of 100,000 FCFA during the loan period.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items for retail

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: Valeria A. A. es un miembro del banco comunal las gaviotas, que significa “seagulls” en español. Valeria se dedica a la venta de zapatos para niños, pero también venda zapatos para mayores.  Ella trabaja diario en uno de los mercados más visitados en la area. Utilizará su préstamo de 1000 soles para invertir en su negocio con la compra de zapatos. Actualmente ella estå ahorrando para comprar para comprar tierra para construir una casa propia. Ella quiere apoyar a sus hijos para que siguen adelante con sus estudios y desea seguir trabajando con su negocio,
texts.en:
Valeria A. A. is a member of the Las Gaviotas Community Bank, whose name means “the seagulls” in Spanish. Valeria sells shoes, mostly for children, but also various types for adults. She works daily at one of the busiest local markets in the area. She will use her loan of 1000 soles to invest in more shoes. She is currently saving to purchase her own land to build a house. She also hopes to ensure that her children continue studying and that she will be able to continue working on her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will use her loan of 1000 soles to invest in her business by purchasing more shoes

loans.name: Sabougnouma (La Bonne Cause Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes (deux mariées et deux veuves) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et de 5 enfants, les membres du groupe Sabougnouma vivent dans des familles polygames avec les coépouses, les enfants le mari et plusieurs parents dans le village de N’tonaso de la préfecture de Koutiala(troisième région administrative du Mali).
Elles mènent essentiellement l’activité d’achat et de vente des condiments alimentaires. Le montant des prêts obtenus auprès de Soro Yiriwaso est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 75.000 FCFA pour le neuvième prêt.  Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs d’oignons, des bidons d’huile alimenaires et divers autres condiments alimentaires auprès des grossistes du grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Elles effectuent leurs ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit, à domicile et de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers dispersés du village.
Elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 50 000 CFA. de bénéfice qui sera utilisé pour renforcer essentiellement le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Made up of four women (two married and two widows) with an average age of 50 and, on average, 5 children, the members of the Sabougnouma group live in polygamous families with their co-spouses, children, husband and several relatives in the village of N’tonaso in the prefecture of Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali).

Their businesses consist essentially in buying and re-selling condiments. The amount of their loans from Soro Yiriwaso has gone from 50,000 F CFA for their first loan to 75,000 F CFA for their 9th loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

The present loan will be used to buy sacks of onions, jerry-cans of cooking oil, and various other condiments from wholesalers at the big open-air market of Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali.) They sell on a cash basis, retail, or on credit, from their homes and as ambulant saleswomen in the various widely separated areas of the village.

They expect to make an average profit of 50,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to boost their working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Bacilio Jose

texts.es: El señor Bacilo José Velásquez tiene la edad de 31  años habita en el barrio C. ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa y tres hijos , la esposa se don Bacilio trabaja como comerciante  y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa , el tiene un negocio desde hace 15 años el cual le genera ingresos y la ves se dedica a la agricultura , una de las hijas de Don Bacilio de 16 años le ayuda con la pulpería , los sueños de el es darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos . El solicita un monto de C$ 6,000.00 para comprar insumos ya que necesita que los cultivos estén en buen estado para así vender un buen precio.
texts.en:
Bacilio Jose V., 31, lives in the C. neighborhood of Ticuantepe with his wife and three children. His wife buys and sells merchandise and helps with household expenses. Bacilio has operated an income-generating farming business for 15 years. One of his daughters, who is 16, helps with the store. Bacilio's dreams focus on making a better life for his kids. He's applying for C$6,000 loan to buy supplies to ensure that his crops are in good condition so that he can sell them for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pesticides and fertilizers for crops.

loans.name: Sy-Koutiala-00050 Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi de l’association Sodia ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’tonaso de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative du Mali)
Liées par des relations essentiellement de parenté, elles mènent différentes activités qui va de la fabrication du savon, de la teinture, la restauration à la vente des produits cosmétiques.
 C’est dans leurs recherches de ressources complémentaires qu’elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis cinq années. Après neuf prêts solidaires tous remboursés sans difficulté, les membres de ce groupe sont à leurs dixièmes prêts. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, cents kilogrammes d’ haricots, 20 litres d’huiles alimentaires et d’autres ingrédients (colorants, potasses etc.).au grand marché de Koutiala auprès des commerçants des domaines concernés.
Les articles vendus au marché, à la maison, dans les gargotes et de façon ambulante à une clientèle riche et variée. 
Elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 100 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle qui sera utilisé pour développer leurs activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkadi group of Sodia association have an average age of 40 and, on average, 4 children. They live in big extended traditional families in the village of N’tonaso in the prefecture of Koutiala (3rd administrative region of Mali).

United essentially by bonds of family, they have various businesses: from making soap to doing dyeing, to food service and selling cosmetics. It was in their search for additional financial resources that they decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 9 solidarity loans, all reimbursed without difficulty, the members of this group are on their 10th loan.

This loan will be used to buy 100 kg of beans, 20 liters of cooking oil, and other business items (dyes, potash, etc.) in the big market of Koutiala, from merchants who sell those goods.

Their merchandise is sold in the market, out of their homes, or door-to-door to a richly varied clientele. They are counting on making an average profit of 100,000 F CFA per loan cycle which will be used to expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items (cosmetics, food ingredients, raw materials for soap-making and dyeing)

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en: Juana Maria L. V. is a member of the community bank Las Gaviotas, which means “the seagulls” in Spanish. Juana lives with her husband and their 3 children who are in school. Juana sells fruit daily; with her loan of 500 soles, she will invest in her business by purchasing bananas, mangoes, strawberries, oranges and peaches. She is currently saving to ensure her business continues to be successful. Her dream is to open a store of her own.

loans.use: Purchase bananas, mangoes, strawberries, oranges and peaches.

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es:
De 41 años de edad y 3 de ellos en la labor de fabricación y venta de calzado, la señora María ha alcanzado la estabilidad deseada laboralmente, siendo ahora su anhelo el lograr una mejor calidad de vida paralelamente, para, así, poder brindarle a sus 2 hijos lo que ella no pudo gozar al provenir de una familia de pocos recursos. Su mayor hijo, de 22 años, estudia y trabaja a la vez, lo que es un gran esfuerzo en pro de su familia misma y, su menor hijo, de 13 años, cursa el colegio. A nivel de la capital, el rubro de calzados es de mucha competencia, por lo que la señora pugna por estar a la vanguardia de los modelos y de los insumos que requiera para éstos, sabiendo, por su experiencia, que aquel esfuerzo es sinónimo de un ulterior éxito. 

Para alcanzar dicha meta, urge de 1000 soles como préstamo, los servirían como bastión para su futura inversión y, por ende, superación, no sólo personal sino también a todo nivel familiar.
texts.en:
At 41 years old, 3 of those spent creating and selling footwear, Señora María has laboriously achieved the stability she sought. Her desire now is to attain a better quality of life in order to provide for her two children the things she could never enjoy, coming from a family with few means of support. Her elder son, 22, studies and works, a great effort for his family, and the younger son, 13, is in school. Financially, the footwear line is very competitive, so this lady strives to be in the forefront with new models and materials, knowing from her experience that such an effort is synonymous with ultimate success. In order to attain this goal, she is requesting a loan of $325, which will be a bulwark against any future reversals, to maintain the level of herself and her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of capital to obtain the supplies for the manufacture of footwear

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Badenya (Fraternité) Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres (5 mariées, 3 célibataires et une veuve) du groupe Badenya ont en moyenne 29 ans, 2 enfants et vivent à majorité dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Bamanan kin de Kirango Markala de la préfecture de Ségou(quatrième région économique du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de cousinage dans le quartier et font toutes la même activité à savoir l’achat et la vente de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique), fancy et de la friperie. En plus de vêtement elles font de temps à autre la vente du bois de chauffe.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leur commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles son troisième cycle après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents prêts.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 40 pièces de pagnes wax et fancy et 5 colis de friperie communément appelé «YOUGOU YOUGOU ». Elles s’approvisionnent en pagnes et en vêtements à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et à Ségou auprès des grossistes. Les produits sont vendus dans la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou Markala et au marché journalier de Kirango Markala à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant à crédit et en détail.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen et mensuel de 30.000FCFAqui sera utilisé pour acheter les fournitures scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The nine members (five married, three single, and one widow) of the Badenya group are on average 29 years old, have two children, and live mostly in traditional extended families in the Bamanan kin neighborhood of Kirango Markala of Ségou prefecture (the fourth economic region of Mali). The women know each other through family and neighborhood connections and are involved in the same business activity, selling fancy pagnes wax (colorful textiles used to make clothes that are very sought after in Africa), as well as second-hand clothes. In addition to clothing, they also sometimes sell firewood. In hopes of increasing the size of their business, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and they are now on their third loan cycle after having properly repaid the two previous loans. The women plan to use this loan to buy 40 bolts of fancy pagne wax fabric and five parcels of second-hand clothing, commonly known as "Yougou Yougou." They will buy their stock of fabric and clothing in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and Ségou from wholesalers. Their products are sold in the weekly market at Diamarabougou Markala and the daily market at Kirango Markala to a clientele made up of men and women buying on cash, credit, and retail. The women each plan to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to buy school supplies for their children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles and second-hand clothing

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.en:
Ancelma Huamni Y. is a member of community bank Las Gaviotas, which means “seagulls” in Spanish. She is a single mother of 3, the eldest of whom is currently studying at the university.

Ancelma uses her uncle’s oven to make desserts to sell while walking around in the city and also when someone orders a pastry. With her loan of 400 soles, she will invest in her business and purchase oil and flour, butter and eggs. She is saving so her children can get an education. She would also like to buy her own land, open her own pastry store and purchase an oven.

loans.use: purchase oil and flour, butter and eggs

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Justina es madre soltera, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Justina vende quesos que adquiere en los terminales terrestres de la ciudad de Ayacucho de las personas que viajan a las ferias, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Lima en el mercado de abastos a donde viaja cada 15 días y dependiendo de la demanda.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Justina son tener un negocio estable, capital propio.
texts.en:
Justina is a partner of the Seagulls Community Bank. She is 31 years old and a single mother of two. Justina sells cheeses that she buys in the bus terminals of Ayachucho, from the people who travel to the markets. She sells the cheeses in Lima's supplies market, where she travels roughly once every 15 days, depending on the demand. Justina needs a loan of 600 soles, which she'll use to purchase cheeses. She dreams of having a stable business, with her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Justina needs a loan of 600 soles, which she'll invest in the purchase of cheeses.

loans.name: Estrellas Brillante Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five women trying to receive loans to increase their businesses. The name of their group is "Estrellas Brillante". Each one of these members has received loans before, and all of them were very diligent in paying back their loans.

Alicia is the representative of this group, and has proven to be a very hardworking woman. She said she has to work hard because she has four young children that she needs to take care of and feed. She has a small business selling food in her area. She hopes to have her own restaurant someday, and move out of the area she is in. She said it's a goal to put all her kids through high school, and hopefully they will be able to go to college someday. She is ready to start changing her life and the life of her children!

On behalf of Alicia, the group, and Esperanza International - Thank you for your help!!!

loans.use: To buy products for making food

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Rosalina es separada, tiene 46 años y 6 hijos, Rosalina vende emoliente (bebida caliente preparada con semillas de lino, hierbas, cebada, que tiene propiedades curativas) sus ventas los realiza ambulantemente en una carreta en una avenida céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Rosalina teje chompas, borda manteles y los vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Rosalína necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago del albañil porque en los últimos meses termino de construir su casa.
Rosalina sueña con mejorar aun mas su casa e implementar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a partner of the Seagulls Community Bank. She is 46 years old and separated, with six children. Rosalina sells emoliente (a hot drink prepared with flax seed, herbs, and barely, which has curative properties) along a central road in the city of Ayacucho. Rosalina also sews sweaters and embroiders place mats. She sells these in the market of Ayacucho. Rosalina needs a loan of 800 soles, which she'll use to to pay the bricklayer who is finishing the construction of her house. Rosalina dreams of improving her home and starting another business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the bricklayer because her house is in the final stages of being built

loans.name: Hilda Victoria

texts.es: Hilda Victoria C. García: Casada, guatemalteca, de 34 Años con residencia  Final de la Zona 1, Totonicapán. Esta señora labora en el comercio (venta de ropa) lo cual inicia su negocio comprando ropa de segunda (usadas) que luego los pone a la venta  y así obtener pequeñas ganancias, con la ayuda de su esposo decidieron agrandar el negocio comprando ropa nueva para obtener un poquito más de ganancias. Con el crédito que solicita en ASDIR pretende aumentar el capital de trabajo, ya que se acerca las fiesta de fin de año y como la apertura del nuevo ciclo escolar dos mil nueve es la  epoca de mejor venta.
texts.en:
Hilda Victoria C. G.: married, Guatemalan, 34 years old with residence at the end of Zone 1, Totonicapan. This hard working woman in commerce (clothing sales) which she established her business buying used clothes whih she lader put up for sale and so obtained small earnings, with the help of her husband they decided to grow the business buying new clothes to obtain a little bit more earnings. With the credit which she is asking for in ASDIR she intends to increase the working capital, now that New Years is getting closer and the beginning of the new school cycle 2009 is the largest season for sales.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying merchandise

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Brigida es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Brigida vende golosinas variadas de manera ambulatoria en el parque central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza  por las noches desde las 6 hasta las 11 de la noche. Además Brigida en algunas oportunidades lava ropa ajena.
Brigida necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos.
Los sueños de Brigida son construir su casa, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the Las Gaviotas ("Seagulls") community bank. She is 37 years old, partnered and has 5 children. She works as a street vendor selling various kinds of snacks in the main park of the city of Ayacucho. She works from 6:00 in the evening to 11:00 at night. She also takes in laundry. Brigida needs a 400-soles loan that she will invest in buying cookies and candy for her business. Brigida's goals are to build a house, improve her business and give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Maximiliana es casada, tiene 43 años y 9 hijos, Maximiliana venD. emoliente (bebida caliente preparada con semillas D. lino, hierbas, cebada, que tiene propiedades curativas) sus ventas los realiza ambulantemente en una carreta y se ubica diariamente en una calle céntrica que se ubica cerca D. los terminales terrestres.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, linaza, cebada.
Maximiliana sueña con mejorar su casa, ampliar su negocio y educar a todos sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a partner of the Seagulls Community Bank. She is 43 years old and married, with nine children. Maximiliana sells emolinte (A hot drink that has curative properties. It is prepared with flax seeds, herbs, and barley). She sells the emolinte walking up and down a busy street and also stations herself each day on a central street near the bus terminal. Maximiliana needs a loan of 600 soles which she'll invest in sugar, linseed, and barley. Maximiliana dreams of improving her house, growing her business, and educating all of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maximiliana needs a loan of 600 soles, which she'll invest in sugar, linseed, and barley.

loans.name: Elizabeth Manuela

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Elizabeth es casada, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Elizabeth vende gelatinas y canchas, que ella misma prepara con la ayuda de sus hijos, algunas de las canchas los compra de los mayoristas, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente en una calle concurrida de la ciudad, en algunas oportunidades viaja a las ferias de la región donde también vende los mismos productos.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gelatina, aceite, azúcar.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos, ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the communal bank, "Las Gaviotas." She is married, is 47-years-old, and has 6 children. Elizabeth sells gelatin and toasted corn, which she herself prepares with the help of her children. She buys some of the corn from wholesalers. She makes her sales as a street vendor on a crowded street in the city. Sometimes she has the opportunity to travel to markets in the region where she also sells the same products. Elizabeth needs a loan of 400 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of gelatin, oil, and sugar. Elizabeth's dreams are to buy a car to transport her products and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elizabeth needs a loan of 400 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of gelatin, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu A. is 52 years old, married and mother of five children, who are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling food products like maize, bags of millet, beans, groundnuts and gari to her loyal customers in the neighborhood. She says that selling these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family. 

A. is a member of the group called Wadala (Enjoyment) Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee social collateral for each other and to assist one another with the loan repayments. Her picture was taken during their group visit.

loans.use: To increase inventory of maize, millet, groundnuts, gari and beans.

loans.name: Maríanila

texts.es:
Maríanila es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Marínala es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos, Marínala vende comida de manera ambulatoria en una calle cercana a los terminales terrestres, actividad que realiza desde las 6 hasta las 10 de la noche. 
Marínala necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ají, ajo, comino.
Marianala sueña con tener casa propia, un negocio estable y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maríanila is a member of Las Gaviotas Communal Bank. She is 22, living with her partner and 2 children. She is a street vendor of food in a street near the overland terminals, which she does from 6 am until 10 pm. Marínala needs a loan of $200 to purchase chili, garlic, and cumin. Marínala dreams of having her own house, a stable business, and that her children could complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chili, garlic, and cumin

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing to add to her inventory and toys to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo Víctor de 40 años y sus hijos Demetrio de 14 y Leucadia de 9. Se dedica desde hace ya 20 largos años a su trabajo de tejidos a máquina, en su mayoría teje chompas, pantalones y todo lo que su imaginación le indica para poder ofrecer a la venta y también por pedidos.
Lo que le gusta a Isabel de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo de trabajo, si quiere trabaja durante todo el día, a veces cuando tiene que atender a sus hijos trabaja por las noches. Por otro lado, cuando tiene pedidos debe encerrarse en su pequeño taller hasta acabar con toda la producción y se le hace abrumador, pero ella ha sabido responder muy bien, haciendo que su trabajo le resulte muy provechoso para generar los ingresos que ella necesita. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar mayor cantidad de material, como lanas de todas las calidades y colores para poder hacer que sus prendas sean mejor vendidas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 49-years old and lives with her husband Victor (40-years old) and their children Demetrio (14) and Leucadia (9). She has worked for 20-years making fabrics, weaving the best sweaters, pants and everything one could imagine to sell and for orders. What Isabel appreciates most about her job is how she’s able to dispense her time. If she wants, she can work all day, or at times if she needs to attend to her children then she’ll work at night. On the other hand, sometimes when she has orders to close production by deadlines it’s somewhat hard to do so in the small shop that she has - it’s quite overwhelming, but she has responded well and the benefits of her work prove to generate the much needed profits. This is the first loan request from Microfinanzas PRISMA and with these funds, Isabel will be able to buy a larger supply of wool of all kinds of quality and colors in order to make the best clothes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a large supply of wool for her shop.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul H. is 32 years old and is a married father with one child who is currently in school. To support his family, Abdul has been selling fresh meat in the busy market of Ashaiman in the neighborhood to his loyal customers. Abdul has been in this business for the past six years and he says it is very lucrative; therefore, he wants to expand his inventory so he can add sheep and goat meat to the existing meats he is selling.

Abdul H. is a member of the community group called Wadala (Enjoyment) Trust group. Members in this group have agreed to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan. His picture was taken when he was visited.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh meat in a large quantity.

loans.name: Luzmila Concepcion

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Luzmila es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos de 20 y 15 años. El menor de sus hijos todavía está en el colegio y el último está en el Instituto.
Luzmila tiene su negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y pedidos de diversos artículos, ella vende como ambulante, en su primer préstamo compró lanas y tejía chompas después las vendía, ahora que se viene el verano quiere vender sandalias y ropa de temporada.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pedidos diversos que tiene (sandalias, zapatos, ropa). 
Luzmila en este momento tiene un problema de salud pues tiene dificultades en la columna.
Luzmila desde que recibe los prestamos ha podido comprar mercadería , pero quisiera poder acceder a un monto más alto de préstamo pues tiene muchos pedidos de ropa, zapatos.
Luzmila sueña con tener una boutique propia para ya no estar de ambulante.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of Mar del Plata Communal Bank. Luzmila is married, 43, with two children 20 and 15. The younger is still in school, the elder is in secondary school. Luzmila's business is selling clothing and shoes, she takes orders for the various articles. A street vendor, with her first loan she bought wool and knit articles that she then sold. For the upcoming summer, she wants to sell sandals and seasonal clothing. Luzmila needs a loan of $200 to purchase various articles (sandals, shoes, and clothing). Luzmila currently has a health problem, a difficulty with her spine. Luzmila, as soon as she receives her funds, has been able to purchase merchandise, but she wants to increase her loan because she has many orders for clothing and shoes. Luzmila dreams of having her own shop, so she will no longer have to be a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funds to fulfill various orders she has for clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Gloria es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos de 23, 21, 15, 15 y 12 años. Tiene 2 hijas gemelas que todavía están en el colegio , sus 2 hijos mayores trabajan.
Gloria tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos, ella tiene este negocio  desde hace 4 años Gloria trabaja con los productos de( Ebel, Esika, Unique, Avon).    
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos. Para tener en stock.
Gloria desde que recibe los préstamos ha logrado tener varios productos en stock.  
Gloria sueña con surgir mas en su negocio que ahora tiene  y lograr poner un bazar, donde pueda mostrar los productos que vendo.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank “Mar del Plata.” Gloria is married, 52 years old, and has 5 children ages 23, 21, 15, 15, and 12 years old. She has 2 twin daughters who are still in secondary school, her two oldest sons work. Gloria has had a cosmetic business for 4 years. Gloria works with Ebel, Esika, Unique, and Avon products. Gloria needs a loan for 400 soles which will be used to buy cosmetics so that she can have stock on hand. Since receiving loans Gloria has been able to have various products in stock. Gloria dreams of growing her business larger than it currently is and be able to open a store where she can display and show the products that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to increase her stock on hand.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Angélica es conviviente, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos de 26, 24, 22, 20, y 14 años, solo el último de sus hijos está en el colegio. Sus  demás hijos  trabajan.
Angélica tiene su negocio  desde hace 20 años, ella vende golosinas como ambulante frente a una botica..     
Angélica necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.  
Angélica sueña con tener asesoramiento  para poner un negocio grande quisiera  una tienda.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the Mar del Plata community bank. She's 50 years old, partnered and has 5 children who are 26, 24, 22, 20 and 14 years old. Her youngest child is still in school and the rest work. Angelica has operated her business for 20 years. She works as a street vendor selling candy across from a pharmacy. She needs a 400-soles loan, money that she'll invest in merchandise for resale. She would ultimately like to set up a larger business with her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal A. is a 32 year old businessman. He is a husband and the father of one male child who is currently in school. He trades in cows and onions. He buys the cows and the bags of onions from the northern part of Ghana, and sometimes travels to Niger and other West African countries. He then supplies restaurant operators with meat for their meals. Beef is enjoyed by many Ghanaian households because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable. 

Faisal's business progress is slow because of inadequate funds to buy the animals from the farmers. With the loan, he wishes to buy more cows and bags of onions. The loan will provide the resources he needs to meet the demands of his customers for good quality meat. He also hopes to save more to support his son in school. Faisal belongs to the community group called ‘Wadala’ Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loans. His photograph was taken after their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy cattle and bags of onions to supply restaurant operators

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es socia D. Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Josefina es casada, tiene 67 años y 7 hijos entre D. 56 y 32 años. 
Josefina tiene un negocio desD. hace 20 años, ella venD. todo lo que es lencería, Josefina tiene el puesto numero 7 en el mercado Virgen D. Lourdes, venD. todos los días.     
Josefina necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lencería , también en la compra D. polos.  
Josefina sueña con  surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of Mar del Plata Communal Bank. Josefina is 67 and married, with 7 children from 32 to 56 years old. She has had a business for 20 years selling all sorts of lingerie. She has stall no. 7 in the Virgen D. Lourdes market, selling every day. Josefina needs a loan of $200 to purchase lingerie as well as polo shirts. She dreams of increasing the stock for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lingerie and polo shirts

loans.name: Maria Herlinda

texts.es:
Maria es socia D. Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Maria es casada, tiene 68 años y 4 hijos D. 42, 40, 39 y 38 años. 
Maria tiene su negocio D. venta D. canastas, bolsas, gorros D. yute, también trabaja con hilo D. rata ella  empezó  con este negocio desD.  hace 3 años, solo confecciona pedidos que le hacen.    
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. materiales para elaborar sus canastas, gorros, va a  comprar hilos.   
María sufre D. la presión.
Maria a sueña con poder abrir una tienda para vender los productos que ella confecciona.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Mar del Plata Communal Bank. María is 68 and married, with 4 children 42, 40, 39 and 38. Her business is selling baskets, purses, straw hats. She also works with macrame, which she started 3 years ago, only creating orders she has already received. Maria needs a loan of $150 to buy the materials to create her baskets and purses, and to buy the yarns. María suffers from high blood pressure. She dreams of being able to open a shop to sell all the items that she creates.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to create her baskets and purses, and to buy macrame yarn.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 59 años y 5 hijos entre 35 y  27  años. 
Maria tiene su negocio de venta de comida en un local, empezó con este negocio desde  hace 10 años , ella entrega pedidos para obras, María vende todos los días .    
Maria necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales para implementar mi negocio, (mesas, sillas).  
María necesita un capital más grande para poder implementar mas su negocio.
Maria sueña con  ajuntar un buen capital y tener otro negocio en otro lugar.
texts.en:
María is a member of Mar del Plata Communal Bank. María is 59, lives with her partner, and has 5 children between 27 and 35. Her business is selling meals in her shop, which she began 10 years ago. She takes orders for special jobs and sells every day. María needs a loan of $150 to purchase supplies for her business (tables and chairs). She needs a greater capital to expand her business. She dreams of putting together a good capital and opening a second business in another location.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs to expand her business.

loans.name: Betty Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Betty Soledad S. M. D. C. tiene 59 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias al Éxito II y vive en la calle Prolongación La Marina  815 Mz F lote 3 del Asentamiento Humano Luis Alberto Sánchez en el Puerto D. Salaverry en la provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Betty Soledad es Técnica en Contabilidad, pero se casó a los 23 años y no continuó trabajando en su profesión. 
Tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 5 son casados y una hija que aun es estudiante y depenD. D. ella.
Betty tiene una bodega  que fue cedida por una hija, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta D. artículos D. belleza, actualmente tiene la ventaja que el negocio se ubica en su propia casa.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas implementó su negocio.
Con este crédito D. 300 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas comprará gaseosas, golosinas y otros insumos.
Betty sueña con regresar a visitar Argentina y reunirse con su hija que aun se encuentra en la patria gaucha.
texts.en:
Betty Soledad S. Maria D. C., 59, belongs to the Las Empresarias al Exito II ("Women Entrepeneurs for Success II") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She's a bookkeeper but she hasn't worked in the profession since she married. She has 6 children, 5 of whom are married. One daughter is still in school and lives at home.

Betty operates a small shop that she took over from one of her daughters. Before that, she maD. a living selling beauty products. She has the good fortune now of working at home. She got started in the business with her first loan of 300 soles which she repaid in 4 installments. With this 300-soles loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy soft drinks, candy and other merchandise.

Betty would like to go to Argentina again to see her daughter who is living there in the land of the "gaucho".

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

location.town: AA.HH. Luis Alberto Sánchez, Salaverry, Trujilloo

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción tiene 59 años, es viuda, vive sola, ya que no tuvo hijos. Tiene experiencia trabajando en la venta D. yeso hace 25 años, tiempo en el cual aprendió muy bien el oficio, para un año después poner su propio negocio D. venta D. yeso, el cual ahora arroja muy buenos ingresos a su hogar.
Lo  que le gusta a Concepción D. su trabajo es la tranquilidad que le brinda, ya que no tiene que hacerlo D. forma ambulatoria, por otra parte el tener que trasladar las bolsas D. yeso es un trabajo muy pesado, pero felizmente tiene la ayuda D. un joven, al cual le dio trabajo. Concepción está en su primer préstamo en microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero adquirirá mayores cantidades D. yeso para ofrecer a la venta.
texts.en:
Concepción is 59 years old, lives alone, and does not have children. She has been selling plaster for 25 years, during which time she learned this work very well. With only one year in this field she opened her own business selling plaster which continues well today and provides good income for her home. What Concepción likes about her job is the tranquility it provides her, she doesn’t have to sell on the street, but she does have to move the bags of plaster which is hard work, but happily she has the assistance of a young man to whom she gave work. This is Concepción’s first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. With the money she will buy large quantities of plaster to offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy large quantities of plaster to sell

loans.name: Razak

texts.en:
Razak B. is a 26 year old businessman. He is a married and the father of one male child who is currently in school. He has been trading in cows for five years now.  He buys the cattle from the northern part of Ghana and supplies them to restaurant operators as meat for their meals. Beef is enjoyed by many Ghanaian households because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable. 

Razak's business progress is slow because of inadequate funds to buy the animals from the farmers. The loan will give him the resources he needs to buy more cows to serve his customers and meet their demand for good quality meat. He also hopes to save more to support his son in school. He belongs to the community group called Saamu (Receiving) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loans. His photograph was taken after their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy cattle to supply restaurants with beef

loans.name: Clara Edelmira

texts.es:
La señora Clara Edelmira P. P. tiene 48 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos, vive en la Manzana I lote 34 del Barrio 3 B del distrito El Porvenir provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudiaba para ejercer como Auxiliar de Contabilidad en un Instituto pero no continuó porque se casó a los 26 años.
Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales, el mayor ya es independiente y los menores son estudiantes.
Clara tenía una bodega pero empezó a fiar sus productos y no pudo recuperar los créditos entonces tuvo que cerrar. Actualmente vende combinado, que consiste en servir un plato con tallarín, ceviche y papa con crema a la huancaína. Lo realiza en forma ambulante.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas compró cosas para su bodega, que ahora ya no la tiene.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será  cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará insumos y volverá a invertir en su actual negocio y tratará de reinvertir en su bodega.
Clara sueña con poner un gran restaurant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clara Edelmira Pareda P. is 48 years old and is a member of the communal bank Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos. She lives at Manzana I, Lot 34 in the neighborhood 3B in the district of El Porvenir, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied to work as an accountant aide at the Institute but did not continue because she was married at 26. She has 3 children, of which the oldest is already independent; the two younger ones are still students. Clara has a grocery store, but started to give them out on credit that she was later unable to collect, so she had to close shop. Today, she sells food which consists of a dish of tallarin, ceviche and potato with huancaína style cream. She sells this door to door. With the first loan of 300 soles, which she has returned in 4 installments, she bought products for her store which she no longer owns. With this loan of 800 soles, which will be payed back in 4 installments, she will purchase ingredients and food products and will again invest in her grocery store in addition to her current business. Clara hopes to eventually own a restaurant.f

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and food products

loans.name: Mamunatu

texts.en:
Mamunatu S. is 32 years old, married and has two children. She is an enterprising trader who is hard working, and has being trading for eleven years She has been selling food products such as maize, plantain, beans, groundnuts and gari in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. 

While her children are in school, she travels to the northern part of Ghana to purchase her products. She says that selling these food items is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make enough income to rent a storeroom. Mamunatu is a member of the group called Saamu (Receiving) Trust Group. Members agree to act as social collateral for each other and assist one another to repay the loans. Her picture was taken during their group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase maize, plantain, groundnuts, gari and beans for resale

loans.name: Mirna Gladis

texts.es: La señora Mirna habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 31 años de edad, se encuentra casada, su esposo es técnico forestal y le apoya C$ 2,000 para gastos de la casa, juntos tienen dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando en la primaria. Actualmente la señora Mirna se dedica a la venta de repostería y ropa, donde lo inicio hace 6 años con fondos prestados de un pequeño banco comunal, que al iniciar su actividad le era difícil obtener buenos ingresos en su negocio, ya que no contaba con sus propias maquinas para trabajar las reposterías, siempre ha trabajado con el apoyo de los prestamos, para ir mejorando su nivel de vida.  La señora Mirna esta solicitando para construir una pared en su casa y poder tener más seguridad, el monto que requiere es de C$ 5,000 aun plazo de 9 meses, así mismo ir realizando mejoras en su vivienda  poco a poco, también tiene planes que en  futuro pueda instalar su repostería en un lugar bien céntrico en la cuidad para así lograr mayores ingresos y apoyar mas a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirna lives in the Laureles Norte neighbrorhod, which is located in the capital, Managua. She is 31 years old and finds herself married, her husband is a forest technician, and he supports her with $2000 for the household expenses. Together they have two children, 7 and 5 years old, who are studying in primary school. Actually, Mirna is dedicated to the sale of clothes, which she started 6 years ago with funds loaned from a scamll community bank. At the beginningof her business, it was difficult to obtain a good income from her business since she couldn't count on her own machines to work, she was always counting on borrowed ones, to improve her level of living. Mirna is asking for a loan to build a wall in her house to be able to have more security, the amount that she needs is $5000 (Nicaraguan) with a term of 9 months, realizing for her self better living little by little, she also has plans to install her business in a good central location in the city to achieve better income and support her family more.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials to build a wall at her house

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Teresa habita en el barrio Lomas de Guadalupe, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 43 años de edad, se encuentra soltera, pero recibe la ayuda alimenticia del padre de sus hijos, donde tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente uno esta bajo el cuido de la señora Teresa. Actualmente la Sra. Teresa se desempeña como empleada domestica, tiene 3 años de brindar sus servicios a una familia, donde ella aspira en un futuro poder instalar un pequeño negocio para poder independizarse, así mismo requiere de un financiamiento para mejorar un poco su casa, donde esta necesitando la cantidad de C$ 5,000 aun plazo de 9 meses, ya que requiere ponerle unas gradas y embaldosar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa lives in the Lomas de Guadalupe neighborhood, a neighborhood which is located in the capital Managua, is 43 years old, finds herself single, but she receives help from her children's father, with whom she has four children, of which only one lives under Teresa's care. Actually, Teresa works as a domestic employee, she has sold her services for three years to a family, and she aspires in the future to create a small business to become independent, which will require financing to improve a little of her house, which is why she needs $5,000 Nicaraguan, which will be repaid in nine months.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cement and tools for her house

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 25 años, convive con su pareja Roger de 30 años, quien también es comerciante de zapatos y sus tres hijos Yerson de 6, Mariela de 4 y Ángela de 2. Ella es una madre amorosa, se dedica desde hace 6 años a su pequeña empresa de producción y venta de calzado, para poder mantener a su familia a la cual espera poder brindarle lo mejor. Gracias a Dios el negocio va progresando y le resulta cada vez más rentable, ya que los clientes ya van prefriendo sus bonitos zapatos. A Ana no se le hace complicado su trabajo, ya que trabaja a favor de sus hijos, los cuales son su razón de vivir y cada vez que tiene que hacer sacrificios, piensa en ellos para seguir adelante. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero comprará materiales para la elaboración de calzado, como son suelas, cuero, pasadores, hebillas, etc. para poder realizar acabados más finos y aumentar el precio y cantidad de sus zapatos.
texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old and lives with her partner 30 year old Roger, who is also sells shoes. They have three children, Yerson age 6, Mariela age 4, and Angela age 2. She is a loving mother. She has had her small business making and selling shoes for 6 years, which enables her to support her family with the hope of providing the best for her family. Thanks to God her business is growing and ever more profitable, as her customers prefer her beautiful shoes. Ana does not find her work complicated, she works for her children’s benefit, who are her reason for living and every time she has to make sacrifices she thinks of them and forges on. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. With the money she will buy materials to make shoes, such as insoles, leather, shoelaces, buckles, etc. to make her finished products even better and increase the price and quantity of her shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make shoes

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo Chug Rodríguez tiene 53 años y pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedora II, vive en la calle Desamparados 720 del balneario Buenos Aires Norte del distrito Víctor Larco de la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, quedó huérfana por lo que no pudo continuar sus estudios. Se casó a los 14 años pero por falta de comprensión se separó de su pareja.
Tiene 4 hijas cada cual con su compromiso.
Trabajaba en venta de zapatos y ropa, llegó a tener un restaurant, actualmente trabaja en sociedad con su hija, tienen un locutorio y una bodega de golosinas y otros productos. El negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró las golosinas.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará zapatos para ir a vender a Lima y de allí traerá ropa.
Consuelo sueña con tener un negocio bien implementado y poder cubrir todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Consuelo Chug Rodríguez is 53 years old and belongs to Enterprising Women II Communal Bank. She lives at 720 Desamparados Street in the resort town of North Buenos Aires in the Victor Larco district, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until 9th grade but then became orphaned and could not continue her studies. She married at 14 years old but due to a lack of understanding, she separated from her husband. She has four daughters, all of whom are on their own. She worked selling shoes and clothing, then she had a restaurant, and now she works alongside her daughter at their phone booth business and a general store with sweets and other products. The businesses are located in her home. With the first loan of 300 soles ($100), which were repaid over 4 months, she bought sweets. With this loan of 800 soles ($275), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy shoes to sell in Lima and she will bring clothing back with her. Consuelo dreams of having a well-stocked business and being able to cover all of her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es: La señora Hilda habita en el barrio Primavera, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 47 años de edad, se encuentra soltera, pero  recibe una pensión por parte del padre de sus,  donde tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad, ambos son estudiantes. Actualmente la señora Hilda se desempeña como empleada domestica, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, donde requiere  seguir esforzándose para obtener un nivel de vida mejor, al igual de poder apoyar a sus pequeños hijos en su formación educativa. La Sra. Hilda requiere de un financiamiento para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, donde esta necesitando la cantidad de C$ 15,000  aun plazo de 12 meses, para cambiar las puertas de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilda lives in the town of Primavera, a town in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is 47-years old and is single. She receives child support payments from the father of their two children, who are 13 and 10 years old. Both children are students. In actuality, Ms. Hilda currently serves as a maid and has been working in this capacity for the past 8-years, though it will take more on her part to achieve a better standard of living, like providing support for her little children’s formative education. Ms. Hilda requires funding for home improvements, where she’ll need a loan in the amount of C$15,000 to be repaid in 12-months, to change the doors of her home as they are currently in bad condition.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two doors for her house.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Doris Elizabeth de 30 años de edad, es la presidenta del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Desamparados 718 del balneario Buenos Aires Norte del distrito de Víctor Larco  provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio Enfermería Técnica y primer ciclo de Ingeniería Industrial, pero se casó y por falta de comprensión se separó de su pareja, entonces tuvo que empezar a trabajar para poder mantener a sus pequeños hijos,  que son tres.
Su negocio consiste en una bodega donde mayormente vende golosinas y otros insumos, también tiene un locutorio, pero aun no cuenta con cabinas. Se ubica en su casa.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas compró arroz, azúcar y papel higiénico.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará insumos y algunos utensilios  para elaborar postres, también venderá ropa interior, manifiesta que para ello compró una vitrina grande.
Doris, sueña con tener su propia movilidad.
texts.en:
Doris Elizabeth is 30 years old, president of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras II” and she lives at Desamparados Street 718, Buenos Aires Norte neighborhood, Victor Larco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She student technical nursing and the first year of industrial engineering, but she married and because of lack of understanding between she and her husband, they separated. She then had to begin to work in order to support her three small children. Her business consists of a convenience store where she sells candy and other consumable products, she also has a telephone café, but she doesn’t have private phone cabins yet. Her business is located in her home. With the first loan for 300 soles which was repaid in 4 payments she bought rice, sugar and toilet paper. With this loan for 800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy consumables and some utensils to make desserts, also she will sell underwear, for which she has purchased a display case. Doris dreams of having her own means of transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy consumables and utensils to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es madre soltera, tiene 40 años, vive con sus 4 hijos: Luzdelia de 23, Fredy de 18, Susana de 15 y Maria de 12. Se dedica a la producción y venta de chompas, hace ya 17 años, gustándole mucho su trabajo, ya que si algo sabe hacer muy bien Julia es el tejer, labor que aprendió de su madre, la cual desde muy pequeña la motivó para que aprendiera este oficio, que hoy en día es su principal fuente de ingresos. A Julia se le hace muy rentable su negocio, ya que por cada chompa cobra un aproximado de 25 soles y produce en gran cantidad, trabaja durante casi todo el día, siendo lo más difícil de su trabajo el no disponer de tiempo para realizar otro tipo de actividades, pero a Julia que esta acostumbrada al trabajo duro esto se le hace un problema mínimo, ya que lucha por un motivo muy grande....su familia. Este es su primer préstamo en microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero que solicita prestado ella comprará mayor cantidad de lana para aumentar la producción de chompas y por ende, generar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Julia is a single mother, she is 40-years old and lives with her 4 children: Luzdelia is 23, Fredy is 18, Susana is 15 and Maria is 12. She is dedicated to the production and sales of sweaters and has enjoyed this job for that past 17-years as it is something she knows how to do well. Julia learned to knit from her mother, when she was little she was motivated to learn this trade, which today it is her main source of income.

For Julia this is a very profitable business, as each sweater costs approximately 25 soles which she produces in large quantity. Sometimes she will work all day and feels that it is very difficult work to complete things timely when she has other activities to do. Despite this, Julia is accustomed to working hard to minimize problems as she fights for a great cause – her family. With this first loan from microfinanzaz PRISMA, she will purchase a large supply of wool to produce sweaters to generate more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more wool for her shop.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena G. S. tiene 51 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias al Éxito II  y vive en la calle Spelucín Mz 10 lote 13 del Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz I del Puerto de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió  hasta segundo año de primaria y ya no continuó estudiando por falta de medios económicos, debido a que sus padres eran muy pobres.
Se casó a los 15 años y actualmente tiene 5 hijos, los 5 casados, con ella viven 3 nietos debido a que sus padres se encuentran trabajando en el extranjero.
Elena vende cerveza, gaseosa y alquila cuartos, tiene diez cuartos alquilados a trabajadores del puerto, los cuales le pagan para que les cocine la cena que no la tienen como pensión. Su negocio es en su casa.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas con ese préstamo empesó a comprar la cerveza y la gaseosa.
Con este crédito de 2000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará material para arreglar sus cuartos, como mesitas de noche, colchas, etc.
Sueña con construir un gran hotel.
texts.en:
Elena G. S. is 51 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Empresarias al Éxito II” and lives at Spelucín Mz 10 lote 13 in the Asentamiento Humano Auraora Diaz I neighborhood, Puerto de Salaverry city, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed second year of primary school but didn’t continue with her studies due to lack of money as her parents were very poor. She married at 15 years of age and today has 5 children, all are married, and 3 grandchildren live with her as their parents are working abroad. Elena sells beer, soda pop and rents rooms. She has 10 rooms rented to port workers, who then pay her to cook dinner as that is not included in the rent. Her business is located in her home. Her first loan for 300 soles was repaid in 4 payments and she bought beer and soda pop. With this loan for 2000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy materials to fix up her rooms, such as nightstands, bedspreads, etc. She dreams of building a great hotel.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furnishings such as tables and bedspreads for rooms she rents

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es: La señora Wendy Jamileth S. López habita en el barrio América tres, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene la edad de 22  años, se encuentra casada, donde se esposo se desempeña como albañil. Actualmente se  dedica de enfermara, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a  esta actividad, ella en un futuro desea preparase mas en su profesión, de manera que le pueda dar la oportunidad de ir mejorando su nivel de vida, además gracias  a los créditos que AFODENIC le ha proporcionado le a permitido ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda, donde actualmente esta solicitando el monto de C$ 12,000.00 aun plazo de 12 meses, para comprar materiales de construcción y componer una habitación de su casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Wendy Yamileth S. L. lives in the town of America Tres, a town in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is 22-years old and is married; her husband works as a mason. Today, she is dedicated to helping the sick. Wendy has been working in this capacity for the past 5 years and hopes to pursue this profession further in a manner that will improve her quality of life.

Moreover, she is grateful to AFODENIC for allowing her to little by little improve her home. Currently, she is applying for a loan of C$12,000.00 to repay in 12-months to purchase construction materials to build a room her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to repair a poorly built room.

loans.name: Flor Yusselina

texts.es:
La señora Flor Yusselina  tiene 37 años,  pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Elena II y es la presidenta, vive en Mz A 27 lote 21 Manuel Arévalo II etapa, distrito de La Esperanza provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió Enfermería Técnica, pero no ejerce porque se casó y tiene tres hijas que aun son estudiantes.
Flor tiene una bodega donde vende abarrotes y verduras, que las consigue en el mercado mayorista La Hermelinda y en el mercado Nazaret de Manuel Arévalo, su negocio lo realiza en su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas compró arroz y azúcar para implementar su bodega.
Con este crédito de 900 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará abarrotes, gaseosa y cerveza.
Flor sueña con ver profesionales a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Yusselina is 37 years old and is a member and the president of the Santa Elena II Communal Bank. She lives at Mz A 27 lot 21 Manuel Arévalo II section, district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied technical nursing, but she doesn’t practice it because she got married and has three daughters who are still students. Flor has a general store where she sells groceries and vegetables, which she buys at the La Hermelinda wholesale market, and in the Nazaret de Manuel Arévalo market. Her business is in her home. With the first loan of 300 soles ($100), which was repaid over 4 months, she bought rice and sugar to stock her general store. With this loan of 900 soles ($300), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy groceries, soft drinks, and beer. Flor dreams of seeing her daughters become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products (groceries), soft drinks, and beer

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica Magalis  M.  Q.  habita en el barrio 22 de enero, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 24 años de edad, se encuentra casada, donde su esposo se desempeña como cajero, la señora verónica  es docente de primaria, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella junto con su esposo han venido trabajando con mucha dedicación para mejorara su vivienda, donde han contado con la ayuda que AFODENIC  les da al proporcionarles créditos para mejorar su casa,  solicito un crédito para dar inicio a las mejoras a su casa de habitación, actualmente  la señora Verónica esta solicitando para continuar realizando mejoras a su vivienda el monto de  C$ 12,000.00 aun plazo de 12 meses para comprar materiales de construcción  y componer el techo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Veronica Magalis M. Q. lives in the town of 22 de enero, a neighborhood located in the capital city of Manauga, Nicaragua. She is 24-years old and is married; her husband works as a cashier. Veronica is a primary school teacher and has been at this profession for the past 5 years. Together, she and her husband work with much dedication to improve their standard of living. Today, they ask for AFODENIC’s assistance for a loan to improve their home. The loan will get them started on improving their residence. Veronica is now seeking to improve her home with a loan in the amount of C$12,000.00, to repay in 12-months. This will go towards purchasing construction materials and the formation of a new roof.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc for home improvement.

loans.name: Capullo De Rosa Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five very excited people! They come from the group "Capullo De Rosa". Each member is living in extreme poverty and feels like starting their own business could be a way to break cycle of poverty.

Jacquelin is the representative of this group and was chosen because of her strong nature. She is only 23 years old but wants to change things early in her life. She says she wants to be able to provide for her kids and family someday. She currently has a small business selling clothes.
